story:
Luciano Lu - River of Cultures

(Please scroll on video for more on my story and for audio samples of my music!)

(PORTUGUÊS - No terceiro video (acima) eu conto minha história inteiramente em Português!

 

Overview 

I am an independent musician and music educator in Canada. Originally from Brazil, I share my music with a passion for my home country's traditional cultural pool where a mix of Indigenous, West African and Mediterranean European influences merge into surprising uplifting manifestations. 

I have been a freelancer/ contract worker both in the art education as well as in the performing arts sectors for over 17 years in Canada. This year's events have pushed artists all over the world to either transition into virtual economy or to forgo their art and look for labour jobs. As a musician and composer, recording my music is the foremost important step in this transition and the fact that I have the opportunity and time to do it now, makes me immensely grateful! With your support I am going to not only be able to pay for regular costs of editing and mastering this album, but also to take the whole project to the next level!

 

Where are the funds going?

Total project budget: $15,000

Personal investment (inheritance): $7,500

Estimated Costs:

$4,000 recording assistance editing and mastering costs - (done remotely) 

$3,500 going directly to invited (featured) artists and session musicians.

$3,000 towards my professional accordion (with a trade-in)

$2,000 for pressing 200 vinyls

$1,000 for merchandise and gifts costs

$1,000 in press and advertisements for the campaign and album launch. 

8% of pledges goes to Indiegogo (transaction processing and hosting)

 

Who are the musicians?

In my musical journey I have met countless talented musicians of all walks of life, styles and cultural backgrounds. For several years I was immersed in the Brazilian percussion and world music scene in Toronto, Canada, and in this community I count with several mentors and talented friends who have influenced my path in major ways. One of my objectives with this album project is to feature some of these relationships in different tracks, creating a cross pollination of cultures and strengthening bonds in a time where the music community is devastated. Rather then having these artists help me with "favours", I would like to be able to offer them an honourable pay for their participation in my album project! Among those confirmed to be featured in this album are: Flavia Nascimento (Quebec/Belo horizonte), Alexandre Garnizé (Rio), Riquinho Fernandez (Quebec/João Pessoa), Maninho Costa (Toronto/Rio), Hassan El Hadi (Toronto/Marrakesh), Sergio Chocolate (Toronto/Recife), Chris Butcher (New Orleans/Toronto) Jean François Lapierre (Gatineau, QC), Wise Atangana (Ottawa/ Cameroon), Andy Gamper "Red Lion" (Huntsville, ON), Bill McBirnie (Toronto). 

 

Who is my producer?

Six years ago I had the rare chance to record one song with a phenomenal musician, multi-instrumentalist and producer from the North East of Brazil, Betinho Muniz (titled "Poder da Graça" on videos above). Since then I have been dreaming of doing a full album with him!! Now that independent music education contractors and performers like me are but stalled, and everything has gone remote, I am jumping on this chance to record over distance, and in fact we have already started! With Betinho Muniz on board there's no waiting around, he works fast and gets things done! That is why I know the album is coming one way or another!

 

 

My goo' ol' accordion needs desperate help...

One last piece of my puzzle relates to the passing of my father a year and a half ago... He was an amateur accordion player and was the single inspiration for all my accordion studying and playing, and even the better accordion I have I owe it to him. Since his passing I have done a deep dive into the accordion learning his repertoire and generally improving my skills, and I can't get enough... In his honour I'll be including one of his unpublished solo accordion pieces. It's like a crowning both for him and me!! SO excited!! However, one challenge remains that you can also help me with.... my accordion is a vintage that is in need of a lot of repair and restoration like a lot of old things... only accordion repairs in Canada cost your face... So I am considering trading my "old friend" in and purchasing an upgrade so that I can record with a clean (better tuned etc.) sound and of course for the prosperity of my accordionistic adventures!! So, part of this fundraiser is also going towards this piece of the puzzle, and again it makes me so happy and grateful to count with your support!!

 

What can you expect of "River of Cultures"?

Expect an album (and singles released along the way..) by spring 2021, with a lot of love and hope for our world, deep cultural roots, a trunk of mature community relations, wild fusional branches, creative colourful sounds like foliage responding to flocks of birds singing and playing above! Intertwined with this creation of many moons are the members of my elastic family, YOU, who with incomparable generosity weaves a safety net of support that will keep humanity's creative artistic spirit alive!!

I'm inviting YOU to come on this journey with me and be part of this story.

If you can't contribute today, I totally understand! I have been there! So I ask you to please help me get the word out and make some noise about my campaign.

Feel free to use the Indiegogo share tools!

Much love and strong health to you!

story:
Hi folks!

 

I am fundraising to give YOU the opportunity of a lifetime to come with me into a 'famous northwest London recording studio' and make a Christmas Record with me as part of my choir!

 

The amazing thing about this is:

- You don't need to be able to sing

- You don't need to be able to act

- You don't even have to be there in person

- AND MOST OF ALL, you cannot get into this particular studio for love nor money without being there on recording business. And trust me, you want to be there :)
 

You will be:

- ON THE RECORD which will receive radio promotion in the UK and beyond

- IN THE MUSIC VIDEO we will shoot on the day in the iconic and highly recognisable studio room

 

And you will get:

- A christmas hat to keep (wearing it in the video is mandatory ;))

- Lunch in the studio canteen (you never know who might be around)

- An entire afternoon at the studio recording, filming, being photographed, followed by drinks

- Professional pictures of you in the famous studio room, and in front of the entrance to the studio to keep

 

If you are international: I will post you the same hat, and want you to send in a pic or short video of you (or your cat) in it, and we will edit it into the video so it will be as if you are with us on the day!

Who is this for?

You. For music fans, for history fans, for people who want to support my music and have fun at the same time. For people coming as a family, with friends, or solo supporters - you will all be made very welcome and led through the day by my coordinator. For people who want a day they will never forget, and a video to prove it! We will have all ages and demographics represented, and I've set aside 5 discounted places for people who can't afford the full fee but really want to be part of this too (just drop me an email on saskia@saskiagm.com).

 

Listen to the demo here: 

https://youtu.be/glWOKxN8BX8

 

You'll be joining in on the choir part at the end, ooh' ahh's and 'you'll find it, don't worry'

It will all be taught to you on the day, and isn't much to remember!

 

Why am I doing this?

 

For fun. 

 

To bring an exciting new single and video out, to answer your many requests to come into the studio with me (which I was unable to do in my last project), and to offer EVERYONE the chance to be part of this. I'm going above and beyond for you guys this time!

 

When is the recording day?

 

Nov 18th. Save the date, book your hotel, train, flights etc.

Arrival 1-2pm in the canteen. Recording, filming, photography till 6pm, optional drinks in the canteen till 8pm latest.

 

What should you do now you've read this?

 

Join us right away by backing this project!

Places are limited to 35, and given the nature of this I wouldn't be surprised if they all go rather quickly.

This is a once in a lifetime opportunity to do something thrilling, and to make some memories that both you and I will not only treasure forever, but also have audio, video and photographic proof that it took place!

 

Quick note to folks:

 

This project was actually designed by you guys when I asked what you wanted to do, and I've tried to make it as accessible as possible so that everyone can join in! And if you are NOT one of the fans who know me and helped design this, then all you briefly need to know is that I'm a British singer-songwriter, and I have dedicated my life to creating music and creating joy. The rest can be found on my website: www.saskiagm.com

story:
IM MAKING A NEW ALBUM OF POSITIVE MUSIC - AS A RESPONSE TO THESE TIMES.


These are bonkas times huh? After 1.5 years of lockdowns & being confined in our houses...going quietly insane - I feel we all need some RELEASE! I feel some POSITIVE HIGH VIBE MUSIC is very much needed in these times - as a remedy & antidote to whats going on.

During these lockdowns - Ive been writing Songs. Songs about these times. Songs putting words - to the many feelings we've all been experiencing during this difficult time. POSITIVE songs. Healing songs. Inspiring songs. High-Vibe songs!

I really want to RECORD these songs - & to make a beautiful funky positive healing Album - & offer it out to the world at this time. To bring the vibes to the people so to speak.

CAN YOU HELP US?

We're asking people - to help make this album happen... Without you guys - the music doesnt play!

SO - HERE'S THE PLAN.

Me & my beautiful band - Rowan, Tristan & Sunny - want to head into a top-notch studio to record these new Songs... but we don't got the money!!

So we are humbly & sincerely asking YOU - to help us create this Album... by supporting us by picking a 'Perk' from the (rather cool) list below - & bagging yourself in advance a copy of the album, & in this way - helping us raise the money to create the Album.

We wanna record an album of the most AMAZING UPBEAT POSITIVE FUNKY MUSIC for you guys... for the Planet! For people to dance like loons to - to release to, laugh to, to cry to, make love to, To have everything your feeling about these tricky times - soothed & made good by this album. 

Without you - the music doesnt happen!

What We Need - & What You Get...

We need to raise £5000. Thats our aim. That will pay for the album to be made. & made well.

You can pick any 'Perk' that pricks your fancy - & we get started on creating this baby...

Ie - Your donation CREATES this Album. You get to BE A PART OF IT.

We then go into the studio - take vid cameras etc - & Get Creative. Do our stuff. & then post out 'behind the scenes' Vids of us making the music in the studio to you - so you can come on a journey with us & feel like you are in the the studio too...

We make the Album - and when its ready - we send out your 'PERK' to you - which will of course - include a copy of the complete Album.

Which is called 'Sacred'.

 

I have chosen a White Lion - as the cover of this Album, becuase White Lions represent Power, enlightenment, & Personal SOVEREIGNTY!  

& We want to make a POWERFUL Album...  

We feel these times are calling for it.

We want this Album to MAKE A DIFFERENCE. Its been an extraordinarily tough time for all of us - this year of covid & endless lockdowns...

  & we want our music to speak about these times - & to touch people... to help them EMPOWER, AWAKEN, RELEASE... so that we can all move on - & start creating a BETTER, more positive future for this planet...

 

We're heartily excited about this Album. The songs are good! Super upbeat. Sacred songs. Songs of hope. & change. of Lion Power!!

The vibe will be Reggae - meets Soul - meets World - meets dub - meets folk - meets Sacred music.

A blend.

 

We love to feel like there are good people - who 'get' this project - who are with us... part of this little journey. TOGETHER we are Stronger...

So - please help us out & Pick a Perk - from the list there on the right:

& every penny donated will help us make this project come into existence. 

 

We want the world to be a BETTER PLACE - as a result of this Album.

THANK YOU  THANK YOU  THANK YOU  

 

YEAH!

LETS GO!!!

 

Blessings

Bob, Rowan & Tristan (the band)

 

P.s

PLEASE BE AN ANGEL & SHARE THIS CAMPAIGN! 

Help us out & RAVE about it to everyone you know! 

 

WE LOVE YOU.

story:
Short Summary

Singer-songwriter Timothy Cloverleaf (aka Timothy Cloherty) is an accomplished songwriter and producer having performed on the Conan O'Brien Show and had music videos on MTV. He has music with both SONY Music publishing and RONDOR Publishing and has recorded albums and EP's with ALMO Sounds (Geffen) and HiFi Recordings. 

After having toured North America and the UK with The Rake's Progress in the 90's he began producing music for television and film and started other projects including then bands Booga Sugar and 50 Shades of Green. 

Weaving traditional folk instruments with his pop sensibilities he crafts his songs into beautifully sad stories that you can sing along and dance to. 

What I Need & What You Get

The home studio is good for some of the demoing and even some of the overdubs but studio time in a professional recording studio is expensive between 500 and 1000 per day. I'll be looking to find the best deals and rates I can find to keep the costs within my budget. I'll be looking to get a studio for 500/day.
After the original studio tracking sessions I'll be working for the most part in the home studio for overdubbing where necessary. I'll need about 4500 for extra studio time and upgrades to get this sounding as professional as possible. 
Mixing will be about 100/day and about a day per song. I'll be hoping to have between 13 and 16 songs for the album. So somewhere between 1300 and 1600.
CD post production and duplication will cost around 2900 for the first 1000 CD's and that will include digitally downloadable MP3's from various music download sites in perpetuity. 
WHAT YOU GET... are my beautiful songs available for your listening pleasure! Plus all donors will be thanked in the liner notes of the physical CD art work. (And you'll have that warm hearted feeling of philanthropic pleasure for your generous gift that will last you till the next world). AND I've arranged for a few perks.

The Impact

People around the world will be able to listen to these wondrously enchanting songs eventually enlightening the masses to bring about global euphoria. Especially if we can get beyond the CD and duplication phase and into radio promotion!

Challenges

As funding comes in I will chip away at the demos and early recordings for the album and start rehearsals for the special guest musicians and singers. I expect that it will take approximately 2 months to finish recording the tracks and another few weeks for post production and CD duplication. After that there will be time to start getting promotional materials together and get started on publicity and maybe even radio promo! 

I have opted in to inDemand so if I raise over the amount necessary to finish the recordings I will put the extra monies toward promotion and publicity. 

Publicity and radio promotion can figure in the range of 20-25 thousand so lets dream big!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't afford to contribute you can help spread the love through social media,  websites and just plain old word of mouth. I appreciate all and any effort in whatever way you can help and I thank you in advance. THANKS!

story:
Hi Y'all,

I'm Spike Gillespie, a writer, wedding officiant, and meditation teacher in Austin, Texas. I have had the great fortune of having two of my books funded by successful crowd funding campaigns, including my most recent meditation memoir: Sit. Stay. Heal. Now I'm back to ask you for your help in realizing a vision I have had for many years. It has been my dream to create a space for people to gather in the name of love and healing. Recently it was brought to my attention that a lovingly handcrafted tiny chapel, made of all salvaged materials, is available. This amazing building, known as the Forget Me Not Chapel, is the perfect manifestation of what I have envisioned. I would like to purchase it, move it to Austin, and use it as a place for weddings, funerals, meditation classes, writing classes, meditation camps for kids, and sanctuary for those healing from grief, most especially those who have lost children. 


Currently the chapel resides in Luling, Texas. It was made with tremendous love and deep thoughtfulness by Brad Kittel. Mr. Kittel is the creative genius behind many tiny structures, all of which he builds from salvaged materials at Texas Tiny Houses. The Tiny Chapel features many incredible details. Click here for a cool video tour of the building. 

I took a drive out to visit the chapel recently and when I stepped inside my heart sang. The vibe inside is stunning. It really is the perfect space to gather together community to celebrate weddings, memorialize those who have passed, listen to live music, do healing writing, and quietly meditate. 

Many of you know I have been meditating for a very long time. Meditation has brought so much healing to my life, which used to be very chaotic and punctuated with ongoing bouts of depression and darkness. The meditation has lifted me to a place where I have gratitude every day, even on my shitty days. To experience such profound alleviation of suffering has moved me tremendously. It is my life goal and calling to help others learn how to alleviate suffering. I am always so honored when I am invited to be useful to others in this capacity and share the knowledge I have been fortunate enough to acquire on my journey.

Up above I mentioned a desire to dedicate some of my time and the sanctuary of this space specifically to assisting those who have lost children. For reasons I cannot know the universe has brought into my life so very many friends who have lost children. Many of them have attended my writing workshops as they work to find some sense in the senselessness of such profound loss. These friends have taught me so much about life. In their honor I plan to offer free writing workshops to those in the early grief stages, to help them get some steady footing on the path to Life After Loss. 

While this building is a chapel, it is important to me to emphasize that I am non-theistic with strong Buddhist leanings. Thus the chapel will not be used to speak to a particular religion or god and it will never be a place for proselytizing. It will be open to all regardless of belief or non-belief in one super entity or another. My feelings about higher powers and spirituality can be best summed up courtesy of the lyrics of Iris DeMent who wrote, "I prefer to let the mystery be," and Chrissie Hynde who wrote in the song Message of Love:  "Now the reason we're here, as man and woman, is to love each other, take care of each other." 

Message of Love. That is the foundation of the Forget Me Not Chapel. That is the work that will be done in the space. I need your help to make this happen. Any donation at all-- even a dollar-- would be so very much appreciated. The chapel is $59,000. I am asking a bit above that to cover the cost of moving it to Austin.

Thank you so much to everyone who has encouraged me. My gratitude is bottomless. 

Love,

Spike

Risks and challenges

This is a very short campaign to raise a significant chunk of change. The brevity of the campaign is because there will quite possibly be others interested in buying the chapel and so I need to move quickly. Mr. Kittel has agreed to give me a little time to crowd fund the acquisition of the chapel, for which I am grateful. But I really need help getting the word out.

The other concern is finding the perfect landing spot for the chapel. I am currently researching property that will be properly zoned so that I can operate it commercially for weddings and funerals. I have a couple of potential spots lined up. Mr. Kittel is willing to hold the chapel on his property until I acquire a suitable location for it, which I anticipate could take up to six months, though hopefully won't take that long. Ideally I will find a property where I can both live and operate the chapel, which will mean selling my current home to make that happen. However I am also looking into land leases. Don't worry-- the perfect location will present itself. I am certain.

story:
Short Summary

We intend to take a van load of drum kits around the UK and help autistic children women and men, disengaged, disenfranchised and lost people have access to them.

Drumming is an art form.  It's also a massive release of stress, energy and confusion.  By allowing access to drum kits for all kinds of people around the UK we hope to promote the magic of a natural solution to problematic situations for various people . . . .

  • Autistic and ADHD/Aspergers children AND adults
  • Ex Soldiers
  • Disengaged and disenfranchised youths
  • Reformed prisoners
  • people with backgrounds linked to abuse
  • People with disability of any form

My names Micky Sheehan.
I have an autistic son and I myself was recently confirmed on the spectrum with ADHD/OCD.
I have played in bands for 20 years.  Mainly as a vocalist and guitarist, more recently as a drummer.
I own my own music venue and recording studio.  I have connections all over the world in the music industry and have worked alongside some of the biggest and best musicians and names going.  My love of drumming comes mainly from being able to lead a band, but also because I can get FREE FROM THE STRESSES AND STRAINS OF MY DEMONS.  Yes, we all have them, you tell me about them after an hr of smashing some drums to bits!!!!!

What We Need & What You Get

Here's what I need to roll this out:

  • I am aiming to raise £3000.
  • I myself will be investing £15,000 in a van
  • £3000 gets me all the drumkits I need [15] and stuff like sticks to give the people after they have played the drums, promo, website, priniting, etc etc

The Impact

I feel my scheme will have the following impact;

  • A complete release from the stresses and strains felt by disengaged people of all ages, races and social strata
  • Bringing together communities.  I hope this can roll out to community centres in all areas helping the users of these centres to engage and realise they have a unique connection with each other through music
  • I also intend to present this to the medical council of England & Wales as an alternative to prescription drugs, especially for children.
  • Also, the more drummers we create, the more bands will form.  The quicker x factor is off your screen!

Risks & Challenges

There are no risks.  I'm going to do this with or without this funding.  But.  I would love to be able to look back on this and thank a community of interested people who can be proud that they may have solved a problem for someone in another city or country just by donating the price of a pint to All Drummers Have Demons

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't help financially . . . . 

  • share and support us through social media
  • offer support in your local town by organising an event
  • please pass on this information to anyone you may know who can help

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Hello, thank you for checking out our fund raising page. I hope you watched the videos and checked out the band a little, but if not read on for a brief round up of what we do and how you could help.

Mark Pontin Group - Formed in 2010, a blues/rock band from Swansea, South Wales, UK. First album released 2013, 'Days Of Destiny', to great critical acclaim, and acknowledged by 5 nominations in the 2014 British Blues Awards, becoming finalists in two categories, 'Emerging Artist' and 'Blues Song Of The Year'.


All of this done without record label, management, or any financial backing.

Walter Trout describes us as 'A Kickin' Band'.

Pete Feenstra Get Ready To Rock blogger/dj/promoter says 

"A welcome breath of fresh air to the blues rock genre'

So thats what we achieved, and we are very proud and grateful for the support we received along the way. Now we come to a crossroads that could see us break out onto the UK,European and even International stage.


When the time came to record the follow up to 'Days Of Destiny', we knew that we would have to surpass to progress. Attention to detail, especially from a songwriting sense was imperative. All of us involved in Mark Pontin Group work full time as musicians. But not full time in Mark Pontin Group solely. To fund recording albums, touring and promotion we work hard playing weddings, functions, cabaret and anything musical we can do. This is very difficult to maintain in the current economic climate, with the first thing to go in a cash strapped world being entertainment. Witness the countless bars and clubs, music venues and festivals shutting down altogether in the last few years. 

Its often the case that people assume that because you are touring, or selling merch/cds then you must be making money. Unfortunately the music industry has altered considerably and whilst its great for independents to be able to get their music heard, its not so great for them to earn money enough to sustain or even break even. Funding usually comes out of their own pockets, or if they are lucky, financial backing. Touring most always at our level, involves LOSING money, as you need to get to be a good draw audience wise to attract either good ticket sales, or a good promoter to back you.

Its a catch 22. We need the gigs to sell the CD's. We need them to raise our profile. But we need a raised profile to get the gigs.

One way to attempt to combat this is to use PR. A good PR firm with good contacts can get magazine interviews, radio play, newspaper articles etc. 

But, you guessed it, this costs money.

So as an up and coming band, we need to -


Fund our equipment, transport, websites, promo, rehearsals, advertising, recording costs, video costs, cd duplication, artwork,touring costs etc and now... PR too.


So we have worked hard to pay for all the above, with the exception of PR. 

Our resources are exhausted, even Mark's beloved 1961 SG Reissue was pawned to pay for extra studio time for Textures. Yes, harsh reality! Ironically Mark was recognised in the Cash Generator queue...


If this was a 'Dragons Den' type scenario our investment would be all of the above. We have brought you a great first album, which many people have enjoyed on Spotify (10,000 plays and counting) and at our shows. Trouble is, Spotify and similar pay us just $18 for those plays, and the gigs usually cost us money right now too.


With your help we can change that. With your added investment, we can push the new album 'Textures' out into the greater musical world, to gain the exposure that would push the band to the next level, allowing it to be self sustaining, allowing the shows to progress and allowing us to reach new audiences too.

So why should you invest in us? Your hard earned money is just as important? Too right! We agree 100%. 

For us we believe that 'Textures' NEEDS to be heard en masse. For all fans of blues rock, guitar and good songs. We wrote the album as if it was something WE would buy and cherish. Its done with a nod to some great albums of the past, and in a way that albums used to be made. Albums used to be ART. All too often these days, you get GREAT guitar players, and not so great songs. Or GREAT songs but poor production. Or GREAT guitar,songs, but poor vocals. As a band we have collectively listened to hundreds of thousands of hours of GREAT music, and our goal was to utilise some of the ingredients of those great albums into 'Textures'.

We made sure the songs were crafted and presented well. There isn't a weak song on the album. Every one has its own merits.

We made sure we have several radio friendly songs, with big hooks, but still blues rock. 

We made sure the production is top notch, maintained a traditional feel, but is contemporary and would appeal to fans new and old.

We made sure only the best takes made it through. We spent our money ( and pawned our instruments ) to get more time in the studio to get it just so.

We made sure the artwork is ART work. All done in house, all pictures, design everything.

So have a listen to our preview video. Its 12 minutes long, I know, but if you're thinking of investing, you need to KNOW, right?

We are not asking for a fortune. Just a little boost to help us out. £1500 is our goal, and if we get more then great.


The money will be used to promote Textures via PR. This will raise awareness of us, the album, the songs etc. With this profile raising we can secure more decent work, further advance the band along the road to becoming a self sustaining unit that doesn't have to pawn their instruments, or doesn't have to 'go on after the purple monsters' at caravan parks ( as useful as they have been..).

You also get a hand in pushing some great music, and you get the just deserved feeling of satisfaction that you contributed whole heartedly to this.


But wait, we don't want your money for nothing ( or your chicks for free...). No,no,no..

You can blag yourself a whole load of EXCLUSIVE goodies, including some prized instruments, guitar lessons, show tickets etc etc. CHECK THEM OUT !!! You won't be able to get these offers anywhere else...


For more band info or if you would like to contact us go to 


www.markpontingroup.com


THANK YOU !!!

story:
Short Summary

Adara Rae & The Homewreckers are releasing their debut album and we need your help! From years of vigorous songwriting in the solitude of Adara Rae's bedroom, to the practice rooms of her project with her band the homewreckers, to the streets and stages of Tucson Arizona, these tunes are finally ready to hit the airwaves and come to you. We are looking to raise money to help fund the release, promotion, and tour that will coincide with the coming of this first album and we truly appreciate any and all forms of support and donations from the fans and even some generous strangers! We will be touring parts of the west coast in November and hope to have a successful advertising campaign set in motion for the album once we are out on the road as well as have the funds needed for the tour itself.

What We Need & What You Get

 CD Printing & Packaging: $2,500
PA (Sound System) needed for the tour: $4,500
Transportation Costs (Gas, Spare Tires, Etc.): $1,000
ALL OTHER FUNDS GO TOWARDS PROMO
Promoting and advertising this album could have an unlimited budget, but we will take whatever we can get! The more money we get the better the album can be promoted, higher level publicists can be hired, features can be found in more magazines and websites, etc. 
Make sure to check out our awesome perks for your donations!

Other Ways You Can Help

This isn't all about the money! If you can't donate then just help us spread the word!

story:
Short Summary

Skin Deep is my very first full length album!  It is a 10 song R&B compilation of 9 original songs, and one cover of a song that my uncle wrote.  This album has been years in the making and I am SUPER excited to be almost done recording all of the vocals at Electrokitty recording studio in Seattle!  I have JUST recently got the final mixes on five of the songs for the album! I have 5 to go and could use your help!!  Here is a PREVIEW link to what we are working with so far!!!

SoundCloud SNEAK PREVIEW

What I Need & What You Get

This round of funding will apply to the following:

  • The album needs to be mixed, mastered, and printed out to CD, and the first run of "Skin Deep" merchandise to be printed.
  • We are also working on a music video for this first round of funding to be released shortly before the CD release party which is planned in January!
The following is a breakdown of where the money will go!
  • The first $2,500.00 goes to complete mixing of the project
  • The next $3,500.00 goes to mastering the project!
  • The following $1,600.00 goes to duplication to CD
  • The next $2,000.00 goes to Merchandise first run
  • The final $2,900.00 goes to the FIRE music video and choreography
In addition to this funding project, I am also raising funds by doing house concerts and small gigs around town.  Please contact me if you have any interested in hosting an event!  molly.hardin@hotmail.com
By contributing to this project, you will receive various rewards depending on the perks you select!  I am working with some dancers and a choreographer for the CD release party and music videos, so STAY TUNED for updates on that exciting endeavor!!!  :)

The Impact

By pitching into this project you are helping get a FANTASTIC work of art out to the public!  Your contributions make all of this possible!!!

Risks & Challenges

After having one successful Kickstarter project, I have been through a number of hurdles in the process of CD duplication and all that goes into it!  I feel like I am much better prepared for all of that this time and have given myself an adequate timeline to accomplish all of my goals!  This time I have asked for the actual cost to get the project done.  If I do not meet my goal, I will be filling in the rest myself.  This project has been 10 years in the making, and it is my absolute pleasure and honor to share it to all of you!  :)

Other Ways You Can Help

PLEASE get the word out!!  Tell ALL YOUR FRIENDS!!!  Share this on Facebook, Twitter, Text your friends, call them up!!  Please let everyone know!!  Any questions, email me directly!  molly.hardin@hotmail.com!!!  NAMASTE!!!!
story_txt:
Short Summary Skin Deep is my very first full length album!  It is a 10 song R&B compilation of 9 original songs, and one cover of a song that my uncle wrote.  This album has been years in the making and I am SUPER excited to be almost done recording all of the vocals at Electrokitty recording studio in Seattle!  I have JUST recently got the final mixes on five of the songs for the album! I have 5 to go and could use your help!!  Here is a PREVIEW link to what we are working with so far!!!
SoundCloud SNEAK PREVIEW   What I Need & What You Get This round of funding will apply to the following:  The album needs to be mixed, mastered, and printed out to CD, and the first run of "Skin Deep" merchandise to be printed.
We are also working on a music video for this first round of funding to be released shortly before the CD release party which is planned in January! 
The following is a breakdown of where the money will go!

The first $2,500.00 goes to complete mixing of the project

The next $3,500.00 goes to mastering the project!

The following $1,600.00 goes to duplication to CD

The next $2,000.00 goes to Merchandise first run

The final $2,900.00 goes to the FIRE music video and choreography


In addition to this funding project, I am also raising funds by doing house concerts and small gigs around town.  Please contact me if you have any interested in hosting an event!  molly.hardin@hotmail.com

By contributing to this project, you will receive various rewards depending on the perks you select!  I am working with some dancers and a choreographer for the CD release party and music videos, so STAY TUNED for updates on that exciting endeavor!!!  :)   The Impact
By pitching into this project you are helping get a FANTASTIC work of art out to the public!  Your contributions make all of this possible!!!   Risks & Challenges  After having one successful Kickstarter project, I have been through a number of hurdles in the process of CD duplication and all that goes into it!  I feel like I am much better prepared for all of that this time and have given myself an adequate timeline to accomplish all of my goals!  This time I have asked for the actual cost to get the project done.  If I do not meet my goal, I will be filling in the rest myself.  This project has been 10 years in the making, and it is my absolute pleasure and honor to share it to all of you!  :)
Other Ways You Can Help
 PLEASE get the word out!!  Tell ALL YOUR FRIENDS!!!  Share this on Facebook, Twitter, Text your friends, call them up!!  Please let everyone know!!  Any questions, email me directly!  molly.hardin@hotmail.com!!!  NAMASTE!!!!

story:
Simple folk songs. 
No barriers. 
No walls. 
Open sky songs. 
Cosmic folk songs.

ABOUT "ASH STREET"

"Ash Street" is already recorded. Analog. Straight to tape. Straight into the board. The old fashioned way. In Austin, TX. Each song goes with the other. They tell stories. They are what happened when I decided to leave town and live with words. They were written on a porch on the corner of Ash Street and 16th Avenue in Portland, OR.

It is a new style of folk music never heard before: I call it "Cosmic Folk." 

THE PLAN:

  • 1,800 for mastering of the tracks. Have the studio lined up already.
  • 500 for physical product.
  • 200 for one piano song that will be mixed & mastered & released separately, by itself.
  • Self-released once completed. 
  • This is the first step toward a larger goal: I will use this album as a way to engage more fully with the folk community, making contacts, and finding entry into folk festivals like Kerrville, DS Songwriters Festival, and SW Regional Folk Alliance a year from now. I believe this community of folk musicians is most closely aligned with what I do and I hope to start the process of becoming a part of it.
  • It is not a commercial success. It is not trying to be. 


PAST CAMPAIGN SUCCESS:


  • The previous Kickstarter campaign was a success. I gained college and community airplay around the country with "She Wasn't Doing Nothing, Just Standing On The Balcony" from the album I We Us Are Was Were Is. 
  • In addition, I've had several instrumental songs used on cable networks. One feature film, "On The Road", used "I'm Gonna Love You Anyway" in a pivotal scene. It had a limited run in major cities and is now on DVD.
  • "Division", an EP, was released. 
  • I've taken this experience and decided to raise funds again to get another album out into the world in order to become more fully involved within the larger folk community around Central Texas. The play here is not for radio or television airplay primarily, but to have an album I can confidently put in the hands of people who dig folk music to start a longer conversation.

CAN'T HELP FINANCIALLY, BUT WANT TO HELP?


  • Get the word out, if you'd be so kind. 
  • Hook me up with ideas for contacts within the folk community for my next steps.

story:
Our story

Hey folks! We are here together - Jon Kenzie and Trukitrek Puppet Company - to announce some great news. 

Do you remember the HANG ME ON THE LINE music video? 

This was the first video we did  together and it was very successful (https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=HRy27c9ffTg). 

Now, a new Jon Kenzie album is coming out, and we'd like to start a new experience and produce an amazing video for you. 


What We Need & What You Get

This project can only happen with your help. For us to do things well we need to work with professionals and special equipment. So if you’re a fan of our work, it’d be great if you could support our project. 

We have a goal of $3800. Your contribution is very important to us. 


Nice Perks for You

We have some nice perks for everyone who helps us. You can view them over on the right.


Other Way You Can Help

Another way you can help us is sharing this campaign to the world. 

Please share it!!!

story:
MindsEye

Hard rock and progressive metal from North Carolina. We're here to bring something new along with something familiar to the musical table. No matter what we do, our lives will always revolve around music. Coming from different musical backgrounds, each of our trio adds something different to the mix.

Check out a song from the album on SoundCloud!

https://soundcloud.com/mindseye-4586156


What We Need + What You Get

We're releasing our first album early 2016.
Many bands use IndieGoGo as a platform to raise funds for recording, mixing, mastering etc. However, we've already done that for you.
The album is finished and is waiting to be released.
By using IndieGoGo, we're giving you all a chance to pre-order the album the way you want. We have many tiers lined up with tons of extras.
Some of these extras won't be offered any other times, so now's your chance to claim what you want!
We're releasing this album no matter what, but with your help, we can have an even more successful album debut. The more we raise, the more physical CD's we can have pressed, and the more extras we can include.

Other Ways You Can Help!


Got an idea for a perk you'd like? Let us know, and maybe we'll add a new tier!

Share this page with your friends, co-workers, or anyone who likes music!
You can also find us on:
Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/mindseyemetal
Bandcamp: https://mindseyemetal.bandcamp.com (Will be launched in February!)

story:
Background

You know The Messiah. But do you know The Christmas Story? The Baroque master Heinrich Schütz wrote a Christmas tale of unsurpassed beauty, and we've got a production that brings it to life.

The Plan
On December 26, The Weckmann Project, Musica Nuova, and Long and Away viol consort will perform the Schütz Christmas Story (Weihnachtshistorie) at First Church Cambridge, with music direction by Jeffrey Grossman and stage direction by Julia Mintzer. This beautiful work is not often performed due to the varied instruments required and the difficulties of engaging an English-speaking audience with a German-language work. 

We will show you a Christmas Story full of theater. Our staging brings out the universal human experiences of this tale: birth, fear, joy, death, promise. At our first collaboration in 2014, some 300 people from diverse backgrounds joined us. In fact, our children's concert was so popular that kids and families are again welcome to this year's afternoon performance - and children under 10 are free!

What We Need & What You Get

This campaign directly supports fees for artists, who are taking pains during the holiday season to devote the time and care that this complex production requires.

We are keeping ticket prices low to welcome families and as many people as possible to this rarely-heard masterpiece. But it's a financial risk for our companies, and it means we must turn to you to help make this production possible. In return, please enjoy one of our musical perks - and more! - as thank you gifts. 

What if we don't make our goal? Liza and Amanda will waive their fees to pay the 30+ other artists involved. But if we exceed our goal and hit $7,000, Liza will dress up like Schütz and serenade passersby in Davis Square - that's priceless!

Why This Project? 

Artist-led projects like this hold the promise of building a sustainable future for classical music. This endeavor creates opportunities for artists and attracts an audience outside of traditional concertgoers. Besides, people like us! We were selected as a holiday feature in the Boston Globe, and last year we were recognized as an innovative ensemble with a grant from Paul R. Judy Center for Applied Research.

Other Ways You Can Help

The success of this campaign rests on small donations, but you can also:

  • Buy a ticket. Only $25/$15 and free for kids! Purchase now by clicking here.
  • Spread the word about this campaign and the concerts. 
  • Volunteer as an usher, front of house, ticketing, and production help - please email us if you'd like to see the show for free and lend a hand!
* PS, it's true, last year we were calling this The Christmas Oratorio. It's the same work, but The Christmas Story is more true to the original title.

story:
Have a listen to the demo!

This album is roots music. It's meant to reconnect us to our common origins and the collective human experience we all share. It's meant to remind us that we aren't as different as we all too often believe ourselves to be. 

I've been fortunate enough to enlist the assistance of Brady Blade (Bob Dylan, Emmylou Harris, Daniel Lanois, et al) as producer for the album. recording has already begun and we're hoping to have everything ready to mix & master by January 2016. 

Since everyone involved is a professional within the music industry, the project requires funding in order to reach a place appropriate for the effort involved. The amount we're asking for is quite modest considering it will cover recording & production, mixing & mastering, and some basic marketing. 

...and here's where you come in. This is my first outing with Crowdsourcing and I'd like to think it will work to help me achieve my goal. Prove me right :)

Thanks!

-Frank

story:
Short Summary

The United Tribulation Choir is not your ordinary R&B Gospel group. Fostering a message of hope and inspiration, UTChoir is dedicated in their quest to unite and empower communities with their R&B-influenced take on Gospel music.

The Montreal-based choir was founded in 2007 by two exceptional men: Brothers Gift and Paul Tshuma. Together, they carry with them years of experience as artists, in addition to their academic backgrounds in jazz music and theory.

Drawing together talented individuals from different walks of life, the UTChoir performs both original and cover songs. They are strong supporters of diversity and extend their reach by singing in multiple languages and performing in a broad array of styles.

The UTChoir was ultimately founded with one goal in mind: to bring about change in local communities and around the world. This goal can only be achieved with your help, by funding our project, it will enable us to cover mixing/mastering costs, graphic designing, as well as CD distribution/duplication costs, which will allow the album to be shared with the world!!

What We Need & What You Get

We have completed tracking the album without incurring any studio costs, thanks to Concordia University for allowing us to use their studio equipment FOR FREE!!  The majority of funds raised will go towards various aspects of the production: mixing and mastering the music, which allows the tracks to sound concise and balanced. The other portion will go towards the printing of hard copies of the album and distributing the music through Itunes, Spotify, Amazon Mp3, Google Play ect., promotion, and paying the musicians, singers, videographer and graphic designer. All of those who contribute to this campaign will receive great perks!!! If we do not achieve the goal, whatever is raised will go towards mixing/mastering costs first. If we happened to go over our goal, we would be able to use the extra money to pay volunteers who contributed to the production.

The Impact

By donating to this campaign, it will allow us to share our music with the world!! Our songs are sung in multiple languages, carrying a message of hope, love and faith, in which we believe the world is in need of.

Risks & Challenges

Life always throws curve balls, creating an album is never an easy feat, there are always setbacks whether it be finances, musicians or singers falling sick, not being able to book a wheelchair accessible studio, ect. all these challenges are part of the journey, they encourage us to work harder to achieve our dream

Other Ways You Can Help

Those who can't contribute financially to this project, can still make an impact by sharing this campaign with friends and family!! This can be done through Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Email etc. Please use the Indiegogo sharing tools on this page to make it easier.

story:
A "Sentimental Journey"

Our Indigogo Campaign is over but we are still in need of funds if you would like to help our volunteer musicians with their financial expenses.  Mail your Tax Deductible donation to:

Minidoka Swing Band Japan Tour                              PO Box 86310                                                       Portland, OR  97286

In observance of the 70th anniversary of the end of WWII, the all-volunteer and not-for-profit Minidoka Swing Band will be performing a concert tour in Japan November 6-16, 2015. We will be sharing an important part of Japanese American history through educational narration, pictures and music to the cities of Tokyo, Yokohama, Iwaki-city, Minamisoma, Gotemba and more.

Based in Portland, Oregon, the Minidoka Swing Band educates and preserves an important period of Japanese American history. Through our music we reach out to groups and organizations and share what the people of Japanese ancestry on the west coast of the U.S.A. endured during WWII.

The Minidoka Swing Band (MSB) is under the umbrella of the Portland Japanese American Citizen's League (JACL) which preserves the culture and values of Japanese Americans and develops understanding between all social and ethnic groups.  The Minidoka Swing Band and its educational message represents all Americans. Our planning team has already put in almost two years of planning to secure our Japanese venues and plan the itinerary.

Contributors to our campaign will help our volunteer musicians with the $100,000 expense of traveling to and staying in Japan while we share WWII Japanese American history with the Japanese. We want to help Japanese citizens understand the suffering that Japanese Americans endured during WWII when they were imprisoned behind barbed wire in isolated incarceration sites surrounded by armed guards. Despite this unjust incarceration of parents and families, young Japanese American men felt the ambivalent compulsion to choose between their ancestral country and their new homeland. Many chose to enlist in the American military, serving with distinction in the 100th Infantry Battalion, the 442nd Regimental Combat Team and the 522nd Field Artillery Battalion. Education and awareness is the best way to prevent this type of imprisoned injustice, “hard choices” and the other tragedies of war from recurring in the future.                          

           

What We Need:

We need your support and donations! The Minidoka Swing Band and its 23 members is composed entirely of volunteers who donate their valuable time and talent to share the history of WWII Japanese American Incarceration through music of the era and music that was popular inside the incarceration camps and played by imprisoned internees. Your donation to our educational tour throughout Japan will help all band members cover the cost of transportation and lodging in Japan. 70% of our band members are over 65 or retired. Four families in the band have 2-4 family members that are musicians in the band.

Our hosts in Japan will be donating the venue sites for our performances and the Minidoka Swing Band will receive no compensation for their performances in Japan. With your help we will be able to cover our expenses for airfare, lodging, meals and transportation while in Japan so that we can share our educational mission statement.  

We all know that the citizens of Japan suffered greatly during WWII and we want to share with them that Japanese Americans suffered as well. We are the last  surviving generation that has had personal experience inside the incarceration camps. 

Three of our Minidoka Swing Band members were actually imprisoned during WWII when they were young, along with their families.  Our band leader, Larry Nobori, a retired music instructor from the Portland School District and an accomplished classical and jazz musician was incarcerated as a baby in  the Jerome Relocation Center. Our lead female vocalist, Nola Sugai Bogle, was incarcerated in the Minidoka Relocation Center as a young child and our lead male vocalist, Henry "Shig" Sakamoto was incarcerated as a teenager in the Minidoka Relocation Center.  Many of our other band members had parents, grandparents and other family members imprisoned in several other incarceration sites around the USA. 

                                                       WWII Japanese American Relocation Camps.

On February 19, 2011 the Minidoka Swing Band was honored to play at the Oregon Nikkei Endowment reception for "An Intimate Dinner with George Takei" at the Portland Marriott Downtown Waterfront Hotel. I have included a very nice email I received from Mr. Takei regarding the evening:

"Dear Laura,

I was transported to my boyhood imprisoned in two U.S. internment camps at that memorable evening (two weekends ago) at the reception for the Oregon Nikkei Endowment. Our barrack was just across the way from the mess hall at both camps. So, one of my cherished memories from those years is that of the music that wafted over on Saturday nights from the mess hall after my mother put us to bed.

The music of the 40’s that I heard from the Minidoka Swing Band sounded so familiar and sweet. That was the music of my boyhood. That was the sound that I loved. And it was brought back to me so marvelously that evening in Portland. My appreciation and gratitude goes to those talented musicians for keeping a dulcet part of a dark experience so melodically alive.

My thanks to you and the talented musicians for the great work that you are doing.

Warm regards,

George Takei                                                                                                  http://www.georgetakei.com/

The Impact: 

Our project will use music, pictures and narration to help everyone understand and remember the injustices of the Japanese American Incarceration during WWII.

The Minidoka Swing Band has performed throughout Oregon and Washington and we would like to reach out to other citizens of the world who were also deeply affected by the tragic events of WWII.  We want to prevent any group of people from suffering and being unfairly imprisoned because of prejudice, discrimination, and war hysteria.  

Who is our band?

The Minidoka Swing Band consists of 17 musicians and 4 vocalists who play and sing such big band tunes as “All of Me," “American Patrol," "Boogie Woogie Bugle Boy," “Moonlight Serenade," “Sentimental Journey," “Tuxedo Junction,"  and many more. 

  

We play at celebrations, festivals, libraries, conferences, remembrances, weddings, concerts in the park and at many other venues across the Pacific Northwest. The Band operates entirely on donations, honorariums from performances, and some grants. Our musicians range in age from 16 to 88 yrs. old. Resources are spent for practice space, equipment, music, and minimal travel reimbursements.

     

The Minidoka Swing Band has been recognized by TV, magazine and newspapers.  Stories and articles have included the front page of the Wall Street Journal (New York), an Emmy - nominated story by KING TV5 Evening Magazine Program (Seattle, Washington), the National Newspaper of the JACL Pacific Citizen (Los Angeles, California), and many more local newspapers around the Portland - metro area. Two of the Minidoka Swing Band’s musical recordings were used in the nationally broadcasted documentary about music in the WWII Incarceration camps, “Searchlight Serenade,” produced by KEET - TV Public Broadcasting (Eureka, California)


[Guest vocalist Frances "Chickie" Ishihara White, incarcerated at Minidoka]   (photo: Sam Greene, KEET-TV)

How can you Help and what do you get? 

You can help by making a Tax Deductible donation to our fundraising campaign.   You will receive a receipt for your donation.  Our tax EID is 20-1116631.

For donations of $50 and up we will send you one of our Minidoka Swing Band CDs for helping us on our journey.

Other perks, depending on the size of your donation include:  

  • Your name on our web site as a Contributor
  • Your name as a Bronze, Silver, or Gold Sponsor on our website
  • Your name as a Platinum or Platinum Plus sponsor on our website, promotional materials and our printed Program in Japan
  • A free 2 hr. concert for your company, special event, or for you and your friends!



Executive Order No.  9066:  

In 1942, President Roosevelt signed Executive Order No. 9066, and between 110,000 and 120,000 Americans of Japanese heritage who lived on the West Coast of the United States were given one week’s notice to leave their homes, businesses and possessions. Japanese Americans spent almost four years behind barbed wire; armed guards in towers ensured that prisoners did not escape. The Band shares this history through the big band swing music that was popular at that time. This music was played inside the camps by some professional and non-professional musicians who where incarcerated, mostly young teens. As quoted by 91-year-old George Tsugawa, a former prisoner at the Minidoka Incarceration Camp, “Every weekend we looked forward to the music and dancing. We loved to swing dance and loved the music and loved the socialization it afforded us. It gave us something to look forward to and took our minds off our living situation. Your band brings back such wonderful memories of a bad place.”

Risks & Challenges:

As a volunteer band, members have been donating a lot of their own time and money to share the story of the Japanese American Incarceration. An overseas trip will be a financial hardship for some, especially the retired seniors and the families with multiple members in the band. We would be most grateful for your financial help in defraying some of the costs of this ambitious venture.

We plan to work hard this summer on our Indigogo fund raising campaign. If you can help us get over our $25,000 goal, that would be even better! We are also coordinating several smaller fundraisers to help with the projected $100,000 expense of helping 21 volunteer musicians and 2 volunteer managers travel abroad. 

Other Ways You Can Help:

If you can't contribute money, you can still be a huge help to our campaign by getting the word out to everyone you know. Reach out through your email networks, Facebook, Twitter, Linked-In and face-to-face too!  Thank you so much for taking the time to check out our Minidoka Swing Band campaign.   We appreciate you and all your help!

Be sure to view our English web site at  http://minidokaswingbandjapantour.blogspot.com/ 

and our Japanese language web site at                              http://minidokaj.blogspot.com/

Japanese Language promotional video:                           https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ryVCFlYWic8&feature=youtu.be

Full length promotional video (English):                   https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=f3TZ2d9cYgw

                                                                                 Thank you!  - The Minidoka Swing Band

The Japan World Exposition 1970 Commemorative Fund
story_txt:
A "Sentimental Journey"
Our Indigogo Campaign is over but we are still in need of funds if you would like to help our volunteer musicians with their financial expenses.  Mail your Tax Deductible donation to:
Minidoka Swing Band Japan Tour                              PO Box 86310                                                       Portland, OR  97286
In observance of the 70th anniversary of the end of WWII, the all-volunteer and not-for-profit Minidoka Swing Band will be performing a concert tour in Japan November 6-16, 2015. We will be sharing an important part of Japanese American history through educational narration, pictures and music to the cities of Tokyo, Yokohama, Iwaki-city, Minamisoma, Gotemba and more.

Based in Portland, Oregon, the Minidoka Swing Band educates and preserves an important period of Japanese American history. Through our music we reach out to groups and organizations and share what the people of Japanese ancestry on the west coast of the U.S.A. endured during WWII.






The Minidoka Swing Band (MSB) is under the umbrella of the
Portland Japanese American Citizen's League (JACL) which preserves the culture
and values of Japanese Americans and develops understanding between all social
and ethnic groups.  The Minidoka Swing Band and its educational message
represents all Americans. Our planning team has already put in almost two years
of planning to secure our Japanese venues and plan the itinerary.

Contributors
to our campaign will help our volunteer musicians with the $100,000 expense of
traveling to and staying in Japan while we share WWII Japanese American history
with the Japanese. We
want to help Japanese citizens
understand the suffering that Japanese
Americans endured during WWII when they were imprisoned behind barbed wire in
isolated incarceration sites surrounded by armed guards. Despite this unjust incarceration of parents and families,
young Japanese American men felt the ambivalent
compulsion to choose between their ancestral country and their new homeland.
Many chose to enlist in the American military, serving with distinction in the
100th Infantry Battalion, the 442nd Regimental Combat Team and the 522nd Field
Artillery Battalion. Education and awareness is the best way to prevent this
type of imprisoned injustice, “hard choices” and the other tragedies of war
from recurring in the future.                          
           
What We Need:

 
We need your support and donations! The
Minidoka Swing Band and its 23 members is composed entirely of volunteers who donate their
valuable time and talent to share the history of WWII Japanese American
Incarceration through music of the era and music that was popular inside the
incarceration camps and played by imprisoned internees. Your donation to our educational tour throughout Japan will help
all band members cover the cost of transportation and lodging in Japan. 70% of our band members are over 65 or retired. Four families in the band have 2-4 family members that are musicians in the
band.
Our hosts in Japan will be donating the venue sites for
our performances and the Minidoka Swing Band will receive no compensation for their performances in Japan. With your help we will be able to cover our expenses for airfare,
lodging, meals and transportation while in Japan so that we can share our educational mission statement.  
We all know that the citizens of Japan suffered greatly during
WWII and we want to share with them that Japanese Americans suffered as well. We are the last  surviving generation that has had personal experience inside the incarceration camps. 
Three of our Minidoka Swing Band members were actually imprisoned during WWII when they were young, along with their families.  Our band leader, Larry Nobori, a retired music instructor from the Portland School District and an accomplished classical and jazz musician was incarcerated as a baby in  the Jerome Relocation Center. Our lead female vocalist, Nola Sugai Bogle, was incarcerated in the Minidoka Relocation Center as a young child and our lead male vocalist, Henry "Shig"
Sakamoto was incarcerated as a teenager in the Minidoka Relocation Center.
 Many of our other band members had parents, grandparents and other family
members imprisoned in several other incarceration sites around the USA. 

                                                       WWII Japanese American Relocation Camps.

On February 19, 2011 the Minidoka Swing Band was honored to play at the Oregon Nikkei Endowment reception for "An Intimate Dinner with George Takei" at the Portland Marriott Downtown Waterfront Hotel. I have included a very nice email I received from Mr. Takei regarding the evening:
"Dear Laura,
I was transported to my boyhood imprisoned in two U.S. internment camps at that memorable evening (two weekends ago) at the reception for the Oregon Nikkei Endowment. Our barrack was just across the way from the mess hall at both camps. So, one of my cherished memories from those years is that of the music that wafted over on Saturday nights from the mess hall after my mother put us to bed.
The music of the 40’s that I heard from the Minidoka Swing Band sounded so familiar and sweet. That was the music of my boyhood. That was the sound that I loved. And it was brought back to me so marvelously that evening in Portland. My appreciation and gratitude goes to those talented musicians for keeping a dulcet part of a dark experience so melodically alive.
My thanks to you and the talented musicians for the great work that you are doing.
Warm regards,
George Takei                                                                                                  http://www.georgetakei.com/

The Impact: 
Our project will use music, pictures and narration to help everyone understand and remember the injustices of the Japanese American Incarceration during WWII.
The Minidoka Swing Band has performed throughout Oregon and Washington and we would like to reach out to other citizens of the world who were also deeply affected by the tragic events of WWII.  We want to prevent any group of people from suffering and being unfairly imprisoned because of prejudice, discrimination, and war hysteria.  

Who is our band?
The Minidoka Swing Band consists of 17 musicians and 4 vocalists who play and sing such big band tunes as “All of Me," “American Patrol," "Boogie Woogie Bugle Boy," “Moonlight Serenade," “Sentimental Journey," “Tuxedo Junction,"  and many more. 

  
We play at celebrations, festivals, libraries, conferences, remembrances, weddings, concerts in the park and at many other venues across the Pacific Northwest. The Band operates entirely on donations, honorariums from performances, and some grants. Our musicians range in age from 16 to 88 yrs. old. Resources are spent for practice space, equipment, music, and minimal travel reimbursements.

     

The Minidoka Swing Band has been recognized by TV, magazine and newspapers.  Stories and articles have included the front page of the Wall Street Journal (New York), an Emmy - nominated story by KING TV5 Evening Magazine Program (Seattle, Washington), the National Newspaper of the JACL Pacific Citizen (Los Angeles, California), and many more local newspapers around the Portland - metro area. Two of the Minidoka Swing Band’s musical recordings were used in the nationally broadcasted documentary about music in the WWII Incarceration camps, “Searchlight Serenade,” produced by KEET - TV Public Broadcasting (Eureka, California)

[Guest vocalist Frances "Chickie" Ishihara White, incarcerated at Minidoka]   (photo: Sam Greene, KEET-TV)
How can you Help and what do you get? 


You can help by making a Tax Deductible donation
to our fundraising campaign.   You will receive a receipt for your
donation.  Our tax EID is 20-1116631.
For donations of $50 and up we will send you one of our
Minidoka Swing Band CDs for helping us on our journey.

Other
perks, depending on the size of your donation include:  

Your name on our web site as a Contributor
Your name as a Bronze, Silver, or Gold Sponsor on our
     website
Your name as a Platinum or Platinum Plus sponsor on our
     website, promotional materials and our printed Program in Japan
A free 2 hr. concert for your company, special event, or for you and your friends!

Risks & Challenges:

be most grateful for your financial help in defraying some of the costs of this
ambitious venture.
We plan to work hard this summer on our Indigogo fund raising campaign. If you can help us get over our $25,000 goal, that would be even better! We are also coordinating several smaller fundraisers to help with the projected $100,000 expense of helping 21 volunteer musicians and 2 volunteer managers travel abroad. 
Other Ways You Can Help:
 If you can't contribute money, you can still be a huge help to our campaign by getting the word out to everyone you know. Reach out through your email networks, Facebook, Twitter, Linked-In and face-to-face too!  Thank you so much for taking the time to check out our Minidoka Swing Band campaign.   We appreciate you and all your help!
   Be sure to view our English web site at  http://minidokaswingbandjapantour.blogspot.com/ and our Japanese language web site at                              http://minidokaj.blogspot.com/Japanese Language promotional video:                           https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ryVCFlYWic8&feature=youtu.beFull length promotional video (English):                   https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=f3TZ2d9cYgw                                                                                 Thank you!  - The Minidoka Swing BandThe Japan World Exposition 1970 Commemorative Fund

story:
Why Opera NEO is Important to my Growth

This summer I have the incredible opportunity to return to Opera NEO, an operatic training program, in San Diego, California. While there last year I was able to participate in performances of the Magic Flute as Papageno, sing in the Cabaret night and most importantly study with voice teacher Braeden Harris. As many of you know last summer was important to me because that was when I made the decision to switch to tenor. I can say with certainty that without the help of the staff at Opera NEO I would not have had the same level of success that I am having today. That being said, I still have a long way to go in solidifying my "new voice." I very much believe that returning to Opera NEO this summer is going to get me to where I need to be vocally. 

Information about the Recital

Join Daveed and pianist Michal Schmidt for an afternoon vocal recital to help him raise money to attend Opera NEO this summer. 

The program will be Deux Melodies Hebraïques by Ravel, 6 Songs from a Shropshire Lad by George Butterworth, L'horizon Chimerique by Fauré and Dichterliebe by Schumann

Rebecca Ergas has graciously let us use her house for the recital. The address is 346 Wyldhaven Rd. Bryn Mawr PA 19010 and will be held on on Sunday July 12th at 2:00 PM. 

What is Opera NEO?

Opera NEO is an up and coming young artist program based in San Diego, California. They have offered me unique opportunities to:

  • Perform the role of Vogelsang in Mozart's "Impresario" 
  • Participate in masterclasses and professional development workshops 
  • And most importantly my continued studies with voice teacher Braeden Harris who was instrumental in my recent switch to Tenor repertoire. 

The Impact

I was fortunate enough to attend Opera NEO last year where I was able to sing the role of Papageno in Mozart's "The Magic Flute" and study with voice teacher Braeden Harris. While there I was able to work with a highly supportive team of professional musicians who were both knowledgable and professionally connected. This year I hope to strengthen these relationships and:

  • Identify and refine my new tenor audition repertoire.
  • Continue to gain positive ground in my transition to Tenor.
  • Strengthen my stage craft through opportunities in the main stage operas, cabaret performances and outreach performances.

Donations

Although Opera NEO provides professional standard performances it is first and foremost a training program and therefore has expenses associated with it.  There is no fixed admission fee for the performance but there is a suggested minimum donation of $50 per group. However, donations of any quantity will be accepted and much appreciated. Those who are unable to attend the recital but donate $25-$50 will receive a recording of Dichterliebe and those who donate $50 or more will receive a recording of the entire recital. The donations will go to cover the costs of:

  • Opera NEO Tuition
  • Cover recital expenses 
  • Air Fare 
  • Dining Expenses

Thank you all so much for your time, I really hope you all can attend! 


-Daveed

story:
Short Summary

Tongue Tied Twist of Fate is a five song album being recorded at Nightsound Studios in Carrboro, North Carolina. Original grooves. Laid back jazzy-pop. 


  • I've currently invested about $560 of my own money in it so far.
  • The Carrboro / Chapel Hill scene is ripe for my style of music.
  • Word on the street is that people enjoy what I create.
  • Tongue Tied Twist of Fate will be submitted to various music festivals, songwriting contests, night spots, and coffee houses in the US. Upon completion of the project, I plan to tour the states and play.


Your contribution will go towards the successful creation and marketing of an album of my original music.



Where the funding goes...

Your contributions will serve in the following function:

  • $600 = foundation recording of guitar and vocals (5 songs @ $120 / song)
  • $600 = preliminary mixing fee (just guitar and vocals 5 songs @ $120 / song)
  • $750 = band fees (drum, bass, sax @ $50 / song x 3 piece band)
  • $400 = final mixing fee (add drums, bass, sax)
  • $150 = marketing and production
  • Total = $2500


The Impact

Any contribution that you make will serve in a number of ways:

  • First and foremost: Exposure. By sharing your involvement with Tongue Tied Twist of Fate, others will build on the momentum that you are helping to create and likewise become involved. 
  • I feel as though the messages in my songs are of positivity and love, themes and concepts that are not often heard enough by the public. 
  • Finally, as a former teacher, I hope to demonstrate to my students whose lives I touched over the years, that dreams DO come true, but only with hard work, tenacity, and through the help of involving others. 



Risks & Challenges

Certainly there are risks and challenges involved:

  • The greatest risk involved is that no one will like my music. However, I feel that there is a niche for what I have to create. I have been consistently playing open mics and various gigs around Carrboro and the response is largely positive.
  • In order to appeal to the greater collective, my intention is to continue to play at various music venues, learning covers, and collaborating with other like-minded artists in the area to expand my knowledge and skills. 


Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't monetarily contribute, there are still opportunities for you to help:

  • Share my indiegogo video on your social media site!
  • Share my YouTube videos on your social media site!
  • Spread the word to your friends and family!
  • Send good vibes and positive thoughts our way!


THANK YOU SO MUCH FOR YOUR INTEREST AND CONTRIBUTION!!!!!!!!

story:
Welcome our project! Enjoy watching and learning about its origins below, but keep in mind this phase of the campaign is now closed and can no longer receive funding... however...  

We would love it if you can help us fund the next leg of this fascinating journey, so when you're done here, please click on this link for the latest news regarding the recording sessions in April 2015, and how we plan to publish the songs, both digitally and in the form of a beautiful 8X11 book:  

 http://igg.me/at/RobertFranzPhaseTwo

*******************************************************************

I'm excited to introduce the world to an amazing songwriter who spent most of his life in 1800s Germany, crafting meticulous little gems of song... and yet, very few people have ever heard of him!

The goal of this project is to put Mr. Franz back on the map, with both live and recorded performances of his best songs. 

Here are the details: In addition to singing professionally in NYC and elsewhere, I also love teaching. A new student named Rita Greenstein asked me if I'd ever heard of Robert Franz. Nope. She then showed me an old, frayed songbook: a collection of 50 of his art songs. Rita played through a few of the songs, and reading over her shoulder, I sang the vocal lines. It wasn't long before I was hooked! The question, "How come nobody knows these amazing little songs?" came up again and again. 

There are compelling theories as to why Franz isn't as famous as some of his colleagues. One possibility is that he never wrote anything "big," like a symphony or opera. Others think his name alone was problematic to critics of the day ("Just whom is he trying to emulate? Schubert? or Schumann?"). Others think his songs are too short; and even others speculate he was a reticent guy who avoided self-promotion.  

Whatever the reason for Franz's falling into obscurity, the proof of his brilliance is in the songs themselves. He evidently pored over them, never wasting a single note, until they became concise, beautiful masterpieces. No two are alike.  

Your contributions will fund the following:
-Recording fees, including a producer, sound engineer and additional pianists;
-Graphic design for the CD cover and booklet;
-CD duplication and digital publication on iTunes and other media;
-Filming of the recording sessions for future use in an upcoming project.
-Fees to create liner notes for both the CD book and digitally;
-Fees associated with producing recitals in four US cities in the late spring  of 2015.

Learn the latest news about who's joined our team and more, here:

http://igg.me/at/RobertFranzPhaseTwo

story: Hi guys. I decided to create this campaign in order to get help with buying an equipment for my future productions, to be exact I want to buy quality studio monitors, nice headphones and of course good audiocard. I don't expect that many people will contribute, but I hope that some will. Yes, I don't promise any extraordinary release like many others do when they start such campaigns, but I can promise different releases in future, most of them as usual will be free to download. If you like my music and you want it to become better than ever before then this campaign is totally made for you.

story:
Darkstarz Records has been contributing real hip hop to the fans for years. We work hard on every project and have given many projects out for free to help stop the dissimulation of Hip Hop. As an independent label we have paid for many projects on our own from hard worked money from our daily jobs. Our goal is not money or fame but to keep the real essence of hip hop alive so our children may have a chance to experience it like we did.


The radio has taking away the true essence of hip hop. Everyone complains about the lack of hip hop but there is no real support from the people who love hip hop. Our goal is to stop that thought and take action by offering real hip hop for a small donation of your choice. Either way we will still release the album but we need your support to spread our project to the masses.

Unlike other projects we are not asking for you to pay for features or other things. We are asking to show your support for a real message that hip hop can live and continue to stay strong. Choosing one of our options can help us. Even if you decide not to give us a donation and want to spread the word to others. That is very supportive and helps us to spread the raw sounds of hip hop to the world. We are looking to use the money from your pledges to fund some of this project so we can press up Cd's of our album and send a true message.

Get to Know who we are. We are " DSR" . Feel free to Download our Past Projects and You will Notice we Offer Our Projects Mostly as Free Downloads. http://darkstarzrecords.info/music

Feel Free to Visit our site at http://darkstarzrecords.com
