We work hard on every project and have given many projects out for free to help stop the dissimulation of Hip Hop. As an independent label we have paid for many projects on our own from hard worked money from our daily jobs. Our goal is not money or fame but to keep the real essence of hip hop alive so our children may have a chance to experience it like we did.The radio has taking away the true essence of hip hop. story:
“Traveling is not just an activity, it's the art of broadening your vision through the priceless experience.” 

― Wayne Chirisa 



Did you enjoy the music video?  Cool.  We enjoyed making it!  Want our new song "We Owe You The Truth" FIRST for as little as $1?  Excellent.  Keep reading.

Greetings.  We are the Small Town Titans, a hard rock power trio from York, PA, and we keep things simple.  We write songs by jamming in a basement together using guitars, drums, our voices, and occasionally the harmonica.  If we can't do it live at a show, we don't put it on a record.  We have been working hard saving all of our money earned from shows and merch sales for several years all over PA, NJ, MD, and VA.  We are ready to tour all over the USA and we are finally taking this next crucial step in our career.  There's one problem.  It's really, really expensive.  We're not kidding and we can prove it to you with spreadsheets.  Everyone loves spreadsheets.  But first here's a picture to show our excitement upon purchasing our baby, Delores, on 11/11/14 - National Metal Day \m/ \m/.  Ben couldn't make it because he was working.  Bummer.


 So, we aren't signed to a record label and we don't get any outside support financially whatsoever, except from what we receive from you, the fans.  We have saved as much money as humanly possible over the last three years in order to do this.  We are showing you, the fan, exactly what we need below.  We've even included links where we can to show you where we got our expense amounts from.  

And if you're wondering where this money is mostly likely going (whether we hit our goal or not), we can pretty much assure you it's a gas tank.  We recently purchased a 1995 Ford E-350 diesel shuttle bus (see excited Phil and Jonny with Delores in photo above).  Filling that up is going to be soooo much fun!  

If you know what crowd funding is, feel free to skip this paragraph.  Our perks are to the right.  If you don't, it's simple.  We are asking for a donation from you, and the more you give the more you get in return from us.  You can contribute as little as $1 and we won't complain.  Every dollar counts.  You can also donate $2,500.  We will definitely not complain there either.  For $1 you get our new single INSTANTLY via email before it's official release.  Indiegogo has made it as easy as can be to share this page with all of your friends with their handy sharing tools you'll see on the page, so use 'em!  

And now for the perks! As you'll see to the right, almost all of these perks stack, so if you donate $10, you get a one of a kind acoustic EP, and the single.  If you donate $25 you get an exclusive shirt, the acoustic EP, and the single, and so on.  Some other cool stuff we're doing this time around include but are not limited to:
- Doing a shot of beer in honor of every name who donates and filiming the whole thing. Yep.  Every donation earned means this video will be a bit more hilarious. 
- Selling a live acoustic EP exclusively through this campaign
- Exclusive t-shirts and hoodies with YOUR name and tour dates on the back (like THESE, see the side bar of perks for all the info):






- Show memorabilia (signed broken sticks, strings, drum heads, posters, etc.)

- Phil will give you a page from his journal (you've been warned)
- Jonny will make you a custom shirt like the ones he has been wearing recently at gigs
- Ben will draw you a flip book telling tales of the band (even WE can't wait to see these so DONATE!)
- We'll play in your living room
- We'll professionally record a song you wrote
- and of course MORE!

And now, the moment you've all been waiting for.  Spreadsheets.  Here's some screenshots of all the money we still need (oh joy!).  We've also included a link to this Excel spreadsheet so you can actually click the links within and see we are telling the truth!

Click HERE to see our full tour expenses spreadsheet.



Our last campaign for our record "From Fight To Flight" was a resounding success and we can't thank our fans enough for it.  We can only hope to hit our goal once again by giving back to you, the fan.  This dream ends before it even begins without every single last one of you.  We take pride in sharing our journey as a band with as many of you as we possibly can.  So let's do this together.  You help us and we will give you everything we can in return.  

So...Are You With Us?  Then spread the word using the hash tag #AreYouWithUs. If you scroll to the top of this page and click the gallery tab, you'll find official social media pics you can use to help spread the word about this campaign along with us. We'll see you on the road. :-)

- STT

P.S. 

If you have any questions, please email sttareyouwithus@gmail.com.  Thanks!

So...Are You With Us?  Then spread the word using the hash tag #AreYouWithUs. If you scroll to the top of this page and click the gallery tab, you'll find official social media pics you can use to help spread the word about this campaign along with us. We'll see you on the road. :-)

- STT

P.S. 

If you have any questions, please email sttareyouwithus@gmail.com.  Thanks!

story:
Short Summary

My name is Stephanie Williams, and I have been working towards an opera career for the past 11 years. I have been training, performing, and competing in the United States since 2006. Having a professional operatic career is something I have dreamed about since I was young. Performing is a passion of mine, and I want to share that joy with others. 

I am planning to attend the The 17th Imrich Godin International Vocal Competition IUVENTUS CANTI 2014 will take place on on April 20-24, 2015 in Vráble, Slovakia. In addition to this competition, I'm planning to assemble a marketing package, including photos, video, and audio recordings to send to 50+ opera companies. the year. This campaign will also help fund the auditions. 


What I Need & What You Get

This campaign will fund the following aspects of starting my career:

  • Training an coaching for the competition as well as for the auditions later in the year.
  • Travel, accompanist, and entry fees for the international competition and for the national auditions.
  • Fees associated with sending out marketing materials to national opera companies (postage, printing, recording, etc)
  • If I don't reach my entire goal, these funds will still go towards my career, I will find a way to supplement the remainder of the money needed. 

What do you get?

Perks include a thank you on my career website, mailed thank yous with photos, a copy of my demo CD, and tickets to a thank you concert.

Risks & Challenges

Pursuing a career in opera is scary, and difficult. It can take years to build a lasting career. I'm hoping that with your help, I can begin this journey, and hopefully come out successful.


There is no guarantee that I can succeed, but I have years of training and performing experience that give me a head start. I will continue to audition and compete, even after this first year. I have the determination to see this through.

Other Ways You Can Help

I understand if you can't contribute. There are other ways you can help me though. Share this campaign with others. The more people the see it, the more chance I have of reaching my goal!


Thank you!

story:
Hello Everyone!

Do you believe you have a great taste in music? Prove it with MSIB. Do you want to find the newest underground artists, or just want some new music? Do it with MSIB. Want to be a popular musician, but need a good way to promote your music? Do it with MSIB.  

We are team MSIB, and our goal is to launch the newest music website: MSIB. MSIB, short for My Song Is Better, is a music website made to support underground musicians. We have 4 different tabs (Rock, EDM, Hip-Hop, and Indie) that will be updated instantly when new music or news appears. We also have a ranking system that will rank the music we post, and a calendar that will keep you updated on upcoming concerts. Sounds like any other music blog, right? We didn't stop there.

MSIB is not just a blog that posts music and news - it's a utopia for music lovers. On MSIB, users will be able to "battle" their music. By this, we mean that users will be able to pick songs, that they either created or just love, from popular music streaming websites such as Soundcloud. Once this is done, this user will be paired up with another user with the same style of music. 

Our visitors, A.K.A. "the crowd", will be able to listen to each song being battled and vote on the one they enjoy most. However, the crowd can do more than just sit, listen, and vote on a song. While they're voting, they can also surf our/other websites whenever they'd like while they're voting. 

Users will also be able to see how superior their taste in music is compared to the rest of the users on MSIB with our leaderboards. The leaderboard will rank everything on our website such as (and nowhere near limited to) the following: Most played tracks, popular musicians/musician's music, and users that won/lost the most amount of battles. There will also be rankings on the genre tabs for things such as the most popular song or trending concerts. Our leaderboards feature will provide data of the most popular music and musicians that's based off our visitors instead of the typical data that has been flawed by marketing tactics. 

We will also add a social media type of feature to our website. On MSIB, users will be able to follow other users. By doing this, they can read up on what songs they are listening to, listen to their favorite songs, read text posts that they post, chat, and much more.

The best part about MSIB? It's FREE. That's right. Our goal is to promote underground musician's, not to make money off of them. To kickoff our website, we are hosting a tournament. We have over 100 different underground musicians competing, and the winner receives a shot to make their dreams come true. By supporting MSIB, you are not just supporting the 6 people on our team, you are supporting underground musicians from all over the world that need help reaching their dreams. 

Artists competing on our kickoff tournament will receive a chance to gain spotlight on our website, other popular music blogs, different labels, and different artists. Joining the tournament is completely free! If you are a musician that would like to join, or has questions about the tournament, please email us at MySongIsBetter@gmail.com!

Donations of all sizes are greatly appreciated! Can't donate? Sharing our crowdfunding campaign is just as helpful!

Thank you!

-Team MSIB

story:
Short Summary

You already know that hearing is one of the five senses that allows us to perceive sound. Hearing impairment, or hearing loss, occurs when we lose part or all of our ability to hear. Other terms that are used to refer to hearing impairment are deaf and hard of hearing.

What you might not know is that Hearing Impaired Individuals are not necessary Mute or incapable of talking, it's just that they would need a special type of therapy to help them talk and communicate; and on average a child needs 2-3 times speech-therapy per week for a period of 1 to 2 years which can be a financial burden on their family that the child end up not receiving the proper support.

  • Our Aim is to create awareness on the topic of Hearing Impairment in general 
  • We want to establish an initiative to make a fund available to support children in need of therapy but cannot afford.
  • The initial Target is to gather 20,000$ that would be divided into 1,000 Token of 20$ each that would be equivalent to 1,000 speech therapy sessions.

And in return of the valuable contribution, The International Author, Samer Chidiac has committed to donate all the profits of his Book 7 Minutes Motivation to this project. 


What We Need & What You Get

  • We are aiming at securing a Fund to cover the costs of 1,000 Speech Therapy Sessions and make them at the disposal of 3-4 Centers to support Children in Need.
  • We will be offering exciting perks, which consist of Books, E-Books, Audio Books and High Quality Podcasts, all the way to Sign Language coaching  by one of the children and some exclusive Platinum Perks for select contributors.
  • Since the smallest token of the fund is 20$ for a session, even if we don't reach our target, we can still support as many children as possible with what we have gathered.


The Impact

With the success of this initiative and campaign, further local, regional and global awareness will be established that would allow more people to continue supporting children in need further more.

The Start of the initiative will take place in various geographies within Lebanon, with plans to move to other countries within the Middle East & Africa and to make Today, I Hear you a regional NGO that would cater solely for the Hearing Impaired Children. 


Risks & Challenges

The main challenge is to make sure that the fund goes to the children truly in need, therefore we have established a team (refer the website: http://iHearYou.Today) who will be following up with the Centers to make sure the management of the fund is solely used with the purpose of Speech Therapy for the Children in need and nothing else.


Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that some people just can't contribute financially, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • If you like our campaign, SHOUT ABOUT IT to your friends and connections
  • Check out the website and sign up to be a volunteer. 

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Randy's death feels like such a waste of beautiful human potential and talent. Let's try to bring some meaning to Randy's death. Randy would love to have known that in leaving this world he was able to do some good on the way out.

Please consider donating to Randy's Memorial Fund. In a month we will hold a get-together celebrating Randy's life and at that time anyone attending will be part of deciding how best to use the funds for good.

Some ideas for the fund include: helping Randy's son Evan; paying back anyone that is owed; donation to an addiction research foundation; music scholarship; or another idea that honours Randy's memory.

If you would like to share a tribute, please visit Randy's memorial website at http://www.forevermissed.com/randycatney

Thank-you in advance,
Linda
LindaBurlison@gmail.com

story:
Not just any EP...

In 2009 I became a rapper. How do you become a rapper you ask? I really don't know the answer to that. You see in my case, I just borrowed the maiden name of my maternal grandmother and went around calling myself a rapper. Shortly after becoming a "rapper", I did what most people do… Just mimicked what I saw and heard. 

I wrote lyrics. Book loads of them. I'd get rap instrumentals from anyone I could and I would spend hours and hours just writing lyrics under the streets of NYC while commuting to and from work on the subway. 

Though, I genuinely enjoy all of the music I've ever made, something never felt quite right. I felt like I was putting on a bit of a character and trying to be like other rappers. During that time I was trying to find my sound and the only way I knew how to do it, was to mimic what I had heard other artists do.  6 years, 2 EP's & 4 singles later I have finally found MY sound. I've started making a kind of music that is truer to me and to be completely honest, it's not really rap. I don't know exactly what it is, but I love it and I really can't wait to share it with you. 

How much do we need?

$5,000

Your contribution will cover the costs associated with creating an extremely professional project in which you'll be able to say, "I helped create that".

Your currency will pay for: 

Studio Time, Mixing, Mastering, Hiring local musicians (The magic), Album Art & Digital distribution  for 3 well packaged tracks that will impact humanity.  

Where is your money going?

A bulk of the budget will go into production costs. My friend, fellow musician and producer Jason Merritt will open his home studio to me for many hours while he records, edits, mixes and masters the tracks all while wearing the producer hat.  Why Jason Merritt? Jason has been able to capture the exact sound required for this EP.  Not only that, he's got credits.

Jason has worked extensively with 5 time Grammy nominated Tift Merritt (No relation). He Mixed Chatham County Line's record "Wildwood", Co produced recorded and mixed Six String Drag's record "Roots Rock-n-roll", Co produced, recorded and mixed Keny Roby's critically acclaimed record "Memories and birds", worked with Underhill Rose on 2 records and a lot of other things... He also recorded and mixed a track of Bloodshot Records 25th anniversary…To top it all off, he's been in sessions with Dr. Dre, Paul Westerberg and Courtney love.  Not only has he been successful behind the scenes pushing the record button, he has also shared the stage with Keny Roby while on a 2 week tour opening for Citizen Cope. 

Local Talent

The use of real recorded instrumentation versus packaged (digital) sound  is incomparable.  Jason and I will be hand selecting local talent and paying them to come into the studio to record with us.  Think deep strings, cellos, percussion and local vocals.  I will be providing the mouth trumpet (just kidding we will not have any mouth trumpeting on this record.  Maybe next time).     

Album Art  

The album art for this record will be subtle, yet powerful and there is no better person to do it, than my good friend Jamie Makely.  Jamie is an amazing artist who I have been so fortunate to have on my side.  She designed art for my last EP, "Till It's Over", and 3 of my singles. 

Till It's Over (2012) Designed by Jamie Makely 

Come Into My Jungle (2014) Designed by Jamie Makely 

Little One (Coming 7/27/15) Designed & drawn by Jamie Makely 


No Good Deed Unseen

For your gracious contributions we have music, fun one-of-a-kind handmade drink coasters, behind the scene footage of the recording process, fresh baked goods (yeah that's right) and personal thank you notes. 

In the event that we don't reach our goal, all collected contributions will go toward completing the album.  I will save until I make up the difference and this EP WILL BE RELEASED.  You have my word. 

If we make more than our goal, we will be mastering this record to vinyl.  

Sans Masque the EP 

This project is dedicated to anyone on the search of truly finding themselves in a culture saturated with hypocritical principles.  One which boasts of individuality all while constantly streaming commercials that feed off insecurities in order to sell products. Sans Masque (Without Mask).  Take off your mask and embrace your strengths and discover your own weaknesses.  

Why will this EP be successful? 

I take pride in hard work.  I am surrounded by talented and amazing people who enjoy sharing their skills for a good cause and I strive to make the world a little better than it was before I got here.  If I've learned anything since I began recording music, it's that you can't force anything and if you do it will become evident in the final product.  Working with Jason on my latest project, Little One (releasing 7/27/15), was an amazing unforced experience in which we brought our strengths to the table all while complimenting each others weaknesses.  This method of creating is my new mantra and it will be clear when you hear.  

Don't have an extra $5 lying around but still want to help me? 

If you can't afford to contribute to this project, don't beat yourself up.  I'm reaching out to you because I myself can't afford to produce this EP by my lonesome.  A simple way you can help me reach my goal: 

*Share This video on every social media platform you can. It won't cost you a dime!   

*Indiegogo makes it very simple to share by using their share tools.

Shout outs 

This project would never have been made possible without my long time friend Andrea Chronister aka (Shley).  She owns an independent video production company called Saghani Studios and she has so graciously produced & Directed this project as well as some past projects including: Come Into My Jungle & This is Zubris. On the last day of this campaign, August 27th we will release a music video of "Little One" directed and produced by her and her production company. She is a beautiful person inside and out and can do ANYTHING.  She can even make croissants from scratch. I'm serious. 

Haven't heard Zubris before?  

Listen to all my stuff here free! 
Check out my YouTube Channel
Like my Facebook page
Add Zubris to your music library
story_txt:
Not just any EP...In 2009 I became a rapper. How do you become a rapper you ask? I really don't know the answer to that. You see in my case, I just borrowed the maiden name of my maternal grandmother and went around calling myself a rapper. Shortly after becoming a "rapper", I did what most people do… Just mimicked what I saw and heard. I wrote lyrics. Book loads of them. I'd get rap instrumentals from anyone I could and I would spend hours and hours just writing lyrics under the streets of NYC while commuting to and from work on the subway. Though, I genuinely enjoy all of the music I've ever made, something never felt quite right. I felt like I was putting on a bit of a character and trying to be like other rappers. During that time I was trying to find my sound and the only way I knew how to do it, was to mimic what I had heard other artists do.  6 years, 2 EP's & 4 singles later I have finally found MY sound. I've started making a kind of music that is truer to me and to be completely honest, it's not really rap. I don't know exactly what it is, but I love it and I really can't wait to share it with you. How much do we need?$5,000Your contribution will cover the costs associated with creating an extremely professional project in which you'll be able to say, "I helped create that".Your currency will pay for: Studio Time, Mixing, Mastering, Hiring local musicians (The magic), Album Art & Digital distribution  for 3 well packaged tracks that will impact humanity.  Where is your money going?A bulk of the budget will go into production costs. My friend, fellow musician and producer Jason Merritt will open his home studio to me for many hours while he records, edits, mixes and masters the tracks all while wearing the producer hat.  Why Jason Merritt? Jason has been able to capture the exact sound required for this EP.  Not only that, he's got credits.
Jason has worked extensively with 5 time Grammy nominated Tift Merritt (No relation). He Mixed Chatham County Line's record "Wildwood", Co produced recorded and mixed Six String Drag's record "Roots Rock-n-roll", Co produced, recorded and mixed Keny Roby's critically acclaimed record "Memories and birds", worked with Underhill Rose on 2 records and a lot of other things... He also recorded and mixed a track of Bloodshot Records 25th anniversary…To top it all off, he's been in sessions with Dr. Dre, Paul Westerberg and Courtney love.  Not only has he been successful behind the scenes pushing the record button, he has also shared the stage with Keny Roby while on a 2 week tour opening for Citizen Cope.

story:
Short Summary

Hey there!  A lot of you probably know me. But if not: 

Hi, I'm Julie Nolen. Most people call me Julie Effin Nolen, polite for...well, you know. 

Born and raised in West Texas, I came to Austin at the turn of the century to write stories and make music. This full length record will be my first as a completely solo artist. Done my way. Little bit country and a lotta bit rock n roll.

There's been a lot of ups and downs this past couple of years. The result is more determination, more confidence, more dignity and more grit in my songwriting. It's hard as hell to survive out there, much less with your wits in tact. And sometimes it's nice to know someone feels the same way you do. Especially through a catchy melody.

So bottom line, if through music, I can help you relate to another person, stay true to yourself and maybe raise a little hell along the way...well, then I've done my job.


What We Need

We live in a world where the music and entertainment business is changing. There's a lot more freedom for individual artists like myself. On the other end, there's also a lot for an independent artist to do all by themselves. 

I don't mind the work. 

But there are some things I cannot do. It takes several links amongst the chains of music publications and radio stations to even open the envelope and listen to our record, much less consider it for airplay. There are things like radio and media promotions that other people have spent their lives networking in and perfecting. I would like to connect with them and share my work with them, in conjunction with consistent touring in their areas. This is where you come in. 

Many grassroots movements by independent artists have proven it to be true that getting a record on the radio, into magazines, online blogs and more, let people choose for themselves what music plays on their airwaves and who plays in their nearby music venues. Together, we can make that happen.

We're going to do something a little bit different. We're going to build from the ground up, grassroots style and spread out from there by releasing the album locally in November. After the holidays, when all those holiday songs are off our radio dials, I'm going to hard release the album out nationally. 

And as a backer, you'll have the album before any one else!

And now it's time for the break down...

  • Radio Promotion (4-8 months): $1500: I will hire an Americana radio promotor to get my music on Americana-specific radio stations throughout America and Europe.  And hopefully charting on Americana Music charts.
  • PR and Press costs: (3 month cycles) $1850 - $4,000: Guaranteed press reviews, interviews, blog posts, articles, etc. Promotion, tour support, video promotion. Including accurate reports back so we can see how well they're working for us.
  • Radio Tour: $2500 including gas, any moderately priced hotels possibly needed. I'm always willing to save a little and sleep on couches of friends though. 
  • Mailing costs: $$$ I'm not even sure yet. But it's expensive to mail out hundreds of CDs and press kits.

You are my support system. You are my friends. You are my fans. You are my record label peeps. You are my family. You are my hellraisers! 

And I need your help.  Let's share this message together. 

What You Get

I'm super excited about the incentives we've come up for you including:

  • Exclusive T-shirts
  • Trucker hats
  • Bandanas
  • Embroidered shirts
  • Chance for your voice to be on the record itself! 
  • Be listed as an Executive Producer!
  • House concerts and more!
Here are the shirt designs!

Check out the Gallery page for pictures of all the artwork proofs for the T-shirts and Hats!

Risks & Challenges

Sure there's a chance we might fall short of our goal. Whatever is given will go as much to what was laid out above as possible. At the very least, playing as many shows as possible and getting my face in front of new audiences is the best PR out there. 

Being on the road itself can incur some unexpected costs but I'm well prepared for that. I intend on providing a consistent touring presence in as many areas as I can get to. Either way I'll be in constant contact with you to tell you how it's going.

Other Ways You Can Help

Bottom line, you hellraisers have done a wonderful job of sharing my facebook posts and events and just spreading the word about me. I appreciate it so much. If you can't contribute right now, I understand times get tough. Please spread this message and share this to your friends and family. The more noise we can make, the better!

  • Share, comment and like on Facebook, Twitter and other social media!
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

Thank you so much for all your help. Now let's go raise some hell!

Share, comment and like on Facebook, Twitter and other social media!

Use the Indiegogo share tools!
   Thank you so much for all your help. Now let's go raise some hell!

story:
"Wepa! This is massive! Out of 850 bands WE have been chosen to play this important music conference WOMEX in October. The new songs are killer, so we better finish our album ASAP to present it in Budapest."

Palenke Soultribe at a turning point

What started in Colombia with two artists in 2006 has grown into an amazing live & electronic 4-piece band. They serve up infectious Afro-Colombian rhythms with spicy electronic dance tunes. Founders/producers Juan Borda and Andres 'Popa' Erazo teamed up with drummer Argel Cota & percussionist Clodomiro Montes in their current home Los Angeles, completing that shimmering punchy-ness that is Palenke's signature sound. 

Perusing this musical path over the years has been challenging, but it's been beyond inspiring! We're so grateful to have been touring and sharing our music with so many diverse people. Three years ago we never would have imagined that we would play festivals like Glastonbury, and yet, there we were.
We've done so much a small team, so it's time to take things to the next level!

Our goals at WOMEX, Budapest

We're thrilled that PST has officially been invited to showcase at one of the world's largest music markets: WOMEX!
On 22 October we'll have the opportunity to play in front of 2500 professionals: presenters, agents, labels and media from all over the globe, generating huge exposure. 
Our management company, Kokako Music, has been working tirelessly to get us to this point and has done most of the booking. Together we have to expand! 

It's the opportunity we've been looking for, the means to find the right partners to get our music out there TO YOU!  What's involved:
  • Finding labels to release our new album SANGRE
  • Finding agents for specific regions, to build viable tours
  • Playing live to get discovered by festival/venue promoters
  • Meeting with press to spread the word
  • and much more! 
All this will take place in Budapest, Hungary, 22 Oct 2015.

 

Making SANGRE

In order to accomplish the above, we need to present our new album. 
On stage we have such amazing chemistry and fun, that we've set out to capture that vibe on our forthcoming album SANGRE.

SANGRE completes the final chapter in our a 3-album series. It represents the third color - red -of the Colombian flag, complementing the previous 2: 'Oro' (yellow) and 'Mar' (blue)
This album represents passion, love and exhilarating (heart) beats. it is us literally pouring our experiences and hearts out to you. So not only do we need to finish this for Womex, we need to finish this chapter for ourselves.
SANGRE will include collaborations with some of our gifted musical friends. 

What We Need & What You Get

It's a long drive and swim to Budapest, Hungary....
By raising $20,000 USD you'll help us create our vision and rocket our career!

PERKS
  • Be the first to hear & receive the new album SANGRE 
  • Exclusively designed merch: tote bags, trucker caps and T-shirts! 
  • An opportunity to hang with the band during a rehearsal
  • Personal message from Budapest.
  • Unreleased tracks and complete your PST music collection
  • First hand drum and percussion lessons by our rhythm jukeboxes Clodomiro & Argel.
  • For schools and institutions: Offer the gift of music to your students or community members by booking a group workshop.
  • A DJ set or, heck, even a full private live show! 

Budget

  • Finish recording, mixing, mastering: $6,000
  • Album artwork and printing: $1,000
  • Round trip flights for crew & gear to Budapest: $8,000
  • 4 nights of hotels for crew & local transport & per diem: $1,500
  • Promotional materials (posters for trade fair, flyers to promote showcase, online campaigns, band merch/goodies): $1,500
  • T-shirts and other campaign merchandise: $1,000
  • Indiegogo fees: $1,000

Efficient & effective

Any professional wants to see an artist perform live before working with them. Participation in WOMEX will propel us forward, allowing us to reach so many professionals at once.
We know this is our strong point. We once even had a promoter book us immediately after we finished our performance at a festival. Bang!

There's nothing like meeting people in person to transfer our energy, our ideas and build strong connections. 

In closing 

We'd been invited to a similar event in Brazil, but it came too late to do a fundraiser. Therefore we missed that opportunity, such a shame!
If we don't reach our goal, we can skip opportunities, do things half-assed, like sleeping in the streets of Budapest, not complete the entire album, etc. ... But think about it, that doesn't get us anywhere, now does it?
It's about time we deliver this new album to YOU, our patient fans.
We have everything ready to make the most out of Womex!!! We're great at networking and our manager will be attending Womex for the 7th time. It's safe to say she has this down to a science. We have an amazing group of people ready to help us promote the show on site.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute financially, you can still help us reach our goal by sharing this campaign through your social media, telling people why you love our music and letting people know how important it is that we reach our goal. 

We are grateful for your help. Now, let's get going! VAMOS

story:
Get Dixieghost to the Clermont

Knoxville band Dixieghost is getting ready to release their new record, Wine and Spirits in May. 

We are shooting a music video Sunday, April 26… at the infamous Clermont Lounge in Atlanta. 

Bluegrass music. Hipsters. Mumford and Sons lookalikes. Dancing girls. The famous Blondie has agreed to appear in our music video. It’s going to be the first ever bluegrass song recorded at the Clermont.

We Need Money, People, and a Celebration

We need money: Renting the Clermont, hiring dancers, covering logistics and production costs. We need to raise about $4000 to cover all our costs. 

We need people: We need about 25 extras to be at the Clermont Lounge in Atlanta Sunday, April 26 from 1 pm-6 pm. If you donate $75 or more, you are guaranteed to appear in our soon-to-be-famous music video. The more the merrier, we need people to bring different outfits, swanky evening bar attire and regular everyday clothing.

We need you at our after party: We’ll be celebrating after the shoot somewhere in Ponce Highlands…We’ll have beer, snacks, and an after party happening at the Righteous Room. 

Because Clermont!!

We'll be the first bluegrass band to record a music video at the Clermont. 

  • Time is of the essence. The Clermont Lounge will be closing for several months during the renovation of the Clermont Hotel. 
  • We've got to get this done before they close for renovations. 
  • We've got a production company with several feature films and music videos behind us with an entire crew.
  • We've also got the famous Blondie in the music video (Google AKA Blondie to learn more about her)

Because New Record

We're releasing our new record, Wine and Spirits, in May, and this music video will help us launch!

  • We've got a great team and a plan to get this done
  • We need your support because our fans are awesome

Ways to Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

Thank you all for your support! 

Sincerely, 

The band: Jason, Justin, Dave, Will, Seth, Jonathan

The producers: Doug and Blake, who just finished Legends of Appalachia: The Ace Miller Story
story_txt:
Get Dixieghost to the Clermont 
Knoxville band Dixieghost is getting ready to release their new record, Wine and Spirits in May. 
We are shooting a music video Sunday, April 26… at the infamous Clermont Lounge in Atlanta. 
Bluegrass music. Hipsters. Mumford and Sons lookalikes. Dancing girls. The famous Blondie has agreed to appear in our music video. It’s going to be the first ever bluegrass song recorded at the Clermont.   We Need Money, People, and a Celebration We need money: Renting the Clermont, hiring dancers, covering logistics and production costs. We need to raise about $4000 to cover all our costs. 

We need people: We need about 25 extras to be at the Clermont Lounge in Atlanta Sunday, April 26 from 1 pm-6 pm. If you donate $75 or more, you are guaranteed to appear in our soon-to-be-famous music video. The more the merrier, we need people to bring different outfits, swanky evening bar attire and regular everyday clothing.
We need you at our after party: We’ll be celebrating after the shoot somewhere in Ponce Highlands…We’ll have beer, snacks, and an after party happening at the Righteous Room.    Because Clermont!! We'll be the first bluegrass band to record a music video at the Clermont.   Time is of the essence. The Clermont Lounge will be closing for several months during the renovation of the Clermont Hotel.  We've got to get this done before they close for renovations. 
We've got a production company with several feature films and music videos behind us with an entire crew.
We've also got the famous Blondie in the music video (Google AKA Blondie to learn more about her)    Because New Record  We're releasing our new record, Wine and Spirits, in May, and this music video will help us launch!  We've got a great team and a plan to get this done
We need your support because our fans are awesome    Ways to Help Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:  Please get the word out and make some noise about our campaign. Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!   Thank you all for your support! Sincerely, The band: Jason, Justin, Dave, Will, Seth, JonathanThe producers: Doug and Blake, who just finished Legends of Appalachia: The Ace Miller Story

story:
Par ici pour la version Française!

Friend of All the World set out to record our third album away from the daily press of the city and the studio. The idea was to to play in a place where no-one had recorded before and make music that sounded like it came from real people playing in a real place. So we built our own studio in an old barn loft north of Trois-Rivières, stuffed it full of mic-stands, cables, drums, amps, a Rhodes piano and a few other odds and ends to see what might happen. The results surprised the crap out of us and we need your help to get it out this fall!

We recorded, mixed and mastered the album on the money we squirrelled away promoting our last record 'The Wild' but the tank has run dry. With the funds raised from this campaign, we aim to print CD's and vinyl, make art work and invest a little to promote this record (a local label has approached us to take on the digital distribution but these days they get you to do the promo yourselves..). In the next few months, we'll be making artwork for the album, revamping our website, filming some live videos, printing posters and getting our record into a few local record stores. 

We're offering a range of perks for different contribution levels from a limited edition pressing of vinyl records:

To CDs:


to T-Shirts



 to a pair of house concerts featuring ourselves:

and, finally, before we forget, there are also one of a kind photos from the recording taken by our in-house ace photographer Kenton Mail:


Any contribution you make will help us get this record out there and help our music make a few new friends!

Version Française.

Friend of All the World s’est donné le défi d’enregistrer son troisième album loin de la frénésie de la ville et du studio. Le principe était de jouer dans un lieu où personne n’avait jamais enregistré et de faire de la musique qui sonnait comme si elle était jouée par des humains. Nous avons donc construit notre propre studio dans le grenier d’une vieille grange au nord de Trois-Rivières, le remplissant à ras-bord de micros, de câbles, de percussions, d'amplis, un piano Rhodes et quelques autres patentes afin de voir ce qui pourrait arriver. Nous fûmes les premiers étonnés du résultat et avons besoin de votre aide pour sortir tout ça de manière présentable cet automne!

Nous avons enregistré, mixé et masterisé cet album grâce à l’argent que nous avions épargné en faisant la promotion de notre album précédent, ‘The Wild’, mais nos finances se sont taries. Les fonds amassés lors de cette campagne serviront donc à imprimer des CD et des vinyles, à finaliser la pochette et à investir dans un minimum de promotion pour cet album (un label local nous a déjà approchés pour la distribution numérique, mais de nos jours la promo doit se faire par les artistes…). Au cours des prochains mois, nous allons fignoler la pochette, rénover notre site Web, filmer quelques vidéos, imprimer des affiches et placer notre œuvre sur les tablettes de quelques boutiques locales.

Nous offrons toute une panoplie de récompenses, en fonction du niveau de contribution offert.

Vous pouvez choisir une édition limitée version vinyle :

Ou peut-être un bon vieux CD:

Ou encore une prestation privée dans votre salon:

Et, finalement, pendant qu’on y pense, nous offrons également des photos originales et uniques de l’enregistrement , prises par notre extraordinaire photographe personnel (et batteur), Kenton Mail:


Toute contribution de votre part nous permettra d’enfin présenter notre album au monde entier et aidera notre musique à se faire quelques nouveaux amis!

story:
Short Summary

The Eat, Sing & Travel People is a sole proprietor business established in 2012 by Danny Chen, a Malaysian who works for an oil company, author, blogger and video host  to promote the appreciation of all good things life, which is to enjoy food, music and travelling around the world.  The EST People's activity in the last 3 years can be summarised into 3 major accomplishments i.e. train2eat Kuala Lumpur a local food guidebook, 48-Hours Stopover YouTube videos by Malaysia Airlines and master classes, opera and concert productions under the banner of EST Opera company, winner of 2 BOH Cameronian Arts Award this year.  

This Opera in Malaysia fund raising campaign is to help fund the transition of the EST Opera company (EST) into a full fledge opera company in Malaysia. The EST Opera company consists of a voluntary artistic committee, a 40-member opera chorus, 9 company principal soloists and an ad-hoc orchestra ensemble consisting of between 14-20 members. Members of the chorus consist of mainly Malaysians. EST produces around 3 productions per year. Since its inception, it has staged La Boheme, Carmen, L'elisir D'amore, Amahl & the Night Visitors and also concerts featuring works by Handel, Mozarts' Coronation Mass, Tchaikovsky's Nutcracker Suite and others.


What We Need & What You Get

The fund is required to:

1) Pay for the administrative cost for registering the new company (US$1,000)

2) To fund production cost such as theatre rental, honorarium for performers and musicians and other miscellaneous costs for the gala concert (US$8,000)

3) To raise enough funds to finance upcoming productions which is currently fully dependent on tickets sales (US$6,000)


For funds contributed, we will send/mail you:

1) US$25 - name mentioned in our program booklet, 1 copy of the program booklet of our productions

2) US$50 - name mentioned in our program booklet, 1 copy of the program booklet of our productions, 1 free T-shirt

3) US$100 - name mentioned in our program booklet, 1 copy of the program booklet of our productions, 1 free T-shirt, 1 copy of train2eat Kuala Lumpur food guidebook

4) US$500 - name mentioned in our program booklet, 1 copy of the program booklet of our productions, 1 free T-shirt, 1 copy of train2eat Kuala Lumpur food guidebook, 1 copy of DVD of the productions

5) US$1000 and above - name mentioned in our program booklet, 1 copy of the program booklet of our productions, 1 free T-shirt, 1 copy of train2eat Kuala Lumpur food guidebook, 1 copy of DVD of the productions, autographed poster and permanent listing in our website.


The Impact

Currently, EST Opera is the one and only active opera company in Malaysia. Your contribution will help keep western opera music and productions alive in Malaysia. We have many talented singers and musicians who needs the opportunity to perform. We have audiences who like opera music and with your help, we can reach out to more.


Risks & Challenges

In the past 3 years, we have had little success in raising funds or donations through the conventional channels. In our second year, we managed to secure some government funding to reduce our production cost but it was soon discontinued. We are trying other channels to seek funding and we hope for your support.


Other Ways You Can Help

Please share this with your friends and help this good cause.

story:
Short Summary

On July 23rd, my soundcloud account was falsely removed and they refuse to reinstate my profile. After 4 years, 83 tracks, 8500 followers, and over 1 million plays, I have dedicated my life to making music for the people that have supported me from the beginning. 

With this recent event, I have found myself at a musical crossroads. Do I try to continue DJ Swoon? Or do I try and be proactive and take advantage of being able to start fresh.

I've decided to give myself a clean slate, and start #ProjectSLUSHII

This is not just a musical endeavor, but a complete experience. We're going big this time. 

I wanted from the start to create something that could be identified with through characters, animations and most importantly the music. This is what I hope to achieve with #ProjectSLUSHII, but I need your help!

What We Need & What You Get

Here's what is in store for this project and how we'll get there!

40% of all funds received will go toward music video/animation funding for the SLUSHII brand. That means hiring animators and video editors to take the music you will hear from Slushii and convert it into a visual experience. This big of a percentage is going toward this aspect because it is very expensive in this day and age to have quality animation done. But I'm sure you guys will love it :)

30% Will go toward actual production of the Slushii album. This accounts for production costs, artwork, album promotion, and distribution.

20% Will go to rebuilding my studio, as a lot of my equipment has been damaged, or worn out from extended use.

10% will go toward promotion for the Slushii brand, because building the family of people involved in this project is one of the most important things about this. We are all involved in this one way or another, and I wouldn't even be here doing this if i didn't believe in you guys!



The Impact

Our goal is to entertain people. At the end of the day we are all here for that sole reason. Music and Media entertainment is really a way for some to escape their reality and get taken to a different world. That is Slushii. The opportunity to create a fun and relatable form of entertainment that people can be on the same wavelength with. With this project we plan to connect music and video in a way that becomes familiar and recognizable.


Risks & Challenges

I know that entertaining people is what I want to do with my life. I am currently trying to overcome this hardship as proactively as I can by creating something more involved and bigger than the DJ Swoon ever was. But I can only do this with the help of the people that supported me in the first place.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate: don't worry! There are other ways you can help!!

SPREAD THE WORD! Tell friends, share this campaign and lets do this!

Give feedback! We love hearing from you.

And use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
We want to create a community performance space like no other on the coast. 
The set up of our new studios is now complete and we are so happy with the result!!
BUT - We have two spare warehouses which will only be used for classes for our full time course, so we thought what do the performers of the coast need? 

The performers of the coast need a cost effective performance and rehearsal space which they don't have to sell a certain amount of tickets or sell a certain amount of drinks and food to use.

Nate Butler's Studio has been putting on a range of performance opportunities and competitions for the past 5 years. In the past we have used a range of clubs and restaurants to put on these event, we would now like to create a  performance space attached to our teaching studios.
We have run many successful singing competitions such as "Sing For Your Supper" & "Sing Your Face Off", which have given away over $50,000 in cash and prizes so far, We have run performance showcases and open mics with local clubs giving local performers a chance to fine tune there performances!! We also run the "Carols by Schooner light" with Shelly Beach Golf Club, which raises money thousands of dollars for the Ronald McDonald Family room at Gosford Hospital, which brings crowds of up to 2000 people. So we have plenty of experience at running events.
OUR NEW VISION
We want to create an affordable new 50 seat performance space to be used by or students and anyone in the community who needs a space. Which can also double as a practice space for large community groups.
We see the space being used for live music nights, open mic's, small plays, cabarets or whatever the local arts community want it for.
We want to use is to run Masterclasses, Workshops and a range of other learning events for our Central Coast!!
We are located only a 10 min walk from Gosford train station which will allow this performance space to be accessed by all of the Central Coast.

This is what the money is going towards and the order in how we will use the contributions.

1 - Leveling out the floors and covering them

2 - Fixing the walls and roof

3 - Purchase of new sound system and lighting

4 - Purchase of seats

5 - Stage

6 - Alarm system

By building this space we will be able to full fill our dream of opening a performance space for not only our students but for the local community. Your contribution is the key to the success of this space. 

We want to make this the best venue possible but we need your help. Please share this campaign with your friends, family & local musk's.

HOW CAN YOU HELP GET THIS UP AND RUNNING??

You can make a donation to our campaign or you can buy one of our perks listed on the side of the screen!

You can buy tickets to the opening show or even have a room with your family name on it there are heaps of options!!

We can't wait to keep you up to date with how our campaign is going!!!
Please help us by donating and sharing with your friends!
Thanks

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know how the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
COSTRUIAMO MUSICA

Chi siamo?

La banda musicale “Francesco Curcio” di Amantea (CS) porta oggi il nome del suo fondatore e primo maestro che, nel 1987, ha dato vita a questa grande realtà con lo scopo di avvicinare al mondo musicale i giovani del territorio in una regione difficile come la Calabria.

il maestro Curcio, è riuscito in poco tempo a costruire un organico di giovanissimi dalle grandi potenzialità che col passare dagli anni è cresciuto ed ha raggiunto traguardi insperati in giro per l’Italia e nel mondo portando la sua musica.

Ancora più importante, è riuscito a creare momenti di socializzazione, coinvolgimento e formazione musicale dando vita ad un gruppo di giovani, meno giovani e giovanissimi che condividono la stessa passione e si impegnano per portare avanti un progetto comune, in miglioramento costante.

Cosa facciamo e cosa abbiamo fatto?

L’impegno giornaliero ci ha portati ad ottenere grandi risultati in Italia così come all’estero.

Nel 2003 ci siamo esibiti al 6º Festival Internacional de Mùsica Amadora dos Templàrios a Tomar, in Portogallo.

Il 2004 ha suggellato un periodo di grandi successi con il 1° posto nel concorso nazionale “Energia in Banda” a Napoli e il titolo nazionale della BANDA MUSICALE PIÙ GIOVANE D’ITALIA, premio riconosciuto per la migliore interpretazione eseguita dalla banda musicale più giovane

Nel 2005, abbiamo partecipato alla prestigiosa parata del COLUMBUS DAY per le vie principali di New York. Infine, nel 2006, è tra le partecipanti al concorso internazionale di Barcellona “Festival Internazionale delle Bande Musicali Europee”.

Tra i prestigiosi riconoscimenti bisogna ricordare che, in occasione dei festeggiamenti per il 150° Anniversario dell’Unità d’Italia, il Presidente del Comitato per le Celebrazioni dei 150 anni dell’Unità d’Italia ha conferito il titolo di “BANDA MUSICALE DEL 150° ANNIVERSARIO DELL’UNITÀ D’ITALIA”.

Questi riconoscimenti non vogliono essere dei traguardi ma delle tappe nel nostro percorso di crescita sia come associazione musicale che come punto di riferimento per l’intero hinterland di Amantea, e soprattutto per i giovani e giovanissimi.

Cosa vogliamo fare?

Anche il talento musicale ha bisogno di mezzi adeguati. Finora tutte le attività son state realizzate in un piccolo magazzino adattato a sala prove, dovendo inoltre pagare un cospicuo affitto, che in un periodo particolare come quello odierno rischia di soffocare la nostra associazione, che non riceve più praticamente nessun contributo.

Abbiamo perciò intenzione di realizzare un plesso moderno che permetta di fornire un sostegno adeguato alla formazione dei ragazzi e alla continuazione delle attività fin qui svolte.

A tal proposito l’amministrazione comunale, non potendo finanziare un edificio ex novo, ha premiato l’associazione assegnando un terreno di circa 1.500 mq per la realizzazione di un polo di attrazione d’eccellenza a condizione che la struttura venga realizzata in tempi prestabiliti dalla convenzione.

Un progetto che prevede una sede a forma di una chiave di violino, divisa in 3 blocchi: una grande sala da concerto e altre due sale per attività didattico – formative costruito in modo tale da richiamare l’attenzione anche sulla sostenibilità ambientale. Insomma, non solo musica, ma cultura in senso più lato.

Alla base del progetto i criteri tengono conto dell’ambiente circostante in cui il plesso dovrà essere inserito, ovvero in un’area già parzialmente urbanizzata che comprende un plesso scolastico e un palazzetto dello sport.

Per la realizzazione dell’intero progetto il costo stimato è di € 400.000. Una cifra considerevole ma estremamente necessaria per il futuro di numerosi giovani talentuosi che vedono svanire i propri sogni.

L’obiettivo minimo del direttivo è quello di realizzare almeno il primo blocco così da permettere all’associazione di svolgere in maniera autonoma le attività bandistiche basilari.

Perché sostenere il nostro progetto?

Sostenere il nostro progetto significa sostenere i giovani calabresi, non solo i giovani della Banda Curcio a credere ancora nella cultura, soprattutto quella musicale, oggi più che mai penalizzata. Confidiamo in chi, come noi, crede nella musica come presupposto per un futuro migliore, dove le arti musicali coincidano con uno sviluppo sostenibile, e dove soprattutto, si possa ancora sperare di realizzare i propri scopi senza dover sacrificare le proprie passioni.

È un grande sogno non irrealizzabile, ma serve il contributo di tutti.

Per questo motivo abbiamo realizzato questo video, con la speranza che il messaggio arrivi a tutti voi.

Ogni contributo sarà ben accetto e, per maggiori informazioni, visita il sito www.bandafrancescocurcio.it nella sezione “nuova sede Banda Curcio”.



BUILDING MUSIC

Who are we?

The “Francesco Curcio” Musical Ensemble in Amantea, Italy has the name of his founder and first director who, in 1987, gave life to this great reality, in order to attract young people to music in a difficult territory, Calabria.

Director Curcio, in a short time has created a big ensemble made up of talented people that has grown during the years and has achieved important not expected goals all over Italy and the World, thanks to its music.

Even much more important, he created socialization, participation and musical formation moments, for young, younger and less young people who share the same passion and work hard to carry on a common project, always improving.

What are we doing? And what have we done?

We worked hard every day to reach great results both in Italy and all over the World.

In 2003 we participated in the “6º Festival Internacional de Mùsica Amadora dos Templàrios”, in Tomar, Portugal.

In 2004 we achieved a lot of prizes starting with the 1st prize at the National Competition “Energia in Banda” in Naples, which allowed us to win the “Italian Youngest Ensemble” prize, in Florence, for the best performance by the youngest ensemble.

In 2005, we took part in the Columbus Day parade in New York and finally, in 2006, we came back to Europe to participate in the “European Musical Ensemble International Festival”, in Barcelona.

Among our achievements, we can’t forget that in 2011, the President of the Committee for the 150th Anniversary of the Italian Unification declared us “Ensemble of the 150th Anniversary of the Italian Unification”

All these achievements are not objectives but we look at them as necessary steps to grow both as musical ensemble and as benchmark for the whole community.

What would we like to do?

Even musical talent needs to be supported. Until now, all our activities have been performed in a small storehouse that we used as practice room, paying a substantial rent that we can’t afford to pay anymore and that could lead to bankruptcy, since our Ensemble has not a public fund.

So, we would like to build a modern building to continue performing our educational and musical activities.

Since the local administration can’t finance a new building for our activities, it gave us a plot of land (1500 square meters) for the building of a new rehearsal room, to help us achieving our goal, but on the condition that it will be built within the established time frame.

Our project is a treble clef building made up of three blocks: a big concert room and two smaller rooms for educational activities, which will be built looking at the environmental sustainability. So, not only music, but culture!

Criteria used in this project took account of the environment where the rehearsal room will be built, that is a partially urbanized area, near to a school complex and a sports arena.

To achieve our project, the estimate cost is of €400.000. It is a large sum but absolutely needed to continue helping our talented musicians have a future.

The minimum target is to build the first block (the concert room), at least, to allow the Ensemble continue performing its basic activities in complete autonomy.

Why should you support our dream?

Supporting our project means helping Calabrian people and not only the members of the “Francesco Curcio” Musical Ensemble to continue believing in culture and, mainly, in musical culture, nowadays penalized.

We trust in those who believe in music as a tool for a better future, where musical arts can grow with a sustainable development and where it is still possible to realize our dreams without sacrificing our passions.

It is a big dream but it is not impossible, and we need all your help!

For this reason, we made a video, hoping that our message will reach you all.

Every donation is welcome!

For more information, please visit our website www.bandafrancescocurcio.it, section “Musical Ensemble new headquarter”.

story:
Update!

Jenna and Seah just made a couch sessions video of new song 'Play With Fire' that will be featured on the album! Have a listen and scroll down for more info!

 

                                         ~~~


Welcome to Sound of the Sun's home on Indiegogo!

YOU have taken time out of your busy life to check US out... Thank you! 

We are SOTS and we have a busy summer ahead of us.

'A clash of 60s, 70s and 90's rock with hints of folk and blues, Sound of the Sun, the brainchild of Seah Maister, Jenna Earle and Karli Rose MacIntosh, has developed it's own brand of West Coast Art Rock.

Originating in Nelson, BC, a hotbed of music and creativity, SOTS draws upon the essence of music from decades past. Their harmony heavy compositions strike a unique balance of soft and heavy, darkness and light.' 

Over the last few years we have worked tirelessly to bring our music to the west coast of North America. From dates at the California Avocado Festival in 2012 and 2013, to playing the Kaslo Jazz fest and the Tiny Lights festival on our 2014 summer tour, to singing back up vocals for Jean Michael Byron (ex-lead singer for TOTO) and prog/metal band Trailight's latest album (featuring members of Annihilator, Devin Townsend Project, among others), we've had some incredible experiences. We released our first EP in 2013, and since then we've grown as musicians, writers and performers. Two years and 3 albums worth of material later, we are overdue for our follow up!  

(Don't mind the crazy lady... She just wanted to dance!)

Dead Letters Preview 

(Here's what Dead Letters will sound like on the album!)

We began tracking for the album (DEAD CROW SESSIONS) 
in January and have completed 3 songs so far at our home away from home: JAMS (Jasmine's Alternative Music School). This studio, situated in Santa Barbara, California is a non-profit organization that provides low cost music education, studio time, workshops and rehearsal space for low income individuals and at-risk youth. From participating in and leading workshops there, we have seen first hand the difference they make and we are very excited to be recording our album within those truly inspiring walls! 

August finds us heading back to Santa Barbara to continue work on our first full length album with producer Mike Dawson (Adam Carolla show). This is where you come in. Recording and releasing an album can be costly and we need help finishing what we started. Some of our expenses include, but are not limited to: Studio Costs, Producer, Mastering, Duplication, Album Artwork, Merchandise, and Promotions. 

Being a DIY band (we’ve even gone as far as doing our own photo shoot with a timer on the camera, Ghetto Family Portrait styles!) has made us have to work twice as hard to make our goals a reality. This campaign is especially important to us because it is a way for us to reach a wider audience while fulfilling a lifelong dream. 


Thanks for lending us your eyes for a few minutes!  

SOTS out!

story:
FFS in Short

Intentions: Electronic Music, fast, melodic and hard. Monty Python like humor and activism. Band Image: Band is a parody on itself, it represents our despise for the current state of show business.


Background

I'm (Stryber) working on this project since 1998. Rest of the band Shaul, Debate, Flip Flop, Dreadnought and Pipe are live crew. We used to play together in various rock bands during 2000's. Live Crew means that they will jump in when we go live. If that ever happens. So I'm on my own for now. The Band may look like joke to you and that's is our intention but we are very serious when it comes to music. 



The Problem

Bands usually need funds for studio fees, mixing, mastering etc. I think it's imperative to do all that by myself. Because all of this is a part of the process of making music and I can't just pay someone to do it for me and expect that it will sounds just like i wanted.

The problem is that I don't have time for this. I know how to compose, record, mix, master, make video... I don't need money for that, i need money to buy me time. For example, it took me two years to finish the video&tune that you just saw! That same job I can accomplish in one month if i have some free time. I have 20 more composed songs, but with this tempo i will need a lifetime to finish it. 


Solution

If i get some funds i can lower quantity of my job (coder freelancer), which means that i will have more time for music. If I reach my goal i will be able to completely quit my job until I finish the album. Everything that exceeds goal will go on equipment for live performance.


The Impact

This first step is crucial because after I finish first album I will have something to promote and hopefully we will have some funds from sales too. Next step will be cover album. (I have in mind some legendary bands like The Beatles, Beach Boys, The Doors, Deep Purple, Jethro Tull, Creedence, movie music: Ennio Morricone, Star Wars, Video Game Music etc.) After that i suppose that we will be ready for final step (Going live) and beyond.

It is worth to mention that when i speak about going live i don't mean in classical way. Our live sound must be just like in the clip you've just heard, but played live with guitars and drums. My role will be to achieve those sounds with processors in real time.


Time is the only risk and challenge

If I reach my goal it is realistic that I will be able to finish the album (with two videos) in one year. If I do not reach My goal but still get some funds It might take a little longer, but that would certainly speed things up. Plus, that would mean that i'm on the right track. If i don't get anything i still will be able to finish it some day, but that can be the difference between two albums or ten albums at the end. And we will, probably, be too old to go live. 


What You Get

Our hardcore supporters will get every FFS future release for free. And most generous backers will have opportunity to get involved in the creative process, with samples and guest appearances in official videos and even chose cover songs. We will never forget you and we will always try to find some extras for all of our backers.


Other Ways You Can Help

If you are not in situation to fund our campaign but want to help us.  you can still be of great help with likes, shares, subscriptions, comments, views...


If you have any questions about a project click the contact link.

story:
Hi there!  Cantalouper is a band from Columbia, Missouri.  We are raising money to launch our new record, Reproduction, which will be released May 8, 2015.  We are setting a goal of $5000 to deliver this album to you in the best form possible.  This amount would cover pressing the album on vinyl and packaging it with unique art that reflects the themes of the whole project.

    Cantalouper consists of four guys who place a very high value on the music they love, but who also face financial struggles common to many musicians and artists.  It costs a lot of money to share what you create with the rest of the world.  We love listening to music, playing shows, and recording.  We also all have multiple day jobs.  We sell books, drive shuttle buses, mop floors, move furniture, and make art.  We work backstage and in cubicles.  Two of us have children (shout out to Lily and Andrue, the stars of our video).  Thank you for taking the time to check out our Indie-Go-Go campaign.


   Cantalouper started when David Bazan helped complete our first EP at his home studio after hearing a tape of four track recordings Levi gave him following a Pedro the Lion show.  Cantalouper's first full-length album, "Mandrakes", was mixed and mastered by Kramer, who has produced records for bands like Low and Galaxie 500.  Aside from nineties indie rock influences, we tend to reference shoegaze and new wave music the most.  We tour regularly and have played multiple Midwest festivals such as Audiofeed, Kalamashoegazer, and Gathering of the Dudes.

   Reproduction has been wrapped up in production for years while we tweaked the songs and saved up the necessary funds to produce the exact sound we wanted.  This album represents the very best we have to offer musically and artistically.  Therefore, we needed it to be of the finest quality possible. It had to be on vinyl. It had to be mixed and mastered by the right people. It had to represent the total sum of Levi's songcraft and our shared ideas for what music can and should be. Reproduction is nothing less than who we are as a band.

   Reproduction was produced and recorded by Cantalouper in various bedrooms, a shed, a theater, an aquarium, and outdoors around Columbia.  Brett Siler mixed it with Levi at Mother Brain Infrastructure in November.  The recording was mastered by TW Walsh (Soft Drugs / Headphones / Pedro the Lion) in January.  Then Cameron Henry at Welcome to 1979 prepared and cut the master lacquers for the vinyl.  The process has been held up multiple times by financial struggles, logistics, changing band members, and even death.  So it's a real, live record.  Like any other birth, the genesis of Reproduction has been difficult but the results are worth it.  The album has been recorded, mixed, mastered, and is currently in line to be pressed.  We are proud of what we have created.  We think it deserves to be heard, and that you'll like it a lot.

   For visual inspiration, we turned to our drummer, Charles Parzych III, a professionally trained and experienced artist.  When asked to create the album's cover art, picture inserts, and new T-shirt design, Chuck cursed us all roundly and holed himself up in his home studio with his French press.  He emerged months later with truly unique and exciting art.  His family is glad to have him back, and we all agree that he's done something incredible. This is one of nine sculptures created for the album, in progress:

   We've been building up to this campaign for months.  Hundreds of e-mails, text messages, and discussions over dinner have revolved around how to best reward our potential donors for their support.  We decided to do something different.  We created our own Cantalouper coloring book featuring Chuck's pictures, concert poster illustrations, album art, and more.

   Unable to quit while we're ahead, we decided to go one step further.  After a great deal of thought, planning, and research; we decided to make custom view-master slides of album-themed images.  This way you can enjoy Cantalouper in three more dimensions.  

   So here we are, exhausted and excited and hopeful.  We love what we do.  We want you to love it too.  Please take a look at our donation tiers and decide if you'd like to own any of our work.  Reproduction is available for pre-order and everything you purchase will be shipped to you when this campaign ends.  Every single item has been designed and assembled by members of Cantalouper and their families.  Every cent you donate goes directly to our efforts to create and share good music that comes from an authentic place.  No matter what you choose, we thank you for the time and maybe we'll see you on the road this year.

Regards,

Levi, Chuck, Andrew, and Josh.

story:
Dark Greetings  

Now is your chance to take part in our crusade and contribute to our next Masterful release! 

As some of you may know - During the past 4 years or so, we have toiled over a new album which was intended to be released during 2014.

The material for the album (complete songs and artwork) was in fact ready a long time ago, and was planned to be released by one of the major labels out there.

ALAS , the label decided to postpone its release date again and again …leaving us with no choice but to relinquish our expectations for them to comply with the agreement.

Hence, we decided NOT TO DISAPPOINT OUR FANS AND FOLLOWERS across the globe – to tread the path which many honorable and established bands have walked before us – and record the album with no help from any label.

Answer the call – and make this manifest of evil come alive .

About us:

"The Bishop of Hexen" was formed in late 1994 in Ramat-Hasharon, Israel.

In 1995, the band entered the studios to record its debut demo tape: "Ancient Hymns of Legends & Lore",

The demo tape got extremely good response from the world wide underground metal scene, and was completely sold out at 450 copies.

Numerous record labels where interested in signing the band for a record deal and finally "The Bishop of Hexen" signed with "HammerHeart Productions" for one full length album opus.

In July 1996 the band entered the studios once again, and released its full length album in April 1997,entitled: "Archives of an Enchanted Philosophy", presenting 8 tracks of the most emotional, atmospheric &melodic black-metal art ever released.

In 2004, after seven years of silence, "The Bishop of Hexen" rejoined once again and recorded a promo CD,entitled "Unveil the Curtain of Sanity". The promo contained 4 new tracks of Atmospheric Melodic Black Metal

in its highest degree. The promo CD was highly appraised by record labels & magazines around the metal scene.

In early 2005, "The Bishop of Hexen" has signed with the Austrian metal label "CCP Records" and in June 2006 a Second Full Length Album entitled: "The Nightmarish Compositions" was released and was nominated to be one of the best and most creative Symphonic Black Metal albums of the year 2006 by many metal magazines and audiences.

In 2009, two tracks from Bishop of Hexen "The Nightmarish Compositions" album, entitled: "The Somber Grounds of Truth" and "A Serpentine Crave" were handpicked to be featured in the highly praised "Brutal Legend" video game soundtrack (Starring movie actor Jack Black as voice over).The game has sold over 1.4 million copies worldwide. The impressive soundtrack - includes multiple famous metal bands such as Motorhead, Judas Priest, Dio, Manowar, Slayer and many more.

Participating in the "Brutal Legend" video game has gained "The Bishop of Hexen" a vast exposure to hundreds of thousands of new listeners and fans and lifted the band to a new level of awareness amongst the metal scene.

In 2011 "The Bishop of Hexen" parted ways with "CCP records", set to find a new record label worthy of the band`s creative Symphonic Black Metal - In early 2012 "The Bishop of Hexen" has released a promo cd entitled "A ceremony at the end of a burning page…".

In March 2015 "The Bishop of Hexen" has released an exclusive sample track  from the upcoming album, entitled: A Thousand Shades of Slaughter (2015)
