story:
Only Irie Vibes?             [version française disponible plus bas] 

"Irie" [ai-ri \i'-ree] is Jamaican word and it means 'alright, good'. Positive. And that's all we want to do! Share good vibes, only irie vibes!

Who are we?

Leah Rosier from Amsterdam, the Netherlands, is passionate about Reggae and combines this with her love for singing and writing songs. With a joyful international mindset determined to share those irie vibes anywhere, Leah has already performed on various stages around Europe and recently also in Jamaica. She has done shows at festivals like Reggae Sun Ska (FR) and Future Reggae Ruigoord (NL) and has opened for artists like Israel Vibration, Ziggy Marley, Etana and Groundation. On her very inspirational journey to Jamaica she got invited by King Yellowman to sing at one of his concerts. Ever since Leah developed skills to record her own songs, she has been voicing many different riddims by producers and bands from all over the world. She released her first album High Paw in 2012 on her own label Likkle Green. In Amsterdam, Leah works closely with Black Star Foundation, a non-profit organization which has been committed to promote Reggae music in Holland for more than ten years. 

Rise & Shine is a Reggae backing band from Besançon, France, consisting of six experienced musicians and a producer. They are members of Uppertone, a local organization which has been supporting and promoting Jamaican music in all its forms for over a decade. In the past Rise & Shine have done live shows with French artists like Yaniss Odua and Nuttea. Besides backing reggae and dancehall singers, Rise & Shine also produce their own riddims. For their two projects Opus Riddim (2011) and Pitaya Riddim (2014) they have worked with various artists like Jah Mason, Queen Omega and Ricardo Clarke.

How we linked up

Together we have been making Reggae music since 2011 when we connected through social media and the band sent Leah some music to voice. This resulted in the song Music Teach Me (Opus Riddim) and Love Fyah, featured on Leah’s first album. In March 2012 we all met each other when Leah came to Besançon for three weeks to rehearse for our first shows that same month. 


Ever since we started performing live we've had a great connection, we all get along very well. We bring out a lot of creativity in each other. We've done many gigs in France and Switzerland in bars, clubs and other venues and also at festivals like Swimming Poule, Cult’Urban and Festival de la Paille. We've opened for French acts like Danakil and Mo'Kalamity. Last year we made a video for Leah's song Enough Is Enough on Rise & Shine's Pitaya Riddim. All this productivity and our strong bond naturally led into making an album together.


Our album: Only Irie Vibes

The past year we've put our heart and soul in writing this album and right now the final recordings are happening at studio Le Zèbre in Besançon, France. It brings joy to say that our album includes two collaborations with Jamaican artists recorded in Kingston, where Leah Rosier went earlier this year. One with the legendary vocal group The Mighty Diamonds and another with rising star Jahbar I. On this very productive and inspirational trip to Jamaica, Leah recorded two more duets, performed six times and shot a lot of video material.

Leah Rosier recorded a duet for our album at Anchor Studios in Kingston, Jamaica.

The album release is planned for autumn 2015. To be able to bring you our brand new music in the best possible quality, we would highly appreciate your support in this crowdfunding campaign to finance the final product: our full length album, 13 original songs, from the heart. Only irie vibes!

With your help we can realize Only Irie Vibes!

The previous time Leah Rosier ran a successful crowdfunding campaign unfortunately some bad minded people heard about it, broke into her home, made a big mess and stole the donated cash. That's why this time we do it all online!

We have calculated that we need around € 13.000 to have our album properly produced, pressed and promoted. This is what we will approximately spend the money on:

  • Studio + producer; recording, mixing, mastering: € 5000
  • CD pressing, product, distribution: € 2500
  • Graphic design; photos, flyers, stickers: € 500
  • Press, promo, merchandise, video: € 5000

What is in it for you?

In return for your support we have various rewards for you! On the right side of this page you can select one of the "perks" we offer. In any case: everyone who donates € 15 or more will get to download Only Irie Vibes and everyone who donates €20 or more will receive Only Irie Vibes on CD as soon as it’s released. Thanks a billion for your support!

Share Only Irie Vibes

If you can't contribute financially, respect, you can still show your support by sharing our campaign with as many people as possible! And also if you have something that we could offer as a reward, don't hesitate to contact us.

Find us online:

Leah Rosier
website: leahrosier.com
youtube: youtube.com/user/likkleGreen
soundcloud: soundcloud.com/leah-rosier
facebook: facebook.com/LeahRosier.music
twitter: @LeahRosier
instagram: @leahrosier

Rise & Shine
website: tidouz.com/riseNshine
youtube: youtube.com/user/riseandshineband
soundcloud: soundcloud.com/riseandshineband
facebook: facebook.com/riseandshineband
twitter: @RiseShineband


-----------------------------------------------


 EN FRANÇAIS:

Permettez à une chanteuse hollandaise et un groupe français de réaliser leur album ONLY IRIE VIBES !


Only Irie Vibes ?

"Irie" (ai-ri /i'-ree) est un terme jamaïcain qui signifie "bien, bon, ok, positif". Et c'est exactement ce que l'on souhaite faire : partager des bonnes "vibes" (vibrations), "only irie vibes" = "que des bonnes vibes".


Qui sommes nous ?

Leah Rosier, originaire d'Amsterdam, est passionnée de reggae et associe à cela son amour pour le chant et la plume. Avec un bon état d'esprit et déterminée à partager de bonnes vibes où qu'elle soit, Leah s'est déjà produite sur différentes scènes en Europe comme les festivals Reggae Sun Ska (FR) et Future Reggae Ruigoord (NL) mais aussi plus récemment en Jamaïque où elle a été invité par King Yellowman à chanter à l'un de ses concerts. Elle a également joué en première partie d'artistes comme Israël Vibration, Ziggy Marley, Etana ou encore Groundation.

Après avoir appris à s'enregistrer par ses propres moyens, elle a réalisé plusieurs titres sur des riddims* venant de différents producteurs et de groupes partout à travers le monde. Elle a sorti son premier album "High Paw" en 2012 sur son propre label "Likkle Green". A Amsterdam, Leah collabore avec l'association Black Star Foundation qui a pour but de promouvoir le reggae aux Pays-Bas depuis plus de dix ans.


Rise & Shine est un backing band** reggae né en 2011 originaire de Besançon et membre de l'association Uppertone (promotion et diffusion de la culture musicale jamaïcaine depuis 2003). Le groupe est composé de six musiciens expérimentés et un ingénieur du son/producteur. Ils ont déjà accompagné plusieurs artistes français sur scène tels que Yaniss Odua ou encore Nuttea. Ils sont également producteurs de riddims. Pour leurs deux précédents projets (Opus Riddim en 2011 et Pitaya Riddim en 2014) ils ont travaillé avec de nombreux artistes internationaux tels que Jah Mason, Queen Omega et Ricardo Clarke.


A propos de notre rencontre

Nous faisons du reggae ensemble depuis 2011, après avoir fait connaissance via les réseaux sociaux lorsque le groupe a proposé à Leah de poser sa voix sur son Opus Riddim. Cette première collaboration a donné les titres "Music Teach Me" et "Love Fyah" présents sur le premier album de Leah. C'est en mars 2012 que l'on s'est tous rencontrés lorsque Leah est venue passer trois semaines à Besançon afin de répéter pour nos premiers concerts le même mois.

Dès les premiers concerts, il y a eu une bonne connexion et une bonne entente entre nous, ce qui a découlé sur beaucoup de créativité mutuelle. Nous avons donc fait plusieurs concerts en France et en Suisse dans les bars et autres salles de concerts, puis avons été programmés dans plusieurs festivals (Swimming Poule, Cult'Urban, Festival de la Paille etc.). Nous avons joué par exemple en première partie de Danakil ou encore Mo'Kalamity. L'année dernière nous avons produit le titre de Leah "Enough Is Enough" sur le Pitaya Riddim, accompagné d'un clip. Toutes ces bonnes expériences, renforçant nos liens, nous ont naturellement menées à l'idée de faire un album ensemble.

A propos de l'album

L'année passée nous nous sommes penchés coeurs et âmes sur l'écriture de cet album et aujourd'hui, les derniers enregistrements sont en cours à Besançon au studio Le Zèbre. Nous sommes heureux de vous annoncer que cet album comptera deux featurings avec des artistes jamaïcains, enregistrés à Kingston pendant le séjour que Leah a passé sur l'île au courant de cette année. L'un avec le légendaire trio vocal "The Mighty Diamonds" et l'autre avec "Jahbar I", un artiste prometteur. Pendant ce voyage très productif en Jamaïque, Leah a enregistré deux autres duos et s'est produite sur scène à six reprises et en a ainsi profité pour enregistrer plusieurs vidéos.

Leah a enregistré un duo pour l'album au Anchor Studios à Kingston en Jamaïque.

La sortie de l'album est prévue pour l'automne 2015.
Afin de vous livrer notre musique dans les meilleures conditions possibles, nous vous remercions grandement d'avance si vous pouvez nous apporter votre soutien dans ce financement participatif. L'album comprendra 13 titres, tous sont des compositions originales qui nous sont chères. Only irie vibes !

Grâce à vous, nous pouvons réaliser Only Irie Vibes !

La dernière fois que Leah Rosier a réalisé avec succès une campagne de financement participatif, malheureusement des personnes mal intentionnées ont eu vent de cela, sont rentrées par effraction à son domicile, ont saccagé son appartement et ont volé les dons en liquide. C'est pourquoi cette fois-ci nous faisons tout en ligne !
Nous avons besoin d'un budget d'un peu plus de 13.000€ pour que cet album soit produit dans les meilleures conditions de A à Z. Voici notre budget, simplifié :


  • Studio + production (prises de son, mixage, mastering) : 5000€
  • Graphisme : 500€
  • Pressage, SDRM : 2500€
  • Communication, presse, merchandising, clip : 5000€

Quelles sont les contreparties ?

En échange de votre soutien financier, nous avons plusieurs contreparties pour vous. Sur le côté droit de cette page vous pouvez sélectionner le montant du don que vous souhaitez nous faire et jeter un oeil sur les contreparties. Pour un don de 15€ ou plus vous recevrez Only Irie Vibes en format digital (téléchargeable). Pour un don de 20€ ou plus vous recevrez Only Irie Vibes en CD dès qu'il sera sorti.


Partagez Only Irie Vibes

Si vous ne pouvez pas contribuer financièrement à ce projet, vous pouvez toujours nous soutenir en partageant cette campagne tout autour de vous et avec le plus de personnes possible ! De même, si vous avez quelque chose que nous pourrions offrir en guise de contrepartie, n'hésitez pas à nous contacter. 

Merci mille fois pour votre soutien !


Retrouvez-nous sur le web:

Leah Rosier
website: leahrosier.com 
youtube: youtube.com/user/likkleGreen 
soundcloud: soundcloud.com/leah-rosier 
facebook: facebook.com/LeahRosier.music 
twitter: @LeahRosier 
instagram: @leahrosier 

Rise & Shine 
website: tidouz.com/riseNshine 
youtube: youtube.com/user/riseandshineband 
soundcloud: soundcloud.com/riseandshineband 
facebook: facebook.com/riseandshineband 
twitter: @RiseShineband 


*riddim = équivalent de l'anglais "rhythm", ce mot venant du patois jamaïcain est très utilisé dans le milieu reggae pour signifier entre autres "version instrumentale".

**backing band = un "backing" est un groupe de musiciens (sans chanteur attitré) pouvant accompagner différents chanteurs et interprétant leur répertoire, comprenez donc "interprètes".

We've done many gigs in France and Switzerland in bars, clubs and other venues and also at festivals like Swimming Poule, Cult’Urban and Festival de la Paille. We've opened for French acts like Danakil and Mo'Kalamity. Last year we made a video for Leah's song Enough Is Enough on Rise & Shine's Pitaya Riddim. All this productivity and our strong bond naturally led into making an album together.
Our album: Only Irie VibesThe past
year we've put our heart and soul in writing this album and right now the final
recordings are happening at studio Le Zèbre in Besançon, France. It brings joy to say that our album
includes two collaborations with Jamaican artists recorded in Kingston, where
Leah Rosier went earlier this year. One with the legendary vocal group The
Mighty Diamonds and another with rising star Jahbar I. On this very productive
and inspirational trip to Jamaica, Leah recorded two more duets, performed six
times and shot a lot of video material.Leah Rosier recorded a duet for our album at Anchor Studios in Kingston, Jamaica.
The album release
is planned for autumn 2015. To be able to bring you our brand new music in the
best possible quality, we would highly appreciate your support in this
crowdfunding campaign to finance the final product: our full length album, 13 original songs, from the heart. Only irie vibes!
With your help we can realize Only Irie Vibes!
The previous
time Leah Rosier ran a successful crowdfunding campaign unfortunately some bad
minded people heard about it, broke into her home, made a big mess and stole
the donated cash. That's why this time we do it all online!
We have
calculated that we need around € 13.000 to have our album properly produced,
pressed and promoted. This is what we will approximately spend the money on:

Studio
     + producer; recording, mixing, mastering: € 5000
CD pressing,
     product, distribution: € 2500
Graphic
     design; photos, flyers, stickers: € 500
Press,
     promo, merchandise, video: € 5000

What is in it for you?In return for your support we have various rewards for you! On the right
side of this page you can select one of the "perks" we offer. In any case: everyone
who donates € 15 or more will get to download Only Irie Vibes and everyone who
donates €20 or more will receive Only Irie Vibes on CD as soon as it’s
released. Thanks a billion for your support!
Share Only Irie Vibes
If you can't contribute financially, respect, you can still show your
support by sharing our campaign with as many people as possible! And also if
you have something that we could offer as a reward, don't hesitate to contact
us.Find us online:Leah Rosierwebsite: leahrosier.com 
youtube: youtube.com/user/likkleGreen 
soundcloud: soundcloud.com/leah-rosier 
facebook: facebook.com/LeahRosier.music 
twitter: @LeahRosier 
instagram: @leahrosier 

Rise & Shine 
website: tidouz.com/riseNshine 
youtube: youtube.com/user/riseandshineband 
soundcloud: soundcloud.com/riseandshineband 
facebook: facebook.com/riseandshineband 
twitter: @RiseShineband 
-----------------------------------------------
 EN FRANÇAIS:Permettez à une chanteuse hollandaise et un groupe français de réaliser leur album ONLY IRIE VIBES !



Only Irie Vibes ?


"Irie" (ai-ri /i'-ree) est un
terme jamaïcain qui signifie "bien, bon, ok, positif". Et c'est
exactement ce que l'on souhaite faire : partager des bonnes "vibes"
(vibrations), "only irie vibes" = "que des bonnes vibes".Qui sommes nous ?
Leah Rosier, originaire d'Amsterdam,
est passionnée de reggae et associe à cela son amour pour le chant et la plume.
Avec un bon état d'esprit et déterminée à partager de bonnes vibes où qu'elle
soit, Leah s'est déjà produite sur différentes scènes en Europe comme les
festivals Reggae Sun Ska (FR) et Future Reggae Ruigoord (NL) mais aussi plus récemment en Jamaïque où elle a été invité par King
Yellowman à chanter à l'un de ses concerts. Elle a également joué en première
partie d'artistes comme Israël Vibration, Ziggy Marley, Etana ou encore
Groundation.
Après avoir appris à s'enregistrer par
ses propres moyens, elle a réalisé plusieurs titres sur des riddims* venant de
différents producteurs et de groupes partout à travers le monde. Elle a sorti
son premier album "High Paw" en 2012 sur son propre label
"Likkle Green". A Amsterdam, Leah collabore avec l'association Black Star Foundation qui a pour but de promouvoir le reggae aux Pays-Bas depuis plus de dix ans.
Rise & Shine est un backing
band** reggae né en 2011 originaire de Besançon et membre de l'association Uppertone (promotion et diffusion de la culture musicale jamaïcaine depuis 2003). Le groupe est composé de six musiciens expérimentés et un ingénieur du son/producteur. Ils ont déjà
accompagné plusieurs artistes français sur scène tels que Yaniss Odua ou encore
Nuttea. Ils sont également producteurs de riddims. Pour leurs deux précédents
projets (Opus Riddim en 2011 et Pitaya Riddim en 2014) ils ont travaillé avec
de nombreux artistes internationaux tels que Jah Mason, Queen Omega et Ricardo Clarke.A propos de notre rencontre
Nous faisons du reggae ensemble depuis
2011, après avoir fait connaissance via les réseaux sociaux lorsque le
groupe a proposé à Leah de poser sa voix sur son Opus Riddim. Cette première
collaboration a donné les titres "Music Teach Me" et "Love
Fyah" présents sur le premier album de Leah. C'est en mars 2012 que
l'on s'est tous rencontrés lorsque Leah est venue passer trois semaines à
Besançon afin de répéter pour nos premiers concerts le même mois.Dès les premiers concerts, il
y a eu une bonne connexion et une bonne entente entre nous, ce qui a découlé
sur beaucoup de créativité mutuelle. Nous avons donc fait plusieurs concerts en
France et en Suisse dans les bars et autres salles de concerts, puis avons été
programmés dans plusieurs festivals (Swimming Poule, Cult'Urban, Festival de la
Paille etc.). Nous avons joué par exemple en première partie de Danakil ou
encore Mo'Kalamity. L'année dernière nous avons produit le titre de Leah "Enough
Is Enough" sur le Pitaya Riddim, accompagné d'un clip. Toutes ces bonnes expériences, renforçant nos liens, nous ont naturellement menées à l'idée de faire un album ensemble.
A propos de l'album

L'année passée nous nous sommes penchés
coeurs et âmes sur l'écriture de cet album et aujourd'hui, les derniers
enregistrements sont en cours à Besançon au studio Le Zèbre. Nous sommes
heureux de vous annoncer que cet album comptera deux featurings avec des
artistes jamaïcains, enregistrés à Kingston pendant le séjour que Leah a passé
sur l'île au courant de cette année. L'un avec le légendaire trio vocal "The
Mighty Diamonds" et l'autre avec "Jahbar I", un artiste prometteur. Pendant ce voyage très productif en Jamaïque, Leah a
enregistré deux autres duos et s'est produite sur scène à six reprises et en a
ainsi profité pour enregistrer plusieurs vidéos.Leah a enregistré un duo pour l'album au Anchor Studios à Kingston en Jamaïque.
La sortie de l'album est prévue pour
l'automne 2015.
Afin de vous livrer notre musique dans les meilleures conditions possibles,
nous vous remercions grandement d'avance si vous pouvez nous apporter votre
soutien dans ce financement participatif. L'album comprendra 13 titres,
tous sont des compositions originales qui nous sont chères. Only irie vibes !
Grâce à vous, nous pouvons réaliser Only
Irie Vibes !
La dernière fois que Leah Rosier a
réalisé avec succès une campagne de financement participatif, malheureusement
des personnes mal intentionnées ont eu vent de cela, sont rentrées par
effraction à son domicile, ont saccagé son appartement et ont volé les dons en
liquide. C'est pourquoi cette fois-ci nous faisons tout en ligne ! Nous
avons besoin d'un budget d'un peu plus de 13.000€ pour que cet album soit
produit dans les meilleures conditions de A à Z. Voici notre budget, simplifié
:

Studio + production (prises de son, mixage, mastering) : 5000€

Graphisme : 500€

Pressage, SDRM : 2500€

Communication, presse, merchandising, clip : 5000€


Quelles sont les contreparties ?
En échange de votre soutien financier,
nous avons plusieurs contreparties pour vous. Sur le côté droit de cette page
vous pouvez sélectionner le montant du don que vous souhaitez nous faire et
jeter un oeil sur les contreparties. Pour un don de 15€ ou plus vous
recevrez Only Irie Vibes en format digital (téléchargeable). Pour un don de 20€
ou plus vous recevrez Only Irie Vibes en CD dès qu'il sera sorti.
Partagez Only Irie Vibes

Si vous ne pouvez pas contribuer
financièrement à ce projet, vous pouvez toujours nous soutenir en partageant
cette campagne tout autour de vous et avec le plus de personnes possible ! De
même, si vous avez quelque chose que nous pourrions offrir en guise de
contrepartie, n'hésitez pas à nous contacter. Merci mille fois pour votre soutien !Retrouvez-nous sur le web:Leah Rosierwebsite: leahrosier.com youtube: youtube.com/user/likkleGreen soundcloud: soundcloud.com/leah-rosier facebook: facebook.com/LeahRosier.music twitter: @LeahRosier instagram: @leahrosier Rise & Shine website: tidouz.com/riseNshine youtube: youtube.com/user/riseandshineband soundcloud: soundcloud.com/riseandshineband facebook: facebook.com/riseandshineband twitter: @RiseShineband 
*riddim = équivalent de l'anglais
"rhythm", ce mot venant du patois jamaïcain est très utilisé dans le
milieu reggae pour signifier entre autres "version instrumentale". 
**backing band = un "backing"
est un groupe de musiciens (sans chanteur attitré) pouvant accompagner
différents chanteurs et interprétant leur répertoire, comprenez donc
"interprètes".

story:
“We are Arise Band, living in the sunny city of Durban in the vibrant country of South Africa. Arise is a band that could be described as many things but we see ourselves as a group of young, passionate Christians who write music about what is close to our hearts. With many musical influences at work in our personal lives, we find a fresh and vibrant sound emerging as we play together”

We are currently working on our first full-length album following our debut EP “Jesus Is” which was released in July 2013. The band is working with esteemed Producer Nik Fairclough who produced the award winning “Life and Times of Absolute Truth” album by band Tree63. Nik has also worked with artists such as Chris Tomlin, Matt Redman as well as one of our own friends, Tim Hughes.

An album for any band is a timestamp of their journey and aims to capture some of the life and passion of the music that they create. For our upcoming album we are excited to not only lay down the songs that we have been writing but to more importantly release anthems that will strengthen the church and inspire those who might be on a journey to finding Jesus. We are trusting for the words and music in this album to reach far beyond our feet and to lift up a sound that we could not match, as voices from around the world make these lyrics their own personal war cries.

WHAT WE NEED

Albums cost money, as we are sure that people know. Just how much money is up to the band itself in a lot of regards. One could record in their bedroom and make it huge like Owl City, or you could go to Abbey Road and come out sounding like the Beatles. We are aiming to capture these songs in the best way that we possibly can and that will be costing us a chunk of money. We are asking for your help to cover our costs of producing a quality product and distributing it around the country. Here is a list of what the funds we raise will go towards:

  • Studio time
  • Mixing and mastering
  • Replication and printing of albums
  • Marketing 
  • Distribution
  • Merch for the album
We are not sitting back expecting for the money to fall out of the sky and so the amount we are aiming to raise on indiegogo is a portion of the album cost. We have been saving, working and raising the rest on our own so basically we are asking you to join us in funding the album and not simply asking you to fund it alone.

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

We totally understand that some of you might not be able to contribute but here are are some other ways that you can help out:

  • Share our campaign with any friends, family or anyone else you know
  • Tell everyone about the album.
  • Pray for us
  • If you have any questions please contact us through our website: www.ariseministries.co.za 

Thank you for reading,

THE ARISE TEAM.

story:
The video you just saw above is the mission and vision of SAGIP. A movement (which I am a part of) that inspired this INDIEGOGO project.


WHAT IS SAGIP?

SAGIP, in English, means RESCUE or SAVE. This is exactly what the movement aims to accomplish. To rescue and save the Filipino nation from total destruction due to corruption. Living in the Philippines, it is not hard to notice the never-ending vicious cycle of corruption which exists in all levels of society. Civilians, businessmen, government officials, big, small, rich, poor, etc. No one is exempted. Every Filipino desires progress for his/her nation for sure. Who wouldn't? But when it comes to action, nobody seems to be interested in 'walking the talk'. People (regardless of their social class) would almost always pursue their own self-interest in matters concerning society. The effects to the Philippine society are not good. They're terrible. 

This is the reason why SAGIP is born. To combat the disease spreading in the Philippines. SAGIP believes that with true unity, the Filipino people can save and rescue the nation.

HOW?

SAGIP makes use of one particular medium to accomplish what it wants to accomplish: MUSIC. 

WHY MUSIC?

 Music is a powerful medium, even a catalyst to unite people together specially those sharing the same sentiments or vision. Filipinos all ever the world love music. Whether they live in the city or rural areas, music is part of their lives. From children to adults ,Filipinos are known to love singing and some made it big time globally. Thus we see music as a means to activate every Filipino as a mover for change which gave birth to this project. Given the right message of a song, they will likely catch the vision to be a change mover for the nation.

SAGIP wishes to use music in order to do the following:

  • To stir up Filipinos and show them the full reality of the state of their nation. 
  • To show them (whether they be politicians, normal citizens, etc.) the things they are doing wrong which, in turn, hinders true progress.  
  • To encourage all Filipinos to help their country break away from the vicious cycle of corruption that has been plaguing the Philippines since who-knows-when.

MUSIC CREATED...SO FAR

SAGIP has been able to release 4 songs so far. Thanks to contributing artist: Maralita. The songs were independently released since  there seems to be no local record label interested in distributing songs like these. The four songs can be heard through SAGIP's YouTube channel. To hear the songs. please go to the link below -
SAGIP YouTube Page

THE PLAN

So what does SAGIP want to do now? 
Release a hit song and make an EP album that will include this new song plus all the other past songs released under SAGIP. The plans for the new song are as follows:
  • To produce the possible hit song using a powerful and hard-hitting genre: Rock-Rap. This genre is popular especially among the Filipino youth: the nation's future leaders.
  • To give it a message that will wake -up Filipinos and make them see the disease called corruption afflicting their country as the worst epidemic.  
  • To deal with all levels of corruption in the country  (government, lower-government, corporate and citizen).
  • To release the song prior to the 2016 elections (hopefully the song inspires them to be better decision makers when the election comes).
  • To collaborate with 3 of the most influential rap artists in the Philippines. The plan is to make them deliver the rap parts of the song. 
  • To make a music video of the song. A visual support to the message of the song. 
  • To market the song full-blast so that all may hear of the message contained in it. What use is the message if it will not be heard?

WHY SAGIP NEEDS YOU HELP

Making music purely out of love for country & not for the financial satisfaction of local record labels is a hard task. It remains to be an unattractive venture for local record labels whose main goal is profits (just like all the other businesses). This forces SAGIP to operate independently. The movement is able to create and release songs due to the personal and heartfelt contributions of artists and all the other people in it. 

For SAGIP to survive and be able to create more music for the country, it needs the help of more people who share the same stand and sentiment as SAGIP's. SAGIP invites you to be a part of the movement. Support SAGIP and help the movement stir up more Filipinos through music.

WHERE YOUR CONTRIBUTIONS WILL GO

Music - recording, mixing, arrangement, featured artists' talent fees, & musicians' talent fees. We want the music itself to be a masterpiece carefully crafted to perfection. It must tackle all the issues aimed to be dealt with and it must be arranged in such a way that it will leave a mark to the listener. A good mark. 

Music Video - production (filming, props, talent fees, equipment rental, wardrobe, set design, etc.) & post-production costs (Editing, visual FX, color correction, etc.). Similar to the music, it is our desire that the music video be produced with flying colors. Something that will not escape the attention of the viewer. The best will be done in order to visually communicate the message of the song efficiently and effectively. The music video will consume most of the budget that will be gathered for this project. 

Marketing - We want to make sure that the song and its music video reach as many Filipinos as possible. Hence, the team behind SAGIP will be making use of radio (which is still quite a powerful entity in the music industry of the Philippines) and YouTube in spreading the song. Radio tours, social media promotions and YouTube promotion tactics will be employed. 

EP Album - Mastering, Album Art & CD replication. The new song will be compiled with SAGIP's existing songs and the factors mentioned are the ones that will incur costs.

THE TEAM

Meet the team:

Maralita

Maralita, together with other artists will write, sing and collaborate, to get the song and music done. She's been writing songs for years,  both under and outside of SAGIP.

Mike Bon

Mike, another seasoned artist, composer, band leader, musical arranger and musical director among other things, is an added perk to this team.

Sockie Fernandez

'Direk Soc', as she is fondly called, is a seasoned film producer and director who has an impressive track record in the Philippines' advertising and film industry. She has won several awards for her works both for films and commercials .

Dodjie Garcia

Dodjie owns the recording studio (Independent Music Solutions, Inc.) where SAGIP recorded some of the songs under it. He has been supportive of SAGIP's projects and he will, for sure, continue to be so for this INDIEGOGO project. The video below shows Maralita recording in Dodjie Garcia's studio.


WHAT IF THIS CAMPAIGN DOESN'T GET FULLY FUNDED?

The funding type of this INDIEGOGO campaign is called Flexible Funding. Meaning, even if only a fraction of the funding goal is reached, contributors will still get charged. It wouldn't be an all-or-nothing scenario.

If the funding goal is not fully met, these are what the contributors can expect.

  • Contributors will receive a digital copy of SAGIP's existing songs.
  • If enough funds are raised to at least create the new song, it's digital copy will be sent to contributors, along with SAGIP's existing songs. 
  • If enough is raised to make both the new song and its music video, the contributors will receive its digital copy along with all of SAGIP's songs (including the new one), all in digital form.
We truly hope that this SAGIP campaign achieves its full goal. With our joint efforts, we can do it. 

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

Can't contribute through IndieGoGo? No problem. There are other ways you can contribute in order to further the cause of SAGIP. 

  • You can support SAGIP's Fabrily merchandise-campaign instead. It can be found in these links:
SAGIP's White merchandise
SAGIP's Black merchandise
  • You can spread this INDIEGOGO campaign to your friends and contacts who may be able to contribute.
  • You can help in spreading the music of SAGIP (the 4 songs plus the fifth, once it is done).
  •  You can help spread and promote SAGIP's FB and Twitter accounts so that SAGIP may be able to connect with more like-minded people. The links to these accounts are as follows.
Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/sagip2013
Twitter: https://twitter.com/sagipcommunity

The FIlipino nation is deeply submerged in corruption. Only we, together with those who truly love this nation, can help it rise once more and be worthy of global admiration. We may not be able to do much individually. But as a united people, we can accomplish much. MABUHAY ANG PILIPINAS!!!

Dodjie owns the recording studio (Independent Music Solutions, Inc.) where SAGIP recorded some of the songs under it. He has been supportive of SAGIP's projects and he will, for sure, continue to be so for this INDIEGOGO project. The video below shows Maralita recording in Dodjie Garcia's studio.


    WHAT IF THIS CAMPAIGN DOESN'T GET FULLY FUNDED?
The funding type of this INDIEGOGO campaign is called Flexible Funding. Meaning, even if only a fraction of the funding goal is reached, contributors will still get charged. It wouldn't be an all-or-nothing scenario.
If the funding goal is not fully met, these are what the contributors can expect.


Contributors will receive a digital copy of SAGIP's existing songs.
If enough funds are raised to at least create the new song, it's digital copy will be sent to contributors, along with SAGIP's existing songs. 
If enough is raised to make both the new song and its music video, the contributors will receive its digital copy along with all of SAGIP's songs (including the new one), all in digital form.

We truly hope that this SAGIP campaign achieves its full goal. With our joint efforts, we can do it. 
OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP Can't contribute through IndieGoGo? No problem. There are other ways you can contribute in order to further the cause of SAGIP. 


You can support SAGIP's Fabrily merchandise-campaign instead. It can be found in these links:

SAGIP's White merchandise

SAGIP's Black merchandise


You can spread this INDIEGOGO campaign to your friends and contacts who may be able to contribute.
You can help in spreading the music of SAGIP (the 4 songs plus the fifth, once it is done).

 You can help spread and promote SAGIP's FB and Twitter accounts so that SAGIP may be able to connect with more like-minded people. The links to these accounts are as follows.


Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/sagip2013

Twitter: https://twitter.com/sagipcommunity

   The FIlipino nation is deeply submerged in corruption. Only we, together with those who truly love this nation, can help it rise once more and be worthy of global admiration. We may not be able to do much individually. But as a united people, we can accomplish much. MABUHAY ANG PILIPINAS!!!

story:
WHO WE ARE

THEATRE OF ETERNAL VALUES CREATES THEATRE AND EVENTS THAT EXPRESS THE INNATE VALUES OF THE HUMAN SPIRIT.

THE DIVINE SYMPHONY ORCHESTRA WAS FORMED IN THE SAME SPIRIT IN 2014 WITH MUSICIANS FROM ALL OVER THE WORLD


WHAT WE DO

We tour the world with our own devised productions,  but we also have a home in Albera Ligure, Italy where we run an international arts academy and summer festival promoting creative interaction between cultures, the Culture of the Spirit Festival.

BREATHOFTHEEARTH.IT

IS A ONE-OF-A-KIND EVENT FOR EXPO IN MILAN, A CONCERT SHOW CELEBRATING THE LIFE ENERGY OF OUR PLANET AND WITHIN US. 

At the heart of this musical extravaganza, amidst the music of the elements, is humanity's search for inner peace, self-knowledge and joy. Our live performance gives 60 musicians, actors and singers from different nations the chance to collaborate and shine their talent; to awaken the inner life energy in all of us. The recording of the concert and show will be edited into a beautiful CD and VIDEO. 

We hope to raise $12,000 for:

  • THE TECHNICAL COSTS OF THE PRODUCTION 
  • TRAVEL EXPENSES OF 70 ARTISTS AND TECHNICAL CREW
  • AUDIO EQUIPMENT
  • TRANSPORT: COACH JOURNEYS FROM CABELLA-MILAN
  • PER DIEMS, LOCAL TAX, PERMITS AND INSURANCE
  • RECORDING AND VIDEO STREAMING
  • POST PRODUCTION FOR CD AND VIDEO

Breath of the Earth features new compositions and songs by: 

Emiliano Gabrieli, Carlo Gizzi, Tuomas Kantelinen, Dmitri Orlov, Kenny Clarys and Jeremy Clancy, Victor Vertunni

The words of: 

Shri Mataji Nirmala Devi, William Blake, Kahlil Gibran, Kabir, the Navaho Indians, the Essene brotherhood. Rumi, 

The Divine Symphony Orchestra is joined by the English baritone Tim Bruce and soprano Sunny Levi, soloists Davide Alogna (Violin) Romain Mollard (Bansuri flute), Hu Qi (Pipa), Hassan Samii (Tabla), Rachelle Jeanty (Singer-songwriter), Jeremy Clancy (Singer-songwriter), Victor Vertunni (Singer-songwriter)

Why we need your help

Funds have already been raised by the  SMNDSY World Foundation to cover the organization, rental of the spaces and promotion for the EXPO events, including the theatre in Milan for Breath of the Earth, but the main production costs are being raised by TEV.  So if you have given already for SY at Expo, rest assured that this is a separate appeal for the cultural activities that are not covered by that fund. 

We know that all of our friends can’t make it to Milano EXPO to enjoy the fruits of their patronage, and so we will share te livestarem of the event and  highlights from the concert recording with those of you who support this campaign.

Risks & Challenges

TEV 's THE LOVE THAT MOVES THE STARS ABOVE, with a 50 piece orchestra cost $18,000. The CD of the concert that was made as a reward for donations , covered not only the orchestra and production costs, but also raised funds for the Culture of the Spirit Festival. To put some perspective on this: inviting just one celebrated musician from another continent for a single evening concert can cost between $3,000- $5,000. We hope this event shows our vision for a more collective, multi-cultural, and unified world!  

THE LOVE THAT MOVES THE STARS ABOVE / L'AMOR CHE MOVE L'ALTE STELLE


Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute financially,  you can still help:

  • By Asking your friends to get the word out and make some noise about this crowdfunding campaign (posting on Facebook & twitter).
  • By reminding them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

    LInks: theatreofeternalvalues.com
    cultureofthespirit.com

story:
(See english translation below)

Dagsê!

Ek hoop julle het my klein filmpie hierbo geniet.

Luister, ons sukkel hier in Slangfontein. Dit het laas jaar glad nie gereën nie en die vee kla aanhoudend, maar dis nie hoekom ons mismoedig is nie.

Ons is mismoedig omdat die Radio Kalahari Orkes al vir jare elke Saterdagaand hier op die stoep sit en werk aan nuwe liedjies wat ons graag wil hê julle moet hoor. Van hulle is vastrap, ander is trane-trekkers, meeste van hulle is nogal kwaai.  Ons kan egter nie die deuntjies uitgee nie, want die die platebedryf, soos ons dit ken, het verdwyn soos 'n reenwolk in die hemel bo ons dorre ou plaasie.

Onlangs het ons Upington toe gery en wat vind ons daar? Die gebou wat eens ons platemaatskappy gehuisves het staan leeg. Al wat oorgebly het is stof en stukkende vensters en ’n dronkie wie seg gaan huistoe! Die musiek bedryf het sy gat gesien! Het julle takhare nog nie van free downloads gehoor nie?

Met ‘n stukkende boerehart en knop in die keel klim ons in ons ou bakkie en ry huistoe. Op die stoep vat ons ’n sluk mampoer. Ek vra: “Boys, kan julle dit glo?” en die ouens sug. In die verte staan 'n maer tollie stert innie lug, kou stof en klippies met ‘n bevoeterde gesig.

Eweskielik veskyn ou Kleinboet, skoolbaadjie en al, mooi gejelde hare en ’n broek wat te knap is om af te val. Hy staan en idle, opgewonde, soos ’n ou Ford kar. Hy wil weet waarom almal so mismoedig lyk. Ons verduidelik en Kleinboet lag. “Nee wat Oom Boet,” seg hy. “No need to be sad. Ek ken ’n nuwe nommer, iets nogal baie rad. Ons laaities noem dit “crowd funding”.

Soos ek die storie verstaan werk hierdie “crowd funding” so. Ons sê vir ons fans: “Broers en susters, ons het julle verskriklik lief. Julle het by ons gestaan en ons CD's gekoop en as die kar se petrol klaar was, het julle tot by ons shows geloop. Dis vir julle wat ons hierdie nuwe liedjies geskryf het, maar die platemaatskappy is in sy moer en ons het skaars ’n geldjie om die maer tollies te voer. Hoe maak ons nou?”

Hier’s die plan: Julle gee vir ons ’n ietsie, en ons gebruik dit om julle hêppie te maak. Boonop kry jy lekker presente - goed wat jy en slegs JY in die hande kan kry. Niemand anders nie. Nooit ooit.

Hier op die regterhand van die bladsy is van die sweeties uiteengesit, maar daar's nog baie meer.

Maar dit is nie net ’n nuwe CD wat ons belplan nie, ons wil veel meer aanpak.

RKO wil met ’n “drie-fase” aanslag vorendag kom. ’n Driepoot pot so te sê. Natuurlik sal ons eerstens die nuwe CD opneem, maar dié moet dan aan die Wêreld bekend gestel word.

Beleggers sal wil weet wat is ons bemarkingsplan. (Dit is noemenswaardig dat in Amerika die bemarkingsbegroting gewoonlik veel hoër is as die prduksiekoste: Sowat 60-40)

 Dit bring ons by die tweede fase; naamlik die produksie van drie films. ’n Dokumentêre film van die hele proses, en twee musiek videos. Nie net movies nie - spesiale flieks wat mense sal laat KYK en geniet.

Laastens die derde fase of te wel die Koeksuster op die koek.: Die opstal op R.K.O se plaas was nog altyd die musiek, daarom het ons al klaar vir een van Afrikaans se grootste dramaturgte, Harry Kalmer, gevra om vir ons ’n splinternuwe verhoogstuk te skryf. Dit sal ons in staat stel om in die nabye toekoms iets oorspronklik en asemrowend vir gehore op te voer. 

Om seker te maak dat die geld vir die doeleindes gebruik word, het R.K.O. die ouditeursmaatskappy Middel en Vennote aangestel om die hele projek offisieël te hanteer en al die boontjies tel, van begin tot einde.

http://www.middel.co.za

Ons wil dit doen. Ons gaan dit doen. As ons saamwerk kan ons die RKO ossewa bo-oor die donker bult sleep tot in 'n vrolike vallei waar daar 'n bier in elke hand is en 'n braai onder elke boom en lekker RKO noveau-vastrap wat uit elke ghetto blaster bulder.

Maar sonder julle kan ons niks verrig nie.

So, asseblief. Staan ons by. Word 'n RKO-venoot. Eendrag sal ons magtig maak.

Radio Kalahari Orkes - honderd jaar agter die tye, maar steeds op die spoor!

(English)

BOET SAYS, STAAN MY BY
 
Howzit mense:
 
I hope you smarked my little video up there.
 
Listen, life is a bit kak here in Slangfontein. It didn’t rain last year and the cows are complaining but that’s not why our hearts are broken.
 
Our hearts are broken because the Radio Kalahari Orkes has been sitting on this stoep every Saturday night for years now, grafting on kwaai new tunes that we really want you to hear. Some of these are vastrap. Some will make you cry. Most of them are actually quite lekker. But we can't get the tunes to you because the record business as we knew it has vanished.
 
Strues! We drove all the way to Upington the other day, only to find that the building where our record company used to be is empty. The wind is blowing dust around and the windows is broken and there’s nobody there but this old dronkie who laughs at us and tunes, go home, ouens. We say, why? And he says, because the record business has seen its gat! Nobody buys music anymore. They get it from free internet downloads. Go home!
 
So right there our hopes were dashed and our hearts were broken. We got back in the bakkie and drove home and sat down on the stoep with a bottle of mampoer. I said, can you believe it, boys? Everyone sighed. Then we just sat here, looking at the thin cows munching gravel in the desert and sipping mampoer to fight our feelings of mismoedigheid.  
 
We were still sitting here when Kleinboet came home from high school and started tuning us about this new invention called crowd funding. Crowd funding is where we say, listen, mense, we love you, and we think – we hope – that you love us, too. At least a bit. We love playing at your church fetes and rugby club parties, and we’d just love to make another CD for you so we can all love each other even more. But the record industry is finished, so how?
 
Let me speak from the heart. We are the Radio Kalahari Orkes, the okes who found a new way of playing Afrikaans music on old plaasgereedskap, e.g. violins, konsertinas and banjos. You are the okes who found us and bought our CDs and came to our shows. If we join together, we can pull the RKO oxwagon over the hill of bitter setback and into a happy place where there’s RKO music in the air and a beer in every hand and a braai under every doringboom.
 
Here’s how it works. You give us some dosh, and we use it to make you happy. On top of that, you get lekker presents– stuff that only YOU will be able to get. Just you. No one else, never, ever.  
 
If you look on the right you can see some of it, but there’s much more.
 
The funding also goes to the following: Harry Kalmer is writing a musical for RKO, so there will be tickets for that. And special offers on stuff like our old albums or the DVD of our cult movie, Die Geheim Van Slangfontein, described by The Citizen as “the best film ever made in South Africa.” We’ll also be making some new YouTube videos, and of course there will be a new RKO CD full of anti-austerity vastrap numbers and saamstaan anthems for trying times.

We also expect you as investors to be interested in the finincail dilligence of the project, that the money invested is spent on the production of this album, the films and the stage play.  To this end we have asked the auditing firm Middel and Partners to oversee the production from begining to end.

http://www.middel.co.za

We want to do this, mense. We are dying to do it. But we can’t do it without you.
 
So please. Staan ons by. Become our partners. Together we can do it!
 
Radio Kalahari Orkes. A hundred years behind the times but still in the game!

story:
They say it takes a lifetime to put out your first album and as I prepare to release this project to the world, this statement couldn't feel more true. A journey from New York City to Berlin to Cologne to Stockholm has led me to this point, asking for your support, in order to give a voice and a platform to a new and refreshing sound available to be experienced by people everywhere.  

I've spent the last two years conceptualizing this piece, inspired by the vibrant nightlife of Berlin and New York, and the storytelling power that exists inside of house and techno music. And now I am in the process of developing a team, which is passionate about the music and the vision,  allowing  for the successful release of this project....
UP THE DOWNSTAIRCASE 
Up The Downstaircase is a collection of 12 tracks carefully crafted and written by myself, produced alongside a brilliant roster of International DJ/Producers from Berlin, Cologne, Leipzig, and Toronto. Beatkind, Bellville, Fennec and Wolf, K-Sonik, Liftboi, Vincent Stefansson, Sebastian Dittrich, and  Martin Tugendhat have worked with me to create this world that takes place in three parts.
1) The Night
2) The Nightlife
3) Sunrise
Visual inspiration from the project is now on my evolving Pinterest:
https://www.pinterest.com/iamseanbradford/

What We Need & What You Get
I am seeking to raise a total of $10,000 USD for this project..which will be used to design, craft, and promote this album.  Since I am working with a much  smaller budget than most label releases, the objective is to use all resources available to ensure  the success of this project.  For example, I will shoot and edit the initial music videos.
The plan is to release the full album in early summer 2015, with two singles and videos preceding this starting in April.  Though the album will be available everywhere via digital distribution,  there is a focus specifically on Sweden and Scandanavian Markets for promotion as my management team and I believe a very  positive response will come from this region, where I have a series of shows lining up throughout the summer. Scandanavia has always been supportive and open to new artists and since 2008, is also one of the only markets to show continual growth in the music industry.
As part of #gogobradford, you are supporting  the final stages of music production, initial pr and marketing campaigns (which are crucial for people being able to discover the music), distribution and release of two singles before the album, creation of two music videos (which I will direct), as well as designers to assist with album artwork and merchandise creation.
Everything raised will help steer this project towards creating a serious impact upon release.

The Impact

My success as an artist in today's music industry only comes from the support of people like you. Yes, making good music is key, but the following steps (quality mastering, innovative video content, and strong marketing campaigns) are what truly give an artist  a voice. The support of fans has fueled and inspired me to keep dreaming, and the response from around Europe and The United States makes me confident that this is the right time to unveil this project.
My debut EP was successfully crowdfunded and led to a series of concerts, new collaborations with other artists, and opportunities that have set the release of my album up for huge potential. However, without the funding to spread the art, it will get lost along with the myriad of music released on a daily basis.

Risks & Challenges

The music industry is unpredictable, however I have worked hard to study competition, create a realistic music business plan and identify opportunities. My team is in the process of formation, and with the help of managers, booking agents, and creatives, we will be able to have a unique opportunity to push through the market.  In addition, I am currently working on other projects with production teams around the world, which shows there is a demand and desire for my sound and style.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you are unable to directly contribute, sharing this campaign, posting about the music, and encouraging others to support are all incredibly valuable. I thank you in advance for believing in me, and together we will be able to create and unstoppable team. These are things that are non monetary that also help!
1) I am trying to build my fan base so you can show support by becoming a fan at: facebook.com/iamseanbradford
2) I am looking for a label to help release and promote the album
3) I want to play live shows and am looking for a booking agent and/or opportunities to do so worldwide
4) I'm looking for producers to remix music from the upcoming album
5)  I love art and collaboration and interested in doing so across various platforms. If you have an idea, message me at info@iamseanbradford.com

With love,
Sean Bradford
story_txt:
They say it takes a lifetime to put out your first album and as I prepare to release this project to the world, this statement couldn't feel more true. A journey from New York City to Berlin to Cologne to Stockholm has led me to this point, asking for your support, in order to give a voice and a platform to a new and refreshing sound available to be experienced by people everywhere.  


I've spent the last two years conceptualizing this piece, inspired by the vibrant nightlife of Berlin and New York, and the storytelling power that exists inside of house and techno music. And now I am in the process of developing a team, which is passionate about the music and the vision,  allowing  for the successful release of this project....


UP THE DOWNSTAIRCASE 

Up The Downstaircase is a collection of 12 tracks carefully crafted and written by myself, produced alongside a brilliant roster of International DJ/Producers from Berlin, Cologne, Leipzig, and Toronto. Beatkind, Bellville, Fennec and Wolf, K-Sonik, Liftboi, Vincent Stefansson, Sebastian Dittrich, and  Martin Tugendhat have worked with me to create this world that takes place in three parts.

1) The Night
2) The Nightlife
3) Sunrise
Visual inspiration from the project is now on my evolving Pinterest:
https://www.pinterest.com/iamseanbradford/


What We Need & What You Get


I am seeking to raise a total of $10,000 USD for this project..which will be used to design, craft, and promote this album.  Since I am working with a much  smaller budget than most label releases, the objective is to use all resources available to ensure  the success of this project.  For example, I will shoot and edit the initial music videos.

The plan is to release the full album in early summer 2015, with two singles and videos preceding this starting in April.  Though the album will be available everywhere via digital distribution,  there is a focus specifically on Sweden and Scandanavian Markets for promotion as my management team and I believe a very  positive response will come from this region, where I have a series of shows lining up throughout the summer. Scandanavia has always been supportive and open to new artists and since 2008, is also one of the only markets to show continual growth in the music industry.

As part of #gogobradford, you are supporting  the final stages of music production, initial pr and marketing campaigns (which are crucial for people being able to discover the music), distribution and release of two singles before the album, creation of two music videos (which I will direct), as well as designers to assist with album artwork and merchandise creation.
Everything raised will help steer this project towards creating a serious impact upon release.

My success as an artist in today's music industry only comes from the support of people like you. story:
It is TIME!

My name is Vivian Gail, and I am a professional singer.  I have produced three albums and three singles since 2005.  However, I have not had a project since 2011!!  I am excited to announce that I am going to record a new album entitled, "Mellow."  This album will be a compilation of original and cover music that is all very beautiful and relaxing.

This campaign is dedicated to raising funds for the costs required to created an album.  All money raised will go towards the costs of paying musicians, recording engineers, and duplication costs.

Words cannot express how grateful I have been throughout my career for the support of my friends and fans.  I ask you to please consider pre-purchasing your CD copy of the new album to make this dream a reality!

What I need and what you GET!

I need $2500 to record this album.

  • The $2500 goes towards all the expenses that are required when recording, including the arrangement of the songs, the rehearsal time, the studio time, the mixing and mastering of the tracks, and the duplication/production of the CDs.
  • When you donate, you get free perks!  If you donate at least $20, you will get an autographed CD from yours truly, and a very heartfelt handwritten thank you letter.  The more you donate, the cooler the perks become!  It you donate enough, you will be mentioned in the cd jacket, and you may even receive a vinyl of the new album!!  
  • All the funds raised will go towards the recording project, even if the total amount is not reached.  I will just keep working until the album is finished!  The more money I raise in this campaign, the sooner I can have the CD release party and thank you all personally!

Other Ways You Can Help

Please considering contributing to the campaign at any amount you can.  If that is not possible, then I ask you to please share the message on social media and to your friends and family!  

Thank you so very much,

Vivi.

story:
What happens when you put Emmy® winning artist Holly Henry and some great new songs into a world-class recording studio? And what if we add an awesome producer and talented musicians without a record company to dictate creative direction?  Let's find out!!!


UPDATE: New $5 perk - The Orchard EP Digital Download pre-order!!!

UPDATE: Every perk $10 and above also receives The Orchard EP digital download!!!

UPDATE: Now accepting PayPal, Credit & Bank Cards, and Apple Pay!

FYI: Perks will start being delivered when the campaign ends.


Hello =] Thank you so much for taking the time to read this xx

So. I’m going to record a four song EP The Orchard… and my first music video. I’ve been obsessing over this project for months so let me start from the beginning

It is very rare that I write songs and care about them for more than a month or so. Usually, I move on pretty quickly and leave my past creations to wilt. One of the songs I wrote is called “Foolish Heart” and it didn’t get added to my collection of dusty old songs. In fact, I’m as excited about it today as I was the day I wrote it. Now, I know that I m building it up quite a bit. But, I truly think it’s something you will love. It’s a lot like what I’ve written in the past in that it has a district melody, is sufficiently original, and is catchy but it’s also like nothing I’ve ever written before. The lyrics are less strange and cryptic and you might even place it in the genre of “Pop”. BUT don’t let that scare you. You know me, I hate writing something that sounds like anything else. 

The song Foolish Heart is about loving someone and not being sure if they love you back. You have this thought or feeling stuck inside your brain: Maybe, even if it’s just a .5% chance, maybe they love you back. And, it’s a rather exciting feeling, but you also feel quite pathetic and desperate at the same time. It’s an odd mental and emotional predicament and I think it’s something most of us can understand. 

This person is all you think about and all you really want and in your brain you know it’s simply ridiculous to obsess over something that may never happen. BUT it’s the heart that drives us to madness. See, our mind knows better, but the heart…

The heart is foolish. 

I had an uncommonly clear mental picture/story when I wrote this song…which is odd because usually when I write it’s about a couple different things. It has it’s own little world. That’s where the idea of a music video was born.  

After I wrote Foolish Heart I began to write more music than I ever had. The other songs on The Orchard are both reminiscent of past releases but also new and unexplored. The Orchard EP will include, collaborations, happy songs, sad songs, an incredible producer (he produced Hide and Seek), general artsy-ness, new themes, enhanced lyrics and melodies, cool artwork, and so much more. I literally cannot wait to show you. 

THIS is when we decided to do the Indie-Go-Go

The statistics are: 

$20,000+ for both a 4-song EP AND a music video BY APRIL 10th 2015

This would cover:

-travel

-production of the 4 songs

-musicians

-production of the video

-directing of the video

-script

-costumes

-advertising

-extras

-location

-marketing

 etc etc etc! 

And more cool news is if we raise even more than $20,000…we will create even more content! Maybe a 6 song EP! Or another music video! The options are endless =] 

This project is me. I’ve had a whole year to think it thorough, come up with ideas, and create. I’m ready, now. It’s time to start doing. 

Let’s think of a good analogy to end this novel….My past music has been the humble embers of a quiet fire and this new EP and video will coax the flames up, lighting the way to new opportunities for perhaps a full length album, tours, and more! This project is the first stepping stone…and I need your help. You have supported me, stood by me, encouraged me, and made me who I am today (as cliche as that sentence is). Thank you so SO much. I feel honored to be followed by such wonderful people. I hope this project makes you excited and ready for an incredible future together. 

xx-Holly 

PS. Take a quick look at the prizes aka bribes to your right ——> 



Here's my latest cover!

This project is the first stepping stone…and I need your help. You have supported me, stood by me, encouraged me, and made me who I am today (as cliche as that sentence is). Thank you so SO much. I feel honored to be followed by such wonderful people. I hope this project makes you excited and ready for an incredible future together. 
xx-Holly 
PS. Take a quick look at the prizes aka bribes to your right ——> Here's my latest cover!

story:
The Debut Studio Album Project Part 2

Music has always been a huge part of my life. I come from a musical family, where all of my siblings played an instrument, and sang, including my gospel singing parents. It was at an early age when I got my voice singing in the family band. I knew singing was my gift. I eventually went on to perform in music

festivals, gospel choirs, bands, etc. in my young adult years. Life was good and I so enjoyed singing wherever, anyone would have me. My career took off fast, however, I made the decision to get married and start my family. My priority was to be a great mom and I did not see a way that would allow me to

meet the needs of my children, and focus on the demands of a career in the music industry at the same time. I have three amazing children that are now my backup singers; well, at least two of them. My youngest son is not quite there yet as a singer, but he is on track to be my keyboardist in the future. Yes, I have amazing children.

So, I returned to the music scene and began performing once again. I had the honor to perform before over 25,000 fans at the Tony Gwynn Memorial Tribute, open up for red hot jazz guitarist Nick Colionne and join in the recording studio with jazz great Eloise Laws just to name a few milestones. I also, had the pleasure of singing for former first lady, Laura Bush, and the wedding of Gold Medalist, soccer great, Alex Morgan. I have shared the stage with many national recording artists. I gained a great fan base and sold out shows. I’m often asked after shows if I have music to purchase and I’ve had to say no. Now, I am taking the next steps so I will never have to say no again.

I have some of the greatest songwriters and musicians joining me on this project. My producer is Grammy Winner Kamau Kenyatta, who received a 2014 Grammy for producing best jazz vocals album “Liquid Spirit” by jazz artist Gregory Porter. I am so excited to work with Kamau and others to deliver my first album “I Still Love You”. The title song was written by my dear friend and Grammy winner, Jaymes Felix. Jaymes is a composer, musician, songwriter, and former lead singer of Tower of Power. He also sang with Gospels legend, Andrae Crouch. Finally, Pamela Sawyer, Motown songwriter whose music credits include, "Love Child", "If I Were Your Woman” has written a few songs for the album.

While I've been able to cover  a good portion of the costs of recording "I Still Love You" on my own, when you are recording at this quality, costs up add rapidly! Your donation to Daneen Wilburn’s Debut Studio Album Part 2 will go towards the following costs:

  1. Pre-production: This is an important step standard in any commercial recording project. Kamau and I will start by discussing arrangements, examine lyrics and structure, and establish a plan for how additional instrumentation will be utilized.
  2. Musicians & Recording: Next, Kamau and I will hire some of the best musicians to play various instruments bringing to life the heart of this album. 
  3. Mixing & Mastering: Each track will be mixed to add excitement and nuance to the compositions. The final step for the album will be mastered from beginning to end, to ensure your listening ears have a great experience.
  4. CD pressing and promotion

Please also don't hesitate to share this campaign and check out some great perks too! There are social media share buttons here on this page--and please tell your friends how grateful we are for this support. “I Still Love You”.

All my love,

Daneen

story:
Avon Faire has just finished their debut album,“Riddles and Love Songs”, an 11-song collection of beautiful, traditional UK and Irish folk songs, sung in rich, 3-part harmony. And it's available now! 

We are so excited about our new record; and we've created this page to sell CDs and T-Shirts and all kinds of special offers and incentives for you to enjoy - Thank you for your support!

The Story of Avon Faire:

Avon Faire is a female trio, inspired to sing in 3-part harmony & play traditional UK & Irish folk, Renaissance & Medieval, and folk/pop songs.  

In New York City, Andriette Redmann asked friends Betsy Long and Kath Green to join her in a journey of singing beloved songs. In the first minute of hearing how we sounded together, Avon Faire was born. After rehearsing, researching, working out guitars and percussion, and having many laughs and heart-to-hearts, we began performing in community gardens, art openings and holiday events, and garnered our first fans.

In the summer of 2015, Avon Faire embarked on a mini-tour of England: the historic Walter de Cantelupe Inn near Worcester; Bristol’s Arnolfini Gallery for an opening of internationally renowned artist (and Betsy's dad!) Richard Long; The Loxwood Joust in Sussex, a 2 weekend medieval festival where Avon Faire performed 4 sets per day, opening for the lauded Mediaeval Baebes; and in Cornwall for a sold-out show at the lovely Tremenheere Sculpture Gardens. The tour was a success, with enthusiastic audiences, new friends of all ages, and the enjoyment of the magical countryside, scenes reminiscent of lyrics in the songs.

Upon our return to NYC, we continued performing, including at Richard Long’s opening at the Sperone Westwater Gallery. We will play Summer Solstice events this June.

Avon Faire said yes to The Loxwood Joust’s invitation to return this August, 2016; so another English mini-tour is in the works, including London, to promote the new CD.

Avon Faire is working intensely in the recording studio with award-winning engineer, Roman Klun (Sarah McLachlan, Joan Osborne, Norah Jones) at “His House-Innsbruck Studios” in Brooklyn, NYC. 

The 11 songs of "Riddles and Love Songs" are a charming blend of classic, melodic, entertaining tales of love and mysteries, such as "All Around My Hat", “Riddles Wisely Expounded,” "T Stands For Thomas, I Suppose", "Salley Gardens“ and “Wild Mountain Thyme (Will Ye Go, Laddie, Go)”. We've fallen in love with the beauty of this music from centuries past, enjoyed creating arrangements around our voices, and are committed to passing this tradition of wonderful songs on to you. Their lyrics are deep in meaning, and still resonate today. 
 

What we are looking for: 

Our goal is to raise enough money to finish recording, mixing, mastering and producing this unique collection of 11 songs. We invite you to join us in our journey by offering you our fun, special incentives such as pre-ordering digital downloads, CD’s, T-shirts, patronage, etc.! 

Other ways you can help:

Thank you so much for your time and support. Please share this campaign with friends and family! People of all ages and musical tastes have responded to Avon Faire's music. We'd love the opportunity to bring these beautifully arranged, traditional songs to new fans! 

The songs:

Avon Faire - "Riddles and Love Songs"

1. All Around My Hat 
2. Cold Blow and the Rainy Night
3. Do You Love an Apple
4. He Moved Through The Fair
5. London
6. Riddles Wisely Expounded
7. Raggle Taggle Gypsy 
8. Salley Gardens 
9. T Stands For Thomas, I Suppose  
10. Who's The Fool Now? 
11. Wild Mountain Thyme (Will Ye Go, Laddie, Go)

After rehearsing, researching, working out guitars and percussion, and having many laughs and heart-to-hearts, we began performing in community gardens, art openings and holiday events, and garnered our first fans.
In the summer of 2015, Avon Faire embarked on a mini-tour of England: the historic Walter de Cantelupe Inn near Worcester; Bristol’s Arnolfini Gallery for an opening of internationally renowned artist (and Betsy's dad!) Richard Long; The Loxwood Joust in Sussex, a 2 weekend medieval festival where Avon Faire performed 4 sets per day, opening for the lauded Mediaeval Baebes; and in Cornwall for a sold-out show at the lovely Tremenheere Sculpture Gardens. The tour was a success, with enthusiastic audiences, new friends of all ages, and the enjoyment of the magical countryside, scenes reminiscent of lyrics in the songs.Upon our return to NYC, we continued performing, including at Richard Long’s opening at the Sperone Westwater Gallery. We will play Summer Solstice events this June.Avon Faire said yes to The Loxwood Joust’s invitation to return this August, 2016; so another English mini-tour is in the works, including London, to promote the new CD.Avon Faire is working intensely in the recording studio with award-winning engineer, Roman Klun (Sarah McLachlan, Joan Osborne, Norah Jones) at “His House-Innsbruck Studios” in Brooklyn, NYC. The 11 songs of "Riddles and Love Songs" are a charming blend of classic, melodic, entertaining tales of love and mysteries, such as "All Around My Hat", “Riddles Wisely Expounded,” "T Stands For Thomas, I Suppose", "Salley Gardens“ and “Wild Mountain Thyme (Will Ye Go, Laddie, Go)”. We've fallen in love with the beauty of this music from centuries past, enjoyed creating arrangements around our voices, and are committed to passing this tradition of wonderful songs on to you. Their lyrics are deep in meaning, and still resonate today.  
What we are looking for: 
Our goal is to raise enough money to finish recording, mixing, mastering and producing this unique collection of 11 songs. We invite you to join us in our journey by offering you our fun, special incentives such as pre-ordering digital downloads, CD’s, T-shirts, patronage, etc.! 
Other ways you can help:
Thank you so much for your time and support. Please share this campaign with friends and family! People of all ages and musical tastes have responded to Avon Faire's music. We'd love the opportunity to bring these beautifully arranged, traditional songs to new fans! 
The songs:
Avon Faire - "Riddles and Love Songs"
1. All Around My Hat 2. Cold Blow and the Rainy Night3. Do You Love an Apple4. He Moved Through The Fair5. London6. Riddles Wisely Expounded7. Raggle Taggle Gypsy 8. Salley Gardens 9. T Stands For Thomas, I Suppose  10. Who's The Fool Now? 11. Wild Mountain Thyme (Will Ye Go, Laddie, Go)

story:
Aloha from The Caretakers!

We need your help paying for recording costs! It takes a village...

  • My name is Ethan Swift and I started the band.
  • The other members include my beautiful girlfriend Deanna Claire Young, my multi-talented Bestie and Bass Player Ben Yahrus, the indomitable Larry Deck on hand percussion and on and off our musical friends from the Hilo community like Rick and Larry and William.  We always invite who ever comes by to play with us at all our performances.
  • I've have put my all into my song writing, musicianship and staying humble.  I realize music is nothing without people to share it with.  I can't want to show the world what I've spent the last 4 years cultivating out here on the most remote Island chain in the world.  I want these recordings to close the gap and bring us all wherever we are closer together.

You are now a part of our Ohana. That means family in Hawaiian.  When you choose to contribute to our music it becomes YOUR MUSIC.  You make it happen.  

We want recorded material to give to people.  Possibly sell, but its most important that people have it, period.  We don't have that right now and its been years of struggle trying to build a cohesive audience without being able to put anything in their hands to take home.  Almost as if the music never happened.  Lets put at end to our invisibility.

We may be far, but not in spirit.  Lets really see and hear each other. Lets close the gap, allow us to communicate our common joys of music, community and family through our songs and make the world a smaller and less silent place.
 
Until we get back to North American you will have something to remember us by. Think of your new recordings like a personalized hearable postcard.  We will never forget your contribution.

What We Want & What You Get

Breaking it down for everyone.

Recording equipment and time is expensive.  I spent $700 on recording 2 songs. Now we have the opportunity to do it for approximately $100 per song.  But we have over 20 original songs.  So, we are starting small with just 5 or 6 songs.

  • You get the EP. All the songs we record will be yours on digital formats and hard copy.

  • If we do not reach our humble goal, the funds will go to recording as many songs as we can afford to record

The Impact

  • No one knows that Hawai'i has an amazing and inspired music and arts scene. We want to help shine the light on all the other artists and musicians here which is why we've also created our own record label.  Viewable at healthparadigm.wix.com/rebelheartmusic

    Also we've been blogging our musical adventures on our self-constructed webpage to keep everyone posted and updated on our project where ever they are on the globe.  We are part of the thriving global village and want you to walk hand in hand with us. NEW UPDATES! CHECK IT OUT NOW!

  • We have recordings and videos which are getting likes and hits.  Some are even created by our fans themselves! Like this one 


    And this one was made with the help of my roommates and band mates and the beautiful mountain name Mauna Kea which is, from the sea floor up, the tallest structure of any kind in the entire world! 



    My solo work has been at #1 on the Reverbnation charts for Hilo, Hawai'i for almost 6 months straight!Reverbnation Charts

  • We have been invited to play our third or fouth festival here in Hawai'i.
    Check us out at Flow Fest 2016


    Risks & Challenges

Everything in Hawai'i is expensive really.  I have personally seen a gallon of milk for $15.  Electricity is 44 cents a Kilowatt hour and rising. Thats two times the highest rates on the entire North American continent.

  • To overcome this I've given up a lot. Including electricity, running water and every day comforts like Juice, Milk, Tea and Bread. Which is about $7-$10 a loaf.  Sure I'm gluten-free now and off of 99% of dairy but its not all been by choice.

    Lets not understate that we are on the most remote and unreachable island chain in the world.  If the food boats stopped coming there would only be 7 days of food available for everyone anyway.  We are reliant on the "mainland" America for food, gasoline and now music recording.  

    Our number 1 industry is Tourism.  With out people coming here there would be no jobs and no economy at all which could sustain life.

    We want to cultivate and build and grow our connection with everyone here and our families and friends on the mainland.

  • I'm currently in between jobs.  I plan on overcome financial hardship by becoming my own business partner in life.  I believe that by following my dreams regardless of my own doubts and insecurities, I can get the help I need to create income through musical performances and festival touring.  

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, thats righteous too!

  • Send this campaign, share it, like it, promote it, tell your neighbor, calling all Angels!
  • The recordings are going to be awesome and we want to tour to support it so stay tuned because there will be more opportunities to be a part of the music in the very near future.

    Thank you and Aloha from The Caretakers.

story:
The Nutshell.
My name is Locks, I’m a songwriter based in North London.
This is the first indigogo campaign I’ve done.

I’m setting up this campaign to try and raise money to go back into the studio with a new band to record a new EP: Rattle Them Bones. I’m really excited about this one as we have already had such positive feedback from Skeletons which was aired on Steve Lamaqcs BBC6 Music show & will be featured on the EP. We already have PR interest as well, something I’ve never had before. We have already booked three gigs for the spring/summer and one festival (Sampire festival) which is in its’ first year! Funded entirely by crowd funder and deemed one of the most successful crowd funded campaigns. I am usually constantly booking gigs however now’s the time to focus on rehearsing and recording.

The style of music borders on Nick Cave & The Bad Seeds Murder Ballads, Tom Waits, a bit of Dead Mans Bones and possibly Kill it Kid. It’s dark & jaunty, the lyrics focus on the unnerving parts of life we all encounter, the bits that people try to ignore in themselves or that consume them.

Rattle Them Bones is meant to shake you and unsettle you.
https://soundcloud.com/locksofficial/skeletons-2

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=akOWPoo11pk

What We Need & Where It Goes.
I’ve asked for help raising £2000 to cover as much of the costs as possible, this includes:

Studio time – Recording Vocals, drums, guitars, double bass
Mixing & Mastering
CD Pressing & Artwork printing
PR Costs
Postage & packaging, we want to send you your perks!

We are aiming to start recording in April for it to be released end of July however if we don’t reach our end goal we will still use it to put towards all of the above. We are going to make this EP.

All the artwork is original and designed by myself and my dear friend Jemma Hardingham who has designed my previous album artwork (hello, macabre) and EP (A collection of songs about loss and leaving). One of the perks of the campaign will be a signed print of the artwork.

This feels like such a great opportunity to take my music to a wider audience, tour and then hopefully record more EPs. Without the help of this campaign this EP most likely won’t get recorded and sent out into the world, and that’s the goal, I want this EP to be heard.

Other Ways You Can Help
It’s completely understandable that not everyone can donate but that doesn’t mean you can’t help out in your own way. I would be so grateful if you would share this on your facebook page, twitter and other social networks. Let friends and family know, check out our facebook at www.facebook.com/locksofficial and give us a ‘like’, spread the word anyway possible. The more people know the better!
Fingers crossed guys!
