story:
Hallo,
mein Name ist Stefan Pfeifer, bin 54 Jahre und bin gelernter Kaufmann. Mein Projekt gibt es in dieser Form noch nicht gibt. Ich selber arbeite im Medium Radio seit 1999 wobei ich auch meine Erfahrungen im kommerziellen Radio (Redaktion bei MainFM) sammeln konnte. Radios gibt es viele, jedoch nicht in der Form wie wir es gestalten werden.
Der Sender wird 24 Stunden an 365 Tagen im Jahr aus einem tatsächlich vorhandenen Studio senden. Dies wird derzeit mitten im Herzen der schönen Altstadt in 63654 Büdingen gebaut und wird dann als sogenanntes "Offene Studio" bezeichnet. Offenes Studio bedeutet, das wir immer eine Tür offen haben, ob für den Hörer, einen Gast oder für Menschen die nur einmal sehen möchten wie Radio gemacht wird.
Radio, ist ein Medium das auf der ganzen Welt zum täglichen Begleiter geworden ist. Leider aber zu oft geht alles im Einheitsbrei unter und man sieht die Unterschiede nicht. 
Deshalb ist dies als regionaler Radiosender gegründet worden, der auf die Region bezogenes Radio macht. Das ganze läuft ehrenamtlich und wird maßgeblich durch eine Gbr.  finanziert. 
Wir arbeiten in Zukunft mit Schulklassen, Vereinen und Organisationen, mit Künstlern und Bands und letztendlich mit Menschen die durch einen besonderen Beruf, ein tolles Hobby oder einer Aktion in unseren Fokus kommen. Wir gehen bei Veranstaltungen vor Ort und fangen so die Stimmung und die Reaktionen ein. Wir beziehen Stellung zum politischen Geschehen und schauen auch mal über den Tellerand von Büdingen und der Wetterau hinaus.
Das Thema Medienkompetenz soll in den Vordergrund gerückt werden, So werden wir besonders an Kinder- und Jugendliche herantreten und diese in Kursen zeigen wie Radio funktioniert. Dabei werden diese dann die gesamten Bereiche des Radios kennen lernen. Diese Kurse sind aktiv Kurse in denen die Kursteilnehmer aktiv im Studio in den einzelnen Bereichen arbeiten bis hin zur eigenen Sendung die wir dann Live senden. Diese Kurse sind natürlich kostenfrei und wir werden insbesondere mit Schulen und anderen Trägern arbeiten. Die LPR (Landesmedienanstalt) gibt hierbei entsprechende Hilfe die wir in Anspruch nehmen werden.
Das alles muss natürlich finanziert werden. unsere derzeitige  Grundausstattung: 4 PC`s, 2 Mischpulte, diverse Mikrofone und andere Technik, sowie einen Satz für Interviews und Umfragen (mobiles Gerät).
Da jedoch der Wunsch ist sowohl das Radio als auch den bereich Medienkompetenz so nah wie möglich an die großen Radiosender zu bringen benötige ich noch einiges an Ausstattung.
Was noch fehlt:
1 x Airmate (Mischpult digital für den Radiobetrieb) kosten 1890,- Euro
1 x Radioautomationssystem der Marke Mairlist kosten 1785,- Euro
2 x Pc incl. Monitoren für den alleinigen Betrieb der vor genannten Systeme
kosten rund 1300,- Euro

Damit wäre eine Basis geschaffen um Radio zu machen das wirklich am Zahn der Zeit ist.
Die monatlichen Kosten für Miete, Gema, GVL und Strom werden auch in Zukunft von der Gbr. getragen.
Sollte der Betrag nicht erreicht werden, so können zumindest einige Teile angeschafft werden, da jeder Zugewinn sowohl das Radio als auch den Bereich der Medienkompetenz fördert.
Ziel ist es ein Projekt aufzubauen, das wir weiterführen können, so wird neben dem jetzigen Verbreitungsweg (Internet) der Sprung in das regionale Kabelnetz und als fernziel auf DAB+ und UKW zu kommen. 
Gerne stehe ich für Fragen dazu auch via Mail unter Sendeleitung@radio-citybeat.de zur Verfügung.

Ich würde mich freuen wenn ihr dies Unterstützen würdet, denn es ist mehr als ein Traum, es ist etwas wovon sehr viele Menschen etwas haben. Natürlich werde ich über jede der Anschaffungen entsprechende Rechnungen und deren Zahlungen veröffentlichen und jeder Cent wird ausschließlich in das Projekt Radio CityBeat investiert.
Vielen herzlichen Dank schon an dieser Stelle sagt
Stefan Pfeifer

story:
*** ONE DAY LEFT: PLEASE DONATE NOW! ***

RIMANE UN SOLO GIORNO: PER FAVORE DONATE ADESSO!

Realising a Dream

It doesn't get bigger than this - Vito Palumbo has built a successful career as a contemporary composer and pedagogue over twenty years. Now the famous Abbey Road Studios - perhaps the most famous recording spot in the world - will play host to an incredible experience: the LSO Records Palumbo.

Realizzare un Sogno

In venti anni, Vito Palumbo si è creato una carriera di successo come compositore e pedagogo. Ora i famosi, forse più famosi al mondo, Abbey Road Studios ospiteranno un'incredibile esperienza: la LSO che registra Palumbo.Meet Vito.

Vito Palumbo is an award-winning, critically acclaimed Italian Composer. He has had pieces performed all over the world, notably undertaking commissions from the Gävle Philharmoniker, the Berliner Philharmoniker and the RAI Symphony Orchestra.

He also works as a Professor of Composition at the Conservatorio S. Giacomantonio in Calabria, Italy.

The London Symphony Orchestra and Abbey Road Studios have enthusiastically signed on to record the first phase of a new album of Vito's works, beginning with a brand new violin concerto featuring world-famous soloist Francesco D'Orazio. The double session, 6 hours in total, has been pencilled in for the 17th of September, just two months away!

La London Symphony Orchestra e gli Abbey Road Studios hanno entusiasticamente confermato la registrazione della prima fase del suo nuovo album contenente il lavoro di Vito, partendo da un nuovo concerto di violino che include il famoso solista Francesco D'Orazio. La doppia seduta, che dura 6 ore in totale, è stata confermata per il 17 Settembre, lasciandoci con soli due mesi di tempo prima che il tutto abbia inizio!

Last week, Vito found out that his local authority, once enthusiastic supporters of his work, have suddenly ceased their financial support of all arts endeavours. What would have covered a third of the total project costs now represents a crippling financial void which threatens to derail Vito's plans with the LSO and Abbey Road. Without this financial backing, Vito's album - a fresh new piece of European contemporary art - will not come to fruition.Vito is so close to bringing amazing new contemporary music to the UK and greater European community.

He needs your help.

La settimana scorsa Vito ha scoperto che le autorità locali, una volta entusiaste sostenitrici del suo lavoro, hanno di colpo smesso di dare sostegni finanziari a tutte le imprese artistiche. Perciò, quello che prima avrebbe coperto un terzo dei costi totali per il progetto ora rappresenta un insostenibile vuoto finanziario che rischia di rimandare a un futuro incerto i piani di Vito con la LSO e Abbey Road. Senza aiuto finanziario, questo nuovo lavoro d'arte contemporanea Europea che è l'album di Vito non avrà modo di esistere.

Vito è vicinissimo a portare della nuova fantastica musica contemporanea nel Regno Unito e in Europa, ma prima ha bisogno del vostro aiuto.

 

What We Need & What You Get

  • We're asking for £15,000 to help offset the remainder of the costs not covered through outside and personal funding. Bringing the entire London Symphony Orchestra and soloist Francesco D'Orazio under the famous roof of Abbey Road Studios is no small feat - the entire day's worth of recording will cost Vito a whopping £38,780. This covers a 69-person orchestra, managers, conductor, librarians, recording engineers and equipment, instrument porterage, and basic print media promotion of the new album. The best resources in the entire world come with a steep price tag. 
  • Want to see your name in the album liner notes? Pull up a chair at the recording session at the world-famous Abbey Road Studios? Even fund a new work, dedicated in your name, by Vito Palumbo himself? With our pledge perks, all of this can be yours!
  • Any amount truly helps - even if we don't reach the £15,000 goal, anything will help bring this album closer to production!

Quello che ci serve e quello che avrete in cambio

Sono necessari  £15,000 per compensare i rimanenti costi che non verranno coperti tramite finanziamenti esterni e personali. Portare l'intera London Symphony Orchestra e il solista Francesco D'Orazio nei famosi Abbey Road Studios non è da poco, e l'intera giornata di registrazioni costerà a Vito l'enorme ammontare di £38,780. Ciò copre il costo di un'orchestra di 69 persone, i managers, il direttore d'orchestra, i bibliotecari, i tecnici per la registrazione e l'attrezzatura, fino a coprire pure la produzione di un disco del nuovo album. Le migliori risorse nel mondo hanno sempre avuto un alto costo.

Vuoi avere il tuo nome nelle annotazioni di copertina? Ti piacerebbe essere presente alla seduta di registrazione nei famosi Abbey Road Studios? O finanziare un nuovo lavoro, dedicato a voi, dallo stesso Vito Palumbo? Tutto ciò è possibile grazie ai tanti vantaggi che potete ottenere con le vostre donazioni!

Ogni ammontare aiuta e anche se non raggiungiamo la cifra di £15,000, ogni donazione ricevuta porterà l'album più vicino alla sua produzione!

​Risks and Challenges:

Right now, the biggest challenge we face is raising the funding in time - the recording session is barely two months away! 

We have taken the following steps to ensure that this campaign will be as successful as we know it can be:

Vito's management, specialist arts marketing agency Promote Classical, are throwing themselves fully behind this campaign, acting as professional support to ensure we reach the widest audience possible.

We are using flexible funding, to make sure that every penny raised goes directly towards the project.

 

Rischi e Problemi:

Al momento, il più grande problema che stiamo affrontando è riuscire a raccogliere i fondi in tempo, visto che la seduta avverrà tra due mesi!

Perciò abbiamo deciso di agire in questo modo per assicurarci che questo finanziamento collettivo sia di successo come sappiamo che può diventare:

Il management di Vito, l'agenzia specializzata in arts marketing Promote Classical, lavora a tempo pieno su questa raccolta fondi, operando come supporto professionale, per assicurarsi di raggiungere il più gran numero di persone possibile.

Inoltre, stiamo usando l'opzione di 'finanziamento flessibile' per assicurarci che ogni centesimo raccolto vada direttamente verso il progetto.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't afford to contribute, don't worry - we understand entirely! You can still help this campaign out without pledging:

Share this page on Facebook, Twitter, Reddit, Instagram, Pinterest, via Email, smoke signals, post the link to your grandparents, send it by owl or even by using QR codes. Every bit of exposure we get helps enormously - seriously.

If you have any questions, comments, concerns, or ideas, please don't hesitate to contact our campaign manager, Promote Classical CEO Elliot Corner at info@promoteclassical.com.

Altri modi per aiutarci

Se non potete permettervi di contribuire, non preoccupatevi! Potete aiutare questo progetto anche senza donare facendo una qualsiasi delle seguenti cose:

Condividendo questa pagina su Facebook, Twitter, Reddit, Instagram, Pinterest, via Email, tramite segnali di fumo, spedendo il link ai vostri nonni, mandandolo con una civetta o anche usando i codici QR. Qualsiasi mezzo di esposizione aiuta enormemente.

Se avete delle domande, dei commenti, delle preoccupazioni o delle idee, non esitate a contattare il manager di questo finanziamento collettivo, CEO di Promote Classical, Elliot Corner a info@promoteclassical.com.

 

-------------------

 

Il rinomato compositore Italiano di musica contemporanea Vito Palumbo sta per realizzare il suo sogno: avere il suo nuovo concerto di violino eseguito dalla London Symphony Orchestra e registrato negli Abbey Road Studios. Gli amministratori della LSO ed i tecnici di Abbey Road hanno già dato la loro conferma, ma dei recenti problemi con i finanziamenti hanno messo a repentaglio l'intero progetto.

Con il vostro aiuto, possiamo rimetterci a lavoro con questa monumentale seduta di registrazione, e riuscire a portare il meglio della musica alla scena Europea di musica classica e contemporanea!


Ricompense

 

£25 - Il tuo nome in prima linea

 

Ricevi un ringraziamento tramite social media da Vito e il team di Promote Classical! Il vostro contributo ci ha avvicinato a rendere il sogno di Vito di registrare con la LSO una realtà!

 

£50 - Dalla penna del compositore

 

Ricevi un ringraziamento tramite social media insieme a una lettera di ringraziamento personalizzata dallo stesso Vito Palumbo!

 

£100 - L'anteprima

 

Diventa  il primo ad ascoltare il nuovo album di Vito! Con questo ammontare di donazione, riceverai l'intero album (contenente la registrazione del concerto per violino con la LSO, "Aqua" per arpa sola, la sonata per piano e altro) prima che l'album sia reso disponibile a tutti!

 

£250 - La scritta nel muro

 

Non solo riceverai l'album prima che venga distribuito al pubblico, il TUO nome sarà presente tra le annotazioni nella copertina! Il tuo contributo è notevole e vogliamo che chiunque compri l'album ne sia a conoscenza!

 

£500 - Un pezzo di storia

 

Con la tua donazione di £500 sterline riceverai tutte le ricompense menzionate, insieme a una copia firmata e professionalmente rilegata della partitura del concerto per violino. Non perdere l'opportunità di ottenere un pezzo di storia che rappresenta la registrazione di Vito con la LSO!

 

£1000 - Un momento da celebrità

 

Vi siete mai chiesti come sarebbe stare nel backstage di una seduta di registrazione nei famosi Abbey Road Studios? Con questa donazione puoi dare un'occhiata a dove i Beatles, Sir Elton, e Adele hanno dato vita alla loro arte, così come ora darà vita alla musica di Vito Palumbo. Avrai un esclusivo invito alla seduta di registrazione del 17 Settembre e una cena con Vito! Il tutto insieme alle precedenti ricompense!

 

£5000 - Il tuo unico ritratto

 

Con la tua donazione di £5000 riceverai tutte le ricompense precedenti, insieme a un nuovo lavoro scritto da Vito e dedicato interamente a te, che verrà registrato nel prossimo album. Così avrai dato ufficialmente un dono che continua a dare!

*** ONE DAY LEFT: PLEASE DONATE NOW! ***
RIMANE UN SOLO GIORNO: PER FAVORE DONATE ADESSO!
Realising a Dream
It doesn't get bigger than this - Vito Palumbo has built a successful career as a contemporary composer and pedagogue over twenty years. Now the famous Abbey Road Studios - perhaps the most famous recording spot in the world - will play host to an incredible experience: the LSO Records Palumbo.
Realizzare un Sogno
In venti anni, Vito Palumbo si è creato una carriera di successo come compositore e pedagogo. Ora i famosi, forse più famosi al mondo, Abbey Road Studios ospiteranno un'incredibile esperienza: la LSO che registra Palumbo.Meet Vito.

Vito Palumbo is an award-winning, critically acclaimed Italian Composer. He has had pieces performed all over the world, notably undertaking commissions from the Gävle Philharmoniker, the Berliner Philharmoniker and the RAI Symphony Orchestra.
He also works as a Professor of Composition at the Conservatorio S. Giacomantonio in Calabria, Italy.
The London Symphony Orchestra and Abbey Road Studios have enthusiastically signed on to record the first phase of a new album of Vito's works, beginning with a brand new violin concerto featuring world-famous soloist Francesco D'Orazio. The double session, 6 hours in total, has been pencilled in for the 17th of September, just two months away!

story:
Listen to the tunes here!


https://dogmaw.bandcamp.com/

 

A Personal Account From Baylor Odabashian, Guitarist, Songwriter

           I couldn't talk back then, so I picked up a loose guitar and started clumsily banging away. Eight years later, I’m still trying to hammer my inarticulate emotions into steel and sound. The things I struggle to say now are less clumsy, less bleak, but the motive remains.

We united our many musical backgrounds for a new celebration. Spencer brought east-european folk, avant-garde, and classical violin. Noor's voice was equally informed by the Arabic and American classics. Ashwin brought his astonishing ability to make original rhythmic music out of suitcases, bear suit mufflers, and half a drum kit. I scaffolded the sound with psychedelic, celtic, punk and folk guitar playing. 

This was a band of poets. Spencer, Noor and I met in the Berkeley Slam Poetry scene, where we were performers, where Noor and I lead writing workshops. Noor was the principal lyric writer, but we all contributed lyrics. Before the band, Noor was a regular CalSlam poetry finalist and the chief editor of the Berkeley Poetry Review. Spencer is a prolific poet and current Editor-in-Chief of The Heuristic Squelch (UC Berkeley's only campus comedy magazine, with a circulation of 11000 copies.)

We were playing live in Oakland or Berkeley every week last Spring, but when we tried to organize a tour last Summer, venues across the West Coast told us we needed recordings. We are producing this album so we can go on tour when we reunite. For now, we are on hiatus while Noor fullfills her Fulbright Scholarship in Jordan, Ashwin studies Math in Paris and Spencer wraps up his chemistry degree. 

Our producer, Omar Khan is a multi-instrumentalist and singer-songwriter with technical and musical expertise. For proof, look no further than his 2014 album, Berkeley Blues (Salvador.) I consider it to be among the best produced indie-pop records of 2014. Omar is a perfectionist. He is the right person for the job. But he is also a student with bills to pay.

None of this music is free. The cost of maintaining equipment can be a serious burden, as can the countless hours we put into our inventing, practicing, and performing our craft. Art is work, like anything else. Our greatest dream is eventually to be able to support ourselves financially with our band. But for now, we are just trying to raise enough money so we can pay Omar less than the minimum wage in Berkeley. 

If, upon listening to this album, you receive even a fraction of the nourishment that we did making it, we will be so proud. I hope we have your support. 

Sincerely,

-Baylor Odabashian, guitarist, songwriter

Dog-Maw and The Plastic LA Skyline

story:
My name is IRWIN

Some of you may know me from the live shows and recordings I've done with singer and songwriter Melody Gardot. Or you may have seen me on stage touring with 3x Grammy and Tony Award winning jazz icon and NEA Jazz Master, Dee Dee Bridgewater. I've been a saxophonist since I was just a little kid and now have been playing professionally for nearly 20 years. It’s hard to believe that I’ve been at it for so long, but music is my life and it keeps me going every day.

I'm thrilled and excited (and freaked out!) to share with you a project that has been weighing on my soul for some time now. I've always been asked, show after show, when I'll be releasing some music of my own. Well after years of touring and recording, I'm finally ready to take the big step. And with your help, we can turn a simple dream into a reality!


What We Need & What You Get

Making an album requires a lot of planning, patience and determination. And money! I'll need funding for:

  • 4 days in a top of the line recording studio (2 days to record, 1 day for fixes, 1 day for overdubs)
  • Recording and rehearsal fees for 4 in-demand NYC recording and performing artists
  • 3 days of rehearsals in a quality NY rehearsal studio with basic recording capabilities and music gear (amps, keyboards, etc)
  • Special guest artist fees
  • Engineering fees for mixing and mastering the final recording
  • Album artwork
  • Printing the physical albums and digital distribution

The cost of recording studio rentals, rehearsal studio rentals, mixing the album, mastering, and hiring the musicians and engineers, average to about $800 per track. “Industry standard" for a full length album is 10 songs.  When you add in the fees and taxes for the campaign, the printing of the album, and the artwork, the costs easily add up to $10,000 - before marketing, additional merchandise, and physical shipping costs, etc.

That's where YOU come in. With your contributions, I believe we can reach and exceed this goal. Fortunately, I'll be on tour in the US, Canada, and Europe for the next 45 days with the incredible Melody Gardot, spreading the word about this exciting new project. I'll be posting regular video and photo updates of the tour, the campaign, and the music creation process!

And to show my appreciation, I'll be offering some unique perks for every contribution, including secret recordings, saxophone lessons, opportunities to meet the band and see the recording process LIVE, exclusive interviews, album credit, and much more!

Remember!  Every little bit counts towards making this project the best it can be. The biggest hurdles are paying the recording studio fees and the musicians. The closer we get to our goal, the more I can do when it comes to hiring special guest artists. Even if we don't reach our final monetary goal, the money will still go towards lowering the upfront initial costs associated with making the album (i.e. studio time).


Risks & Challenges

Some of the biggest risks associated with a project of this nature involve scheduling. I'll be recording and rehearsing in one of the fastest cities in the world - NEW YORK! Known for looming skyscrapers and endless diversity. It's also known for it's non-stop hustle and bustle. Fortunately, there are no shortage of quality studios to use. I've been working with my musicians for many years now around the world and they are all excited to come together to make this project happen.

Marketing is also a challenge with any artistic process. Fortunately, the new connected world we live in offers us unique ways to approach this. Through social media and live performances, I have an opportunity to market the album to audiences around the world. This campaign is the first step in a social media effort designed to get the word out. High profile shows as a featured soloist with amazing, award-winning artists also provide a chance to promote the project to millions around the world. 


The Impact

Making an album is a very personal and vulnerable adventure. I've had thoughts of releasing an album in the past, but for too long was nervous about what my impact could be. I always want my audience to be able to relate to my music. I’ve been fortunate to travel around the world doing what I love and to see firsthand how music can serve as a bridge to connect people everywhere. From clubs in Tokyo, to theaters in France, to arenas in Australia, it's the most endearing feeling to have a person approach and tell you that your music has changed their mood, their day, their life. To be able to connect with people around the world despite our spoken language, through sound and energy, is a unique gift. 

The opportunity to connect with something deeper and larger than myself is what inspires me to create music. I've been afraid for so long that my voice wouldn't reach far enough to others or that it would be rejected. I’d tell myself maybe I haven't practiced hard enough or had enough experience to say something that matters. Perhaps being a part of someone else's vision is the only way to validate what I do. But at some point I realized I had to put my personal anxieties aside and take a leap of faith. This project is that leap. And I hope it impacts you the way it has me.


Some more about IRWIN

IRWIN HALL is a saxophonist, flautist and clarinetist known for his versatile stylings and melodic improvisations. His abilities have taken him around the world playing everything from jazz, swing, funk, groove, gospel, and beyond. He got his musical start on the alto saxophone in his elementary school in New Jersey at the age of 9. But when a local jazz musician came by his church a couple of years later, Irwin’s life was changed. He joined a youth program called Jazz Institute of New Jersey at the age of 11. In less than a year, Irwin was on stage performing at blues bars, organ jazz sessions, local churches, and in his early teens was ranked third nationally in the NAACP ACT-SO competition in the contemporary music category. 

From 2003 to 2007, Irwin attended Princeton University where he majored in East Asian Studies. He became fluent in Japanese and after graduating moved to Tokyo to work at the Asahi Shimbun, Japan’s largest and oldest national newspaper as the Research Assistant to the Editor-in-Chief. While working in Tokyo, he encountered songstress Melody Gardot who heard him play and hired him immediately to join her band. Irwin quit his job, packed his bags, and hit the road with Melody on her immensely successful “My One and Only Thrill” World Tour.  

While on tour with Melody, he caught the ear of trumpeter Theo Croker, grandson of legendary trumpeter Doc Cheatham, who invited him to Shanghai China to join him for an artist-in-residency. Being comfortable living in Asia, Irwin accepted the offer, performing and touring throughout Asia for two years. He returned to the States in 2014 to record Croker’s release, the Dee Dee Bridgewater-produced “Afro Physicist”. The album received critical acclaim and Irwin went on back-to-back European tours with Croker and 3x Grammy and Tony Award winning jazz icon Dee Dee Bridgewater. In 2015, Melody called Irwin into the studio to record her Grammy-nominated work “Currency of Man” for which they are currently touring.


Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute monetarily, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

SREAD THE WORD! Post on your Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, Tumblr or other social media accounts. Make a shout out on your Snapchat! Email your friends about it. Indiegogo has great share tools. Feel free to use them to let people know about the campaign! 

And, of course, THANK YOU for your encouragement, help and support. Thanks to all of you for the emails, comments, and most importantly, LOVE you've shown me over the years. I'm glad my music has been able to reach you.
story_txt:
My name is IRWIN
 

Some of you may know me from the live shows and recordings I've done with singer and songwriter Melody Gardot. Or you may have seen me on stage touring with 3x Grammy and Tony Award winning jazz icon and NEA Jazz Master, Dee Dee Bridgewater. I've been a saxophonist since I was just a little kid and now have been playing professionally for nearly 20 years. It’s hard to believe that I’ve been at it for so long, but music is my life and it keeps me going every day.


I'm thrilled and excited (and freaked out!) to share with you a project that has been weighing on my soul for some time now. I've always been asked, show after show, when I'll be releasing some music of my own. Well after years of touring and recording, I'm finally ready to take the big step. And with your help, we can turn a simple dream into a reality!
   What We Need & What You Get 

Making an album requires a lot of planning, patience and determination. And money! I'll need funding for:



4 days in a top of the line recording studio (2 days to record, 1 day for fixes, 1 day for overdubs)


Recording and rehearsal fees for 4 in-demand NYC recording and performing artists


3 days of rehearsals in a quality NY rehearsal studio with basic recording capabilities and music gear (amps, keyboards, etc)


Special guest artist fees


Engineering fees for mixing and mastering the final recording


Album artwork


Printing the physical albums and digital distribution





The cost of recording studio rentals, rehearsal studio rentals, mixing the album, mastering, and hiring the musicians and engineers, average to about $800 per track. “Industry standard" for a full length album is 10 songs.  When you add in the fees and taxes for the campaign, the printing of the album, and the artwork, the costs easily add up to $10,000 - before marketing, additional merchandise, and physical shipping costs, etc.

That's where YOU come in. With your contributions, I believe we can reach and exceed this goal. Fortunately, I'll be on tour in the US, Canada, and Europe for the next 45 days with the incredible Melody Gardot, spreading the word about this exciting new project. I'll be posting regular video and photo updates of the tour, the campaign, and the music creation process!
And to show my appreciation, I'll be offering some unique perks for every contribution, including secret recordings, saxophone lessons, opportunities to meet the band and see the recording process LIVE, exclusive interviews, album credit, and much more!
Remember!  Every little bit counts towards making this project the best it can be. The biggest hurdles are paying the recording studio fees and the musicians. The closer we get to our goal, the more I can do when it comes to hiring special guest artists. Even if we don't reach our final monetary goal, the money will still go towards lowering the upfront initial costs associated with making the album (i.e. studio time).

    
Risks & Challenges Some of the biggest risks associated with a project of this nature involve scheduling. I'll be recording and rehearsing in one of the fastest cities in the world - NEW YORK! Known for looming skyscrapers and endless diversity. It's also known for it's non-stop hustle and bustle. Fortunately, there are no shortage of quality studios to use. I've been working with my musicians for many years now around the world and they are all excited to come together to make this project happen.
Marketing is also a challenge with any artistic process. Fortunately, the new connected world we live in offers us unique ways to approach this. Through social media and live performances, I have an opportunity to market the album to audiences around the world. This campaign is the first step in a social media effort designed to get the word out. High profile shows as a featured soloist with amazing, award-winning artists also provide a chance to promote the project to millions around the world. 




The Impact


Making an album is a very personal and vulnerable adventure. I've had thoughts of releasing an album in the past, but for too long was nervous about what my impact could be. I always want my audience to be able to relate to my music. I’ve been fortunate to travel around the world doing what I love and to see firsthand how music can serve as a bridge to connect people everywhere. From clubs in Tokyo, to theaters in France, to arenas in Australia, it's the most endearing feeling to have a person approach and tell you that your music has changed their mood, their day, their life. To be able to connect with people around the world despite our spoken language, through sound and energy, is a unique gift. 
The opportunity to connect with something deeper and larger than myself is what inspires me to create music. I've been afraid for so long that my voice wouldn't reach far enough to others or that it would be rejected. I’d tell myself maybe I haven't practiced hard enough or had enough experience to say something that matters. Perhaps being a part of someone else's vision is the only way to validate what I do. But at some point I realized I had to put my personal anxieties aside and take a leap of faith. This project is that leap. And I hope it impacts you the way it has me.


Some more about IRWIN

His abilities have taken him around the world playing everything from jazz, swing, funk, groove, gospel, and beyond. From 2003 to 2007, Irwin attended Princeton University where he majored in East Asian Studies. He became fluent in Japanese and after graduating moved to Tokyo to work at the Asahi Shimbun, Japan’s largest and oldest national newspaper as the Research Assistant to the Editor-in-Chief. While working in Tokyo, he encountered songstress Melody Gardot who heard him play and hired him immediately to join her band. Irwin quit his job, packed his bags, and hit the road with Melody on her immensely successful “My One and Only Thrill” World Tour.  
While on tour with Melody, he caught the ear of trumpeter Theo Croker, grandson of legendary trumpeter Doc Cheatham, who invited him to Shanghai China to join him for an artist-in-residency. Being comfortable living in Asia, Irwin accepted the offer, performing and touring throughout Asia for two years. He returned to the States in 2014 to record Croker’s release, the Dee Dee Bridgewater-produced “Afro Physicist”. The album received critical acclaim and Irwin went on back-to-back European tours with Croker and 3x Grammy and Tony Award winning jazz icon Dee Dee Bridgewater. In 2015, Melody called Irwin into the studio to record her Grammy-nominated work “Currency of Man” for which they are currently touring.


Other Ways You Can Help Some people just can't contribute monetarily, but that doesn't mean they can't help:
SREAD THE WORD! Post on your Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, Tumblr or other social media accounts. Make a shout out on your Snapchat! Email your friends about it. Indiegogo has great share tools. Feel free to use them to let people know about the campaign! 
And, of course, THANK YOU for your encouragement, help and support. Thanks to all of you for the emails, comments, and most importantly, LOVE you've shown me over the years. I'm glad my music has been able to reach you.

story:
Last year’s very first festival was a huge success. Over one sunny weekend in Brighton, sold-out audiences witnessed incredible performances from leading artists from the US, Europe and the UK including William Parker, Hamid Drake, Mette Rasmussen, Nat Birchall, Rachel Musson and many others.

Now, in 2016, we want to do it again.

Once again, we’ve programmed a world-class line-up of some of the most creative and uncompromising avant-jazz practitioners currently at work – including several debut UK performances and special collaborations.

More than ever, we’re dedicated to showcasing improvisers from scenes and communities not often represented at UK festivals. And, at the same time, we’ve extended our commitment to providing a platform for risk-taking female musicians who are still sorely under-represented in other jazz festivals.

Audiences this year can look forward to enjoying performances by breath-taking musicians including Artifacts Trio, featuring Nicole Mitchell, Tomeka Reid and Mike Reed (US), Ingrid Laubrock and Tom Rainey (US), Sophie Agnel, Steve Noble and John Edwards (France/UK), Bourne Davis Kane with Paul Dunmall (UK), Konstrukt with Alexander Hawkins (Turkey/UK) and more.

It promises to be a truly special event.

But we need your help to make it happen.

In order to make this dream a reality, we need to raise £3,000 to access funding promised to us by the Arts Council. If we don't make this target, the future of the festival - which is 100% non-profit - is in serious doubt. The team at BAJF are already hard at work getting preparations underway, but, to get us up and running, we urgently need your help.

Will you make a donation today?

In return, you'll get to be a patron of the festival, get exclusive merchandise, or even be lucky enough to sit in our VIP area. This year, you can also use your contribution to buy reduced-price early bird tickets for the festival, which will save you money and help bring the festival one step closer to happening.

If you can't contribute you can still help us by sharing this campaign on social media, telling your friends and generally helping us get word out. Let’s do everything we can to make sure Brighton Alternative Jazz Festival is back to stay in 2016!

For further details see the Facebook event page at https://www.facebook.com/events/1155865431142013/

And the festival's dedicated website at http://brightonalternativejazzfestival.com

story:
Creating music is not only a passion, but a privilege. Living in a place where so many creative minds are being thrown in the mix can only be described as a "utopia" where it leaves you feeling nothing less than fortunate. I've had the opportunity to live amongst many great musicians and songwriters, of whom I'm glad to call friends. Residing in this type of environment has produced not a desire to write a better song than your counterpart, but a desire to further better yourself and your storytelling abilities. 

With this in mind, I've been working tirelessly to create something that is new and will hopefully have a lasting effect. The release of my first record was an example of me testing the waters and waiting for the moment to jump. I don't regret this at all. But since then, I have come a long way and now feel it is time to continue down this road of squalor to bring you the best I have to offer. This new record will be completely different from the first. Showcasing all new songs, it will range everywhere from folk to blues, rock, gypsy and more; all the while covering a literary field of Gothic tales to cynical love. I hope that everyone will find solace in their own interpretations.

Asking for help has never been a strong suit of mine, but living the life of a musician can leave you feeling hopeless sometimes. Sometimes you just have to ask. Your donations to this project will NOT be taken lightly. The cost of creating a high quality product does not come cheap and we have estimated that the goal of $10,000 will make it possible to do so. I will be working with the best minds and top notch musicians on this project and can guarantee that every donation received will go towards creating something that we can all be proud of. Without the support of family, friends and fans, I would find myself in a dark hole. 

I thank you from the bottom of my heart to those who have been supportive. It means the world to me and I look forward to see what the future brings.

P.S. - Although the life of a musician/songwriter can sometimes sound gloomy, I hope the video above can show the lighter side of things.

story:
Hey there! Merry Christmas! I'm Sheldon. 

(Yes, you heard right! Merry Christmas!)

I'm a New York City-based singer and performer from a quiet town in North Carolina. I've been in NYC for 5 years now pursuing my dreams of performing in any capacity possible. 

Creativity, passion, music, and performance are of utmost importance to me and they bring me unlimited happiness. I like to pass that happiness on to others as many ways as possible and I'd like one of those ways to be creating an album full of beloved Christmas songs for everyone to enjoy.

This is where you come in.

I can't do this without your help and support. I'm asking you to become a vital part of helping me pursue my dream and bringing happiness to others, which is something we all need right now. 

Read ahead to find out how you can make a difference, what your donation is funding, and what kinds of fun gifts you can receive by helping out!

 

What We Need

Our goal is $20,000 by August 25. 

In the interest of total transparency, here's the 411 on the financial aspects of the project:

Where your money goes:

Making and marketing an album of the best quality is no small feat. Every step counts. By donating to this campaign you will be helping provide:

  • Digital and print marketing: The best of the best in advertising and design for the album. My friends at KernVision and JMack Design will be helping with all things graphic and visual.
  • Studio Fees: The album will be recorded over the course of a few days at The Bunker Studio in Williamsburg.
  • Musician Fees: I'm asking my friends, including Michael Taylor as arranger, to play and sing with me on this project because I love them and their talent. I'm blessed to know lots of amazing professional artists who love what they do and deserve compensation for their high quality work. 
  • Mixing and Mastering Fees: The Bunker Studio has amazing mixing and mastering technicians on staff who stay with the artist throughout the recording process and after to ensure the absolute best product possible.
  • ​Album Production: This will ensure production and shipment of physical and digital copies of the album to recipients who purchase the album. This includes copyright fees for any songs which are not public domain.
  • Post Production Advertisement and Concert: A small portion of proceeds is set aside for an album release party and publicity.

 

What You Get

There are lots of great rewards waiting for you when you donate to the cause! They are outlined in the Perks section (to the right). They include but are not limited to:

  • Signed Posters
  • Vinyl and CD copies of the album
  • Early release perks
  • Complimentary tickets to the album release
  • AND MORE!

We are counting on $20,000 dollars and I KNOW we can do it. But any and all donations will be put to very good use!

 

The Impact

Music heals and enriches the soul. The holiday season is a time when people set aside their differences, show a little more kindness, and walk with an extra spring in their step. Christmas songs are a huge part in fostering that love, community, and unity. For this reason, I would like to add my voice to the list of artists who have made holiday music contributions to the world. If even one person is uplifted or changed by this album, it will all be worth it.

Over the last few years, I have performed in NYC and all over North America in musicals, concerts, and cabaret shows, bringing live entertainment to happy audiences of strangers and friends alike. These experiences have been so amazing, but those moments are fleeting in live performance. For this reason, I long to create an album that listeners can revisit again and again. I want to provide a way for you and the rest of the public to be able to relive those magical moments. Making an album allows anyone to relive and treasure the experience for a lifetime.

 

Risks & Challenges

There is always an amount of risk that comes with creative projects. From budget changes to timeline shifts to technical difficulties, no artistic pursuit is without its hurdles. I have worked with my team of artists to prepare for the unexpected and create a game plan that will maximize our time and money efficiently.

"But what if you don't make your goal?"

In crowdfunding, there is always a fear that your goal will not be met. In the event that the goal is not reached, all donated funds will still be put to use in producing the best product with the money we receive. We will redistribute the money being put towards this project and go with Plan B to make sure you still get an album even if we don't make it to $20,000.

However, I believe in all of you so much and I know we can make this happen!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If anyone understands the financial constraints life can put on us on a day-to-day basis, it's me. Trust me. If you are unable to contribute at this time I totally understand. 

But! You can help in other ways!

In crowdfunding, word of mouth is the best tool you can have in your arsenal to make sure you reach your goal. So, if you can't make a donation, please be sure to take advantage of your social media circle by sharing this campaign with your friends, family, and any famous people you might know! (Hey, it's worth a shot!) Just getting the word out is a gigantic step in the right direction! You can simply copy and paste this URL to your various social media outlets or take advantage of IndieGoGo's sharing tools.

A little help goes a long way and sharing this page definitely counts!

Thank you so much for being a part of this project and for all the help and support I know you can and will provide!

story:
Rachel's Debut Album

Hello.  My name is Rachel Knowles.  Singing and entertaining people are my passions.  So, I am continuing my journey to make my first album.  During my first round of fundraising, I was able to raise funds to make my first 3 songs.  I now need to raise additional funds to record the remaining songs and produce the album.

I am 14 years old and in 9th grade. I have been singing and dancing since before I can remember.  I have been taking dance classes since I was 3 years old and performing in recitals, talent shows, choruses, and dance competitions since. I currently sing in the worship teams for the children's and high school ministries at Grace Family Church in Tampa.

Since I began writing and recording songs the last few months, I have loved it more and more.  One of my biggest dreams is to become a professional songwriter and singer.  I want to motivate other young people to pursue their dreams and overcome adversities. My music styles include Christian Contemporary, pop, and alternative.

I am working with a local music producer and musician, Nick Coetzee with Rain Music Recording Studio (http://www.rainmusic.org). We recorded the song Oceans by Hillsong in my own style followed by two original songs (I’m So Done & Lord You’ve Changed Me).

What I Need From You & What You Get

Although I have supportive parents, family, and friends, they are not able to fully fund this project. I need to raise an additional $4000 to produce an album that will include Oceans and four original songs.  This amount includes all expenses needed to produce the album including producer fees, studio fees,  mastering, artwork, and manufacturing.  

The incentives for your donations are accumulative:

$5.00  Digital Download of Oceans & mention on my Facebook page

$10.00 Digital Download of I’m So Done

$15.00 Digital Download of Lord You’ve Changed Me

$20.00 Signed Picture Mailed to You.

$25.00 Signed Copy of the EP Mailed to You.

$50.00 Credit for Support on EP's Liner Notes

$75.00 Two Tickets to Album Release Party

$150.00 Four Additional Tickets to Album Release Party & Three Additional Signed EPs

$300 Concert at Your Home or Location in the Tampa Bay Area

$600.00 Song Written for You and Performed at Your Home or Location in the Tampa Bay Area.  

The Impact

By supporting this project, you can help me get my music out to the world and inspire others to find their talents and reach for their dreams.  I believe that God gives us talents for a reason and, through my songs, I can bring joy and happiness to people to encourage them through difficult times and give them hope.

Risks & Challenges

I know that there are a lot of people who will say, there is no way she can become a successful singer.  But, because I have faith in God and I have very supportive parents, family, and friends, I believe I can. And, I have learned the hard way not to let people's negative statements and attitudes get to me.  I know that it's not going to be easy.  But, anything that's worth something shouldn't come easy.  

Other Ways You Can Help

If you think, there's no way you can help; that's not true.  Because even if you don't have the money to donate; you can spread the word, share my link, and tell people that I'm worth the support.  Your prayers and kind thoughts mean a lot to me.  I am very grateful for those of you out there who will give me a SHOUT OUT and tell the world about this exciting project.  

Thank you for your time and thoughtful consideration.
story_txt:
Rachel's
Debut Album
Hello.  My name is Rachel Knowles.  Singing and
entertaining people are my passions.  So, I am continuing my journey to make my
first album.  During my first round of
fundraising, I was able to raise funds to make my first 3 songs.  I now need to raise additional funds to
record the remaining songs and produce the album.
I am 14 years old
and in 9th grade. I have been singing and dancing since before I can remember.  I have been taking dance classes since I was 3
years old and performing in recitals, talent shows, choruses, and dance
competitions since. I currently sing in
the worship teams for the children's and high school ministries at Grace Family Church in Tampa.
Since I began
writing and recording songs the last few months, I have loved it more and
more.  One of my biggest dreams is to
become a professional songwriter and singer. 
I want to motivate other young people to pursue their dreams and
overcome adversities. My music styles include Christian Contemporary, pop, and
alternative.
I am working with
a local music producer and musician, Nick Coetzee with Rain Music Recording
Studio (http://www.rainmusic.org). We recorded the
song Oceans by Hillsong in my own style followed by two original songs (I’m So
Done & Lord You’ve Changed Me).
What
I Need From You & What You Get
Although I have
supportive parents, family, and friends, they are not able to fully fund this
project. I need to raise an additional $4000 to produce an album that will
include Oceans and four original songs.  This amount includes all expenses
needed to produce the album including producer fees, studio fees, 
mastering, artwork, and manufacturing.  
The incentives for
your donations are accumulative:
$5.00
 Digital Download of Oceans & mention on my Facebook page
$10.00 Digital
Download of I’m So Done
$15.00 Digital
Download of Lord You’ve Changed Me
$20.00 Signed Picture Mailed to You.
$25.00 Signed Copy
of the EP Mailed to You.
$50.00 Credit for Support on EP's Liner Notes
$75.00 Two Tickets
to Album Release Party
$150.00 Four
Additional Tickets to Album Release Party & Three Additional Signed EPs
$300 Concert at Your
Home or Location in the Tampa Bay Area
$600.00 Song
Written for You and Performed at Your Home or Location in the Tampa Bay Area.
 
The
Impact
By supporting this
project, you can help me get my music out to the world and inspire others to
find their talents and reach for their dreams.  I believe that God gives us
talents for a reason and, through my songs, I can bring joy and happiness to
people to encourage them through difficult times and give them hope.
Risks
& Challenges
I know that
there are a lot of people who will say, there is no way she can become a
successful singer.  But, because I have
faith in God and I have very supportive parents, family, and friends, I believe
I can. And, I have learned the hard way
not to let people's negative statements and attitudes get to me.  I know that it's not going to be easy.
 But, anything that's worth something shouldn't come easy.  
Other
Ways You Can Help
If you think,
there's no way you can help; that's not true.  Because even if you don't
have the money to donate; you can spread the word, share my link, and tell
people that I'm worth the support.  Your prayers and kind thoughts mean a
lot to me.  I am very grateful for those of you out there who will give me
a SHOUT OUT and tell the world about this exciting project.  
Thank you for your
time and thoughtful consideration.

story:
We Dream of Lions

 

Music with Purpose

"...don't let me go, so I won't go under..."

"...so many thoughts unsaid..."

"...and here we are, just clinging on..."

We want to make music that makes a difference in peoples lives - more than just great drumlines, awesome guitar hook lines and catchy beats... although our music has that also! We want to be able to share our passion and dream with you, but we definitely need your help in making this happen! 

First, we want to get personal with you!

 

Here are the members of our band...

Lead Singer & Piano & Acoustic // Donazon 

Vocals & Electric & Acoustic // Duncan

Vocals & Bass // Eric

Drums // Greg

Bass (in Album) // Chris

 

Funds from this campaign will go directly to music production with Venture House Music, as well as funds needed for the Album Release Party that is happening later this year! We want to thank you SO much for even taking the time to come to this page, and so grateful for your contribution to the campaign as well as sharing this with your friends and family!

 

We can't wait to be able to share our music with you!

 

Connect with us through our social media sites! 

Instagram & Twitter - @WeDreamOfLions

Facebook - www.facebook.com/WeDreamOfLions

story:
Short Summary

Russell Buddy Helm is a multi media artist, writer and classically trained musician. Having played and recorded with many greats, Allman Brothers, Chuck Berry, Frank Zappa, Tim Buckley, Bethlehem Asylum, Mike Bloomfield, Kinkie Freidman, Big Joe Turner, Bo Diddley, Dorsey Burnet, and many others. Also soundtracks for Ron Howard and other film makers, Also writer for George Lucas, Star Wars comic strips. Also extensive film and television production helping to create MTV and post production supervisor for Lorimar's Dallas, Falconcrest, Knott's Landing, etc. Leaving film to teach drumming meditation and drumming therapy as a treatment for the stress of contemporary living. He started publishing books on Llewellyn, "Drumming the Spirit to Life/Let the Goddes Dance"and  touring with djembes starting in 1987, continuously, across  the US, Australia and Japan, creating certified drumming therapists. There were no drumming groups at that time. Functioning as "Johnny Applseed of the Downbeat, Russell Buddy Helm introduced and taught healing and celebration drumming groups everywhere. This is a rediscovery of our grooves for safe sacred dancing for women, celebration, rhythmic healing, drumming meditation and joyful non-sexist rock n roll. "History of the Groove"

Funding goes to the final printing of "History of the Groove" a colorful 6"x9" book with lots of stories and insights about drumming as a fun, healing, enlightening meditation for dance and celebration! Our goal is $5000. You are guaranteed a copy of the book and also a CD if you like.

There are several CDs to pick from. If the goal is not met, the book is still yours and we will continue to drum live in our store in Santa Monica and stream to Youtube. You are invited!

The impact you will have by funding this endeavor is to raise the consciousness and level of happiness in the world! You are part of The Groove! You are helping to make the world a better place and you are having fun doing it with cool people from all over the planet, and maybe outside our solar system too!(you never know)

I have published several books previously, "Drumming the Spirit to Life/Let the Goddess Dance", "Way of the Drum" (on Lewellyn Worldwide) and also "Healing through art and soul" on Oxford Scholar Press. You will be a member of a very enlightened group of supporters that will no doubt bring more good luck and healing into your life. I have witnessed the positive benefits to people in the thirty years I have been teaching this form of healing drumming  meditation around the country and the world. We need this form of enlightened drumming in our culture to create and protect a safe place for women, and men, to dance in sacred ecstatic dance with peaceful non- sexist drumming rhythms that are a part of our heritage. Your help will come back to you in many positive ways. I have been very successful as a drummer, playing and recording with many of the great talents in our musical world. The stories in the book will explain how all these events have led to this important time in our lives and how the drum has played an important role in many people's lives. There are no risks to being involved with this endeavor. The universe supports us in this activity no matter what our background is. Share the Groove!

You can watch us on Youtube three times a week, Tuesday and Friday at 7pm Pacific time and on Sunday afternoon at 3 pm Pacific time at Russell Buddy Helm either on Youtube or Facebook. Let us know in the chat room if you are a contributor and we will make a special groove for you! All the shows are archived so you can link your friends.

The emotional strength that comes from feeling your own groove has been a healing process for me and many others. I have drummed since I was eight years old, My first teacher was a great woman, Ailleen Trafford. I encourage women to drum! I have been very lucky and have benefited from the survival wisdom of many great musicians. I am sharing these insights with you so that we can continue to create a community of healing, joy, safe sacred dance with you all as partners in our rhythmic community.

Share the groove with us even if you don't spend money. You are all welcome!

story:
Summary

In 2016 former police officer and Broadway composer/playwright Christopher Smith wrote the  music and lyrics of the original song "You Were There (A Tribute for the Fallen.)" The song, which was first performed by choral groups, celebrates the courage and sacrifice of public service and armed service members who have died in the line of duty. This is something that has been close to Chris' heart for many years.

Free for families and communities worldwide

Chris believes that this song should be completely free for anyone who wants to use it in a non-profit, non-commercial way. When police officers, firefighters and armed service members die in the line of duty their funerals must be arranged very quickly and Chris did not want there to be any hindrance to families and communities choosing to use "You Were There" in a free and timely way.

The Campaign

Indiegogo offers us the opportunity to gather support from people around the nation and world. Your contribution will help pay the costs of making the song, recordings, videos, the organization, and our ongoing public outreach. In the future, based on performance, we hope to expand the "You Were There" trademark to develop other products which commemorate the sacrifices of our public servants; including a book and documentary film focused on the lives of heroes from cities and small towns across our nation.

Our Thank You (Perks)

Though it may seem strange to call them "perks," the items listed on this page are just a way for us to say "Thank you" for contributing to our work.

For contributions of:

$10 - Exclusive digital MP3 audio download of the original recording of You Were There. Compatible with ipods, smartphones, tablets and computers at-home or on-the-go. This is the only way to receive this recording, it will not be on iTunes or music sharing services.  

$25 - Audio download (above) and  commemorative pin of the official You Were There (A Tribute for the Fallen) logo.

$50 - Download, pin and  original sheet music of You Were There signed by the author, Broadway composer and playwright Christopher Smith.

Special - Corporate / Foundation / family contributions over $5000, live event in your home town. Hosted by Broadway composer and playwright Christopher Smith, featuring live music performances including You Were There.

Other Ways to Help

Please use the Indiegogo share tools on this page and please share the song and video freely. Inform those in leadership positions in choirs, faith-based and other community organization that this song would be a welcome addition to public gatherings which recognize our public servants and members of the military.

story:
The Muse

"The dreamers are the saviors of the world...Composer, painter, poet, prophet, sage, these are the makers of the afterworld, the architects of heaven. The  world is beautiful because they have lived. Without them, laboring humanity would perish." -James Allen

I am Sherrie Love. I am an artist. I've been an artist for as long as I can remember. My mother worked for a school supply company when I was growing up, and when I visited the store, I ran straight for the tubes of paint, always fascinated by the multitude of colors. Although I am predominantly an oil painter and colorist, I have worked in and enjoyed many mediums. I am particularly interested in sculpture. I weld. I love foundry work and have done several bronzes. I enjoy working in clay. I am a writer and fashion designer as well. I began a line of women's clothing called Trucker's Daughter.  I studied fine art at Watkin's College of Art, Design, and Film in Nashville, Tennessee.

I have since returned to my home state of Montana. I live in Billings where I was born and raised.

I have had the vision for many years to create The Muse, a gathering place for artists, poets, musicians, and revolutionaries. I have had a gallery and studio and have curated many interesting art shows and hosted events.The Muse is the next logical step, a beer/wine/coffee bar/art gallery where people can paint, draw, write, etc. The bar will feature live music, poetry slams, fashion shows, and special events of all kinds. There will be a large studio space where art classes are held. The Muse will be an artist's community, a school, and a venue for entertainment.

Life as an artist can be challenging. My reason for creating The Muse is to create a forum and outlet where people can nurture their talents  and expose their art to the world via the internet and television. Because of the way our society is constructed, artists do not fit the norm. We tend to be odd, or unique. We are most often loners and feel out of our element when engaging in the real work-a-day world. We are the waiters and waitresses and teachers who possess immense skills, but who must rely on other means of income because art is a hard-sell. It can be discouraging if not devastating to feel as though one's skills are not of value. That can cause a devaluation of the self, which is why I love the quote above from James Allen. It makes me feel like I do have a purpose and that I contribute value to our world.

Artists are interesting characters. Much of what takes place at The Muse will be filmed as a documentary/reality tv show. I want to address the integrity, dedication, passion, and sometimes insanity of the lives of artists, follow their work and elevate the arts and culture by elevating its creators.  The documentary/reality show will begin as a stream on YouTube, funneling viewers through the social media streams I am currently building. As The Muse gains recognition, the work of the artists will be promoted by online silent auctions.

The Muse will also be a place of learning where a variety of art classes are held. As well as a class designed for teens with autism. I was invited by the mother of an autistic teen to teach an art course. The class has evolved to include the local autistic community. One of the mothers and I are designing the curriculum together. In her wisdom and understanding of autism, she is entitling the course, Art and Life Skills.  I am certain that not only those with autism but artists also will benefit through some of the practices in this curriculum. When I was in art school, I was not taught how to survive in the real world as an artist. It has been through life experience, trial and error, success and failure, that I have learned and continue to learn.

Autistic people have difficulty in connecting with reality, society, the earth. It appears artists and those with autism have that in common. I do know what it is like to be an artist. My experience has given me compassion for others and the desire to help make a positive difference in people's lives and our world. And maybe even do away with the concept of the "starving artist."

The Setting

Billings, Montana. Cowboy and Indian country. Population (Billings area): 165,361.   Billings is curious in that it produces many gifted artists, musicians, writers, etc.  I think it is because of the long winters!

The property that will stage The Muse is on Billings' historic Minnesota Avenue, which had its colorful beginnings as the home to saloons, brothels, Chinese restaurants, and opium dens. The north side of the road frequented by cattle ranchers and the south by  sheep ranchers. And never the twain did meet.  Welcome to the real Old West!

The building that will be home to The Muse began as a saloon and brothel called The Oasis.  When I began envisioning this location for The Muse, my original intention was for the  purchase and renovation of four adjacent properties. Building this campaign has helped me to narrow my focus to this one property. However, I believe The Muse will evolve, grow, and expand to encompass my original vision. That vision includes leased artist's studio spaces, large metal and wood shops, more class space, and an empty lot that will become a sculpture garden.

The funding we are seeking is for the purchase and construction budget of the one building as well as seed money for start-up.

If we do not reach our goal of $500,000, we will invest what we do make into the property and continue to raise  funds.



The Impact

The Muse will create a thriving art community that will enhance our local community, bring commerce to artists, and, via the World Wide Web, help make our world a more beautiful place. Perhaps I will begin a chain of Muses! 

 I have heard it said that our purpose in life is found in the moment of our greatest struggle. If I can help anyone find relief and joy through the expression of art, the return is so much the greater for me. 

There will be risks and obstacles in this venture as with anything worthwhile. Being a native Montanan has taught me to overcome challenges.  Like making one's way through a blizzard, you put your head down and move forward, no matter what. Or you freeze to death in the storm. You just do it. I am building an internet marketing system that includes social media and affiliate marketing as means of promotion and alternative streams of income.
 I have overcome many challenges in my life, the most significant being the loss of my only child in 2007.  I didn't think I would make it through that. But here I am. I am strong, and I am sound and I am happy. And I have found much to appreciate in this life. I know pain and suffering, and I know how I have channeled that grief into and through my art, and I believe that has been a great part of my healing process. It is my goal to encourage and inspire others with my love of the arts.
I invite you to be a part of The Muse and a part of the positive effect it will have globally. Your contribution to this venture will significantly influence the lives of many. If you will invest financially, know you are helping to make the world a more beautiful place. If you are unable to contribute financially, please help get the word out. Tell everyone about The Muse, and it's global potential. And remember, use the Indiegogo share tools! Thank you! Peace, Love, & Joy to each and every one.

 I have heard it said that our purpose in life is found in the moment of our greatest struggle. If I can help anyone find relief and joy through the expression of art, the return is so much the greater for me. 

There will be risks and obstacles in this venture as with anything worthwhile. Being a native Montanan has taught me to overcome challenges.  Like making one's way through a blizzard, you put your head down and move forward, no matter what. Or you freeze to death in the storm. You just do it. I am building an internet marketing system that includes social media and affiliate marketing as means of promotion and alternative streams of income.


 I have overcome many challenges in my life, the most significant being the loss of my only child in 2007.  I didn't think I would make it through that. But here I am. I am strong, and I am sound and I am happy. And I have found much to appreciate in this life. I know pain and suffering, and I know how I have channeled that grief into and through my art, and I believe that has been a great part of my healing process. It is my goal to encourage and inspire others with my love of the arts.


I invite you to be a part of The Muse and a part of the positive effect it will have globally. Your contribution to this venture will significantly influence the lives of many. If you will invest financially, know you are helping to make the world a more beautiful place. If you are unable to contribute financially, please help get the word out. Tell everyone about The Muse, and it's global potential. And remember, use the Indiegogo share tools! Thank you! Peace, Love, & Joy to each and every one.

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know how the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Hello music lovers...I'd like to thank you for your time.

So a little about me..I'm a homegrown New Orleans girl full of my city's culture and music which is bursting at the seams of my musical being. I've been writing music ..some which has left me quite vulnerable but it's been such an healing experience for me that I'm ready but also nervous to share..you know how we artist are..lol..but there's no other choice..that's what happens when music has a hold on you. The music is evolving into my Soul's Expression which is the backbone storyline of this album. It covers my expressions of Fleetwood Mac "Dreams" and Allen Toussaint "Old Records" sung by legendary Irma Thomas Queen of New Orleans..these songs I love and I so connect with the stories. Also original music that tells stories of personal and general situations that music lovers can relate and dance too.
I need your help bringing this self funded dream to fruition ..which is to have for the first time a professionally recorded,produced, and mastered CD of some really great Vintage Soul music with that throwback feel but with a current sound...when songs told stories and soothe a broken heart. And to also have a well directed video of the newly released single "Dreams."
But this is not a hand out but pre sale to something really spectacular which also comes with some really great perks which I am excited about because I really appreciate the love and support and I would love to reciprocate just to convey how much your support neans.
The goal would cover 
Studio cost
Musicians (New Orleans musicians )
Production of 10 somgs
Directing of video
Marketing 
Producer
Etc. Etc. Etc.
So spread the word and be a part of something special by choosing one of the fantastic perks and help this NOLA girl to continue to SHINE !!!

story:
The Psalms are Originally Music in the First Place!

I started putting the Psalms to modern music in September of 2013, aiming to do one a week. We sing them during the scripture reading portion of our contemporary-liturgical worship service on Saturday nights.

There have been weeks in which the liturgical calendar repeats a scripture reading, but generally I have stayed on track to writing one song a week, recording it, creating a video to go with it, and uploading it to YouTube.

I know that there are other churches and individuals who could benefit from this project, and I'd like to raise awareness, and gather support to make this beneficial to as many as possible.

Why not participate in a worthy project? Help to make it happen by contributing financially.

What I'm Hoping For

As you can imagine, it takes a fair amount of time to do this each week, and I am not remunerated in any way. I am hoping that by creating an IndieGoGo project, people can pledge their support for what I'm doing.

Your support will go a long way to making this a reality!

So, What's In it For You?

Look at it as a tangible way you can participate in this project. You're not just helping to validate what I'm doing, you're directly participating in making it happen.

  • People all over the world can be touched by these contemporary arrangements of Psalms
  • Churches can use the sheet music in their worship services
Help to make it happen by joining in this project.

Risks & Challenges

The main challenge I face each week is just making the time to write the music and bring that song to full completion. I try to create my own video material, or use video clips that are marked as being in the public domain. My camera isn't very good, I have substandard musical instruments and video software-- but when one considers these things, I am encouraged by the quality of the finished project in most instances.
But with your help, I'll be able to upgrade equipment, as well as focus more time and energy on a high-quality final product.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Help spread the word! Make some noise for this campaign!
  • Try using the built-in share tools to let those you love know.

story:
Short Summary

Hi everyone! My name is Lauren Dair Owens and I am a singer/songwriter originally from Anchorage, Alaska (now living in Valencia, California). I am 16 years old and I have written over 50 songs and have put out two EP's. Over the last few years, I have really been trying to find myself as an artist. I have gone through many musical changes and find my music to always be evolving. From hard rock to power ballads, it seems like I've tried it all. I think I have finally found my niche. I think that this is the perfect time to show the world the real Lauren. Along with this new style, I think it is time to adapt my name into something more fitting. While I will always wear my old music on my sleeve, it is time to shed my skin into something more me. So along with my old style, I will also be dropping the 'Owens' in my name. So from now on, I will be known by 'Lauren Dair'.

New name, new style, same heart. I want my third EP to feel like my first one. My first EP had a sense of innocence. I hid behind this tough exterior because I didn't know how to be vulnerable. But now I know that there is nothing more beautiful than pure innocence and bare-bones honesty that rocks someones soul. They often say that third times the charm and I think that is 100% true. The last year and a half has been full of ups and downs and has made for some excellent writing material. The songs I have written tug at my heart-strings and I want to share these songs in hope that they may have the same affect on someone else.


What We Need & What You Get

My third EP has been written and hopefully can be recorded this summer. I see this EP as a celebration. This EP will celebrate my graduation from high school, moving into my professional musical career, and starting my life in the "real world". Why should you contribute? Here's a few reasons:
  • You would be helping contribute to an EP that has the possibility of having songs placed in various TV shows and movies.
  • You would be helping a young artist get their music out into the world.
  • Producing, arranging, and mastering music can be very costly. Without help, it may take a year or two to save enough money to put these songs into the world.
  • Putting music out into the world is challenging and expensive.  I have written the songs but to get them arranged, produced and mastered can cost thousands of dollars.  I want to share my experience with my fans and friends! I am hoping to raise money to help cover the last money needed for my third EP.  My goal is to record something so amazing that I can continue my musical career.
  • For those of you that will donate $5, $10, $50 or more... you can share in my musical journey!  For each level, there will be a perk!  So read through and please consider a small donation.  Even a little bit makes a huge difference!
  • The money will be used for finishing up recording and mastering my third EP!
I am hoping to make this EP between five or six songs long. With your assistance, I will be able to fully record, produce, and master all of my tracks. As a senior in highschool/freshman in college, every extra dollar will help make this vision of mine come true. Thank you to everyone who has supported me thus far and to all of those who have yet to hear what I have to say with my music, I hope you enjoy the music! Thank you!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't make a small donation, please take the time to share my music!  Post my social media links and send people to my concerts.  It is great to know that you are all listening, but it is even better to know that my music touches you all!

www.twitter.com/laurendairowens
www.instagram.com/laurendair
www.facebook.com/laurendairowens
www.reverbnation.com/laurendairowens (Downloads available here)

story:
Set For The Fall

Has been playing shows non-stop for the last couple of years, and while we have a great time doing so, our truck that we borrowed was sadly taken from us (sold). Now we no longer have a vehicle to pull our trailer and get us to our shows. We have tours lined up for this year and at this point we do not know how we are going to do it! Since we're in this for the long haul, we've decided to move into a bigger, more dependable rig for the rest of 2015 and beyond. That's where you come in! We've put together rewards that are only available through this fundraiser, and which give you a way to support us in bringing our music to your city. Thanks for the support so far, and we'll see you all on the road!

Risks and challenges

The biggest risk for us on this project will be not only raising the money but also finding a reliable van with the amount of money we are raising. 
Lucky for us, we have some great friends who can get us a van at the lowest possible cost!
