story:
Short Summary

Comedians Donna Kay Yarborough and Sadie Bowman invite you into the nostalgic mythos of country music legends The Famous Haydell Sisters. Think "Spinal Tap" meets "Coalminer's Daughter" meets "Thelma and Louise." Music history will be made over the summer of 2015, as Mattie and Maybelle Haydell pack their instruments and their hopeful hearts into a little orange car and launch their comeback tour on a professional scale across the US and Canada! 

  • "The Famous Haydell Sisters Comeback Tour" is a 60-minute theatrical concert experience, featuring original comedic songs and a whole lot of heart.
  • Montreal Fringe, Toronto Fringe, Winnipeg Fringe and Edmonton Fringe are confirmed festival bookings as of this writing. February's Rogue Festival in Fresno, CA will be a west-coast appetizer for the grand tour. Before the Canadian festivals the tour will be rounded out by gigs at bars and roadhouses in the midwest, Texas, and eastern US!
  • Live music aficionados in Portland, OR have been following this comeback since 2013. Local superfans tend to describe the experience with words like "witty," "hilarious," and " the Stephen Colbert version of two decorum-challenged has been sisters."

Your contribution will spread laughter, misplaced '90s nostalgia, and satirical mindgames across two countries--even to people who speak French. Won't you come along?

What We Need & What You Get

The realities of showbiz advise us that we must prepare to lay out about $15,000 for this ambitious three-month endeavor.

  • This goes toward not only hefty festival participation fees (~$3,000) and promotional necessities (~$2,000), but gas for the approximately 10,000 miles we plan to drive (~$4,000), 90 days worth of baby carrots and coffee-to-go for two artists who are eating and lodging on the road (~$5,000), and a much-needed upgrade to our sound equipment: Garth Brooks AND Britney Spears have headset mics (~$1,000), we need them too!
  • Your contribution rewards will range from membership in the Official Famous Haydell Sisters Fan Club (or Haydell Hug Club), through a handsome array of personalized Haydell memorabilia and original creative property, on up to the coup-de-gras--if we meet our goal, Mattie Haydell pledges to cut her hair into a full-on lady mullet, just like she had in the '90s!
  • This endeavor requires not only investment in upfront and ongoing operation costs, but commitment from the artists to leave their jobs and suspend all other income for three months. Any funds that offset this investment will go far in supporting these two funny ladies as their creative muse chases them toward their dreams.

The Impact

Sure, it's going to be awesome to have a road trip and get Donna a reason to finally obtain a passport, but as hardworking artists we have a bigger agenda.

  • The Fringe festival circuit is a vital cultural experience for communities large and small across the continent (and the world). These festivals offer the public affordable ticket prices and provide platforms that espouse ideals of creative innovation. Mattie and Maybelle are proud to embrace this opportunity to contribute to comedy, music, and live arts on a global scale.
  • Maybelle Haydell's alter-ego, Sadie Bowman, is a veteran touring artist, having met success on the Fringe circuit in 2006-07 with a show called "Calculus: The Musical!" It's a long story, but that show is currently in its 9th season of production under the professional stewardship of a reputed regional theatre in the midwest. Point being, the opportunities for exposure, influence and future growth presented to these artists, as ambassadors of the arts community of Portland, OR, are inspiring.

Risks & Challenges

Playing the role of two washed up country music stars and bringing silly songs to life is a LOT of fun, and that's no lie! However, the realities of a three-month tour are not always rosy.

  • We'll be sleeping in weird places. We'll be playing show after show after show, often in cities where we haven't a single familiar face to lock eyes with. Promoting a quirky comedy act in maybe a dozen new cities in a row is going to be hard, and that's no lie either. 
  • We are working to build relationships with local radio stations across the US and Canada, with our professional-quality song recordings. But getting the word out also takes money (that's where you come in!) and legwork. Happily, the most effective form of advertisement is word of mouth, and one thing we've come to count on is once folks get in the door, the songs and the spirit of these characters gets 'em hooked. And that's also where you come in!

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't scrounge up the cash? We get it! Want to help us even beyond your donation?

  • Spread the word! If you have a posse in Fresno, Montreal, Toronto, Winnipeg, Edmonton or ANYWHERE who enjoys witty and irreverent original music, send them to our website (www.thefamoushaydellsisters.com), send them to a show!
  • Help us get booked at your neighborhood bar! Think we'd be a great fit for a music or comedy venue near you? Let us know!
  • Share this campaign or any of our videos on your social media! Surely someone will get a kick out of something, we hope!

story:
Who are The Coordinates?

We are a three piece group consisting of an upright bass, two acoustic guitars, and three part harmonies! We have been playing music as The Coordinates in Austin, TX for about a year and a half now. Playing music is what we live and breath for, and now it's time to get a CD of all of our original material out into the world!

(The Coordinates in front of The Alamo in San Antonio, TX)

We signed a publishing and recording deal with Smilin' Castle Productions based in Kyle, TX back in May 2014, and we began working on our full length debut album. This is something that we poured our souls into. Some of the songs on this record have even been in our hearts for years, so it was such a great experience recording them.

What's this campaign all about?

The hard work behind the scenes in the studio has been accomplished, and the album is being pressed as you read this! Behind every successful album launch is a successful and well thought out marketing campaign. We need funding to support a marketing campaign to get the world excited about our debut album. We would also love to invest in high quality merchandise for our fans! Lastly, we need to cover the cost of mastering for our CD and new stage equipment. $5,500 is a good amount of money, so let's show you exactly where it will all be going.

Here's the breakdown:
Publicist Fees: $2,000
New Merchandise: $1,600
CD Mastering Fee: $900
Equipment: $1000

Our minimum goal is to raise $5,500. Any amount donated over our minimum goal will be used to purchase additional merchandise and to put a down payment on a van so we can tour the states without killing Jeremy's personal car.


(The Coordinates at a film shoot)

We may not have a lot to give but what we've got we'll give to you!

There are different kinds of perks that you can receive for supporting us! Since we are still trying to plant our roots, we don't have as many flashy items out there. Our main perk is what all this is about... the MUSIC.  Therefore, a donation of only $25 will get you a signed copy of our album in the mail a week before the official release date. 

(Sneak peak at The Coordinates album cover!)

There are plenty more perks as well. For the big time supporters out there, you can be permanently featured on our official website on the page "Friends of The Coordinates" that is dedicated solely to those who have donated any amount over $100 (along with receiving a pre release copy of the album). Want us to play a private show for you? Want some handwritten lyrics? Want a personalized thank you video? Take a minute to browse through all the perks on the right, or if you're feeling snazzy feel free to pick an amount of your choice to donate!

(Tracking at Smilin' Castle Productions)

Thank You!

Thanks for your time and support. Please help us share this campaign with your friends, with your family, and with the WORLD.  Your continued support means everything to us, because we definitely wouldn't be able to do what we are doing without YOU!


Photo credits in order of appearance: (1) Kyle Tomchesson, (2) David Ventura Garcia, (3) Bailey Philips, (4) Jeremy Fowler

story:
"1" First album by Dayvia

Hello, I am Dayvia. I`m excited to say that after many years of preparation, I am finally releasing my first cd. Anyone who knows me knows that I am a very self critical artist. So, I have been putting my all into this upcoming album and I am delighted to finally be able to share something with you. 

 What You Get

1. Hand-written thank-you notes

2. With A donation of $10 and up you will receive a complimentary ticket to the April 15th performance/album release. (Reg. priced at $15.95)

3.  Digital copy of "1" on April 1st before the Album release Party

4. Be added to the email list 

4. And more! 

The Impact

As an Indie artist/writer I hope to convince others that they can travel on the same path and successfully produce great music without the help of a label. Especially if you write your own material because WRITERS ARE WHAT MAKE THE MUSIC WORLD GO ROUND!!! lol

About me

I grew up in the great city of Augusta!! (In my Madea voice) I`ve been watching my grandfather play the organ in church since birth. That`s where I developed my passion for music as well as my ability to play every instrument by ear. I currently live in Marietta Ga. and 23 years later, I play the drums beside my grandfather every Sunday. I don`t know where I would be without God, my family, and music.

 I`m starting up an Indie record Label called Reign Family Music Group, which is why I need your help!! Not only in donations but in spreading the word about the label as well. Word of mouth is the best type of marketing there is. The second best is utilizing social media. so, please take the time to speak, tweet, and etc information about myself and my label to anyone who will listen. There is power in numbers!! 

How YOU can help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Make some noise about this campaign!! Share the link to this fundraiser for me!!

Support the music by checking out Reignfamilymusicgroup.com


.

story:
My 3rd CD is all done but I still have a few costs before I can Reach my goal of Releasing what I feel is my best album yet to my fans! The name of my Sophmore CD is Reach! And I'm Reaching out to my Fans, Friends, Family and hopefully new fans to help me Reach my goal!

I need to pay my Production costs, Art Work and of course the final cost, producing the CD's themselves. Without paying the Producer Fees this CD CAN NOT be released to you my Fans and I can't wait for you all to hear it!

With the current success of the Single Somebody's Baby in the UK and support of fans in Canada, UK and USA I just know I can Reach my goal!


Who Am I?

If we haven't yet met just a quick introduction to who I am! My name is Sarah Beth Keeley and I am a Country Rock Indie Recording Artist living in Calgary Alberta whose lucky enough to have called both Alberta and BC home! I'm a first born Canadian with deep British Roots (: So having Fans on both side of the Pond has been so exciting!

I've recorded and released two albums. The first album is called "Time", a little more Country than Country Rock (although the sound is there) and an album I'm still proud of today. My second album titled "Reinventing Myself" is where I let my true sound of Country Rock emerge.

I have been recording and touring for nine years and have received numerous award nominations. Some highlights include: 2012 & 2013 ACMA final Female Artist of the year & nominated Fan’s choice.  I think the one I'm most proud of was, a second ballot nomination for the CCMA Female Country Artist of the year putting me in the top 10 artists across Canada and the ONLY completely Independent Artist on the list of nominees. 

I've Played some pretty big festivals over the past few years...

 Craven Country Jamboree Main stage, Kick off party and Socan songwriters stage at the Big Valley Jamboree, Penticton Peach Festival main stage, Party in the park, Ponoka Stampede, Cowboys Tent Calgary Stampede to name just a few.

Who I've been so blessed to open for!


 I have been so honored to play with and open for so many talented artists here are just a few, Sawyer Brown, Dean Brody, Shane Yellowbird, Doc Walker, Neil McCoy, Streetheart, Clay Walker, Ronnie Dunn, Big and Rich, Gretchen Wilson, Rascall Flats, Deana Carter, Honeymoon Suite,  Johnny Reid, Tim Hicks, Michelle Wright, Lindsay Ell, Jake Mathews and Aaron Lines.


CMT CANADA has added Sarah Beth Keeley to their elite list of artists.
Check for news, bio, tweets and future videos to come. Thanks for your 
ongoing support and thank you to CMT CANADA!!! 
http://www.cmt.ca/artist/sarah-beth-keeley/


In January of 2015 I was thrilled to have my song Somebody’s Baby have the unprecedented status of reaching #1 on the International Chart on CMandT! CMandT is an UK Internet website and Country Music Video TV station. With this amazing accomplishment my video was actually played on UK television on SkyTV! I was also featured in a 4 page article in the UK Country Music magazine UP Country Magazine! What a thrill to be in the same magazine who happened to also have an article with one of my idols Miranda Lambert!

All of the love from the UK has resulted in an upcoming Spring/Early Summer 2015 tour of the UK!


 What Will you Get for Helping Me?

I’ve never believed in asking for anything for nothing! So with my Social Media Manager we have come up with a variety of Perks we hope you will enjoy!

-  Autographed Photos

-  Custom UK SBK Tour Guitar Picks

-  SBK T-shirts, Hoodies, Sweatshirts, Tanks, Beanies/Toques

-  SBK custom jewelry

-  Signed copy of Reach *see legal note at bottom

-  A chance to have coffee via Skype, and a free song played for you

-  Limited Edition SBK UK Tour Jackets

-  A House Concert or for my UK Fans an awesome VIP pack including free tickets with a Meet & Greet and more!

*I have to stress for Legal Reasons, the Perk with the album is similar to a Pre-release. I must legally complete payment of my Production Fees before I can finish producing this CD! Hence this Crowd Funding! Therefore there is a longer timeline for the Perk of the CD than the other Perks.

How fast I can Produce and release Reach strongly depends on this Crowd Funding Campaign! I really am hoping my wonderful Fans, Friends and Family can help me Reach my goal!

What happens if I don’t reach my goal is a question Indiegogo stresses I address with you! I hate to be negative!! I really believe together we can do this!! However if I don’t collect all the funds I need to through Crowd Funding every dollar I do make (other than those to cover the cost of Perks) will go towards my Production Fees and then Art Work and finally the CD’s themselves. The rest I will make through gigs I book with my amazing band and my upcoming tour in the UK.


How Can You Help?

Every dollar will help me Reach my goal! I realize however giving financially isn’t always possible for everyone but that doesn’t mean you can’t help!

Share my Crowd Funding Campaign with your Friends via Facebook! Twitter!


"

story:
Hi all, 

We're Colour & Codeine, an alternative rock band from the Reading area. We've been together for about 2 years, playing shows in our home state of PA, along with a few other states along the east coast. Last year, we released our first EP titled "If I Die Tomorrow", and it was a HUGE success!! This summer, we are currently scheduled to make a trip to Boston to record our next EP for a total of 10 days with producer Gary Cioffi, however, it's going to be a bit costly considering we are all attending college. This is where you come in! If you preorder our new EP for only $5, we can use that money to go towards the down payment needed for the trip, along with overhead expenses so we can plan accordingly. Any amount is greatly appreciated, and even if you can't donate, the fact that you took the time to read this means the WORLD to us! We are super stoked for this adventure, thank you so much for your continued support!!!

Much Love,

Colour & Codeine

story:
Who is Ken Lavigne?

Hello, everyone.  My name is Ken Lavigne and I am a classically trained singer  from Vancouver Island, Canada. I sing and perform my style of classical crossover music to appreciative audiences all over North America. A few years ago, I fulfilled a life long goal of singing at Carnegie Hall in NYC, giving the proceeds to charity.  I realized I couldn't just wait for someone to open the doors for my career, so I took a leap of faith and made it happen for myself.  The risk and hard work helped my career immensely, but now is the time to raise the bar again - by singing at the Sydney Opera House in Australia! What's new this time around?  It's still a self produced show, but this time producers from PBS want to document the evening and present it on their network.   I need to raise the funds to make this happen.



What's Going On?
We're using this crowd funding campaign to raise the funds for the Sydney Opera House rental and hiring the orchestra.

What We Need 

Phase 1: This is only the beginning!

To properly film for PBS we need two days in the opera house. One to set up the cameras and other technical gear. The following day we will be rehearsing and shooting the concert.  In this initial fundraising campaign, here is how the cost breaks down:

  • Sydney Opera House rental  - $36,380/day x 2 = $72,760 ($70,492.00 CAD)
  • Orchestra - $14,450.00 ($14,002 CAD)
  • GST tax = $8721.00 ($8451.00 CAD)
  • Total = $92,945 CAD

What you'll get!

The end result will be a beautifully filmed, broadcast quality DVD and CD of the concert at the Sydney Opera House. If you've heard me perform before, then you know what you're in for; a performance that inspires, lifts your spirits and speaks to your soul.  If you haven't heard of me, have a listen at www.kenlavigne.com.  I'm excited to bring my best performance to this world class performance hall.

 Rewards

You want 'em? We got 'em! Look to the right and find something that suits your unique "Ken Lavigne Fan" needs.

  • Postcards from Sydney - When I'm Down Under, I'll be thinking of you! I'll send an honest "wish you were here," postcard old-school style!
  • Voicemail Magic - Personalize your voicemail greeting by hiring a professional vocalist! (Me)
  • Awesome Digital stuff - Pre-sales of the Sydney DVD + CD 
  • Ken's Bar-B sauce + apron package! Home made by moi and pretty much the best sauce ever! Go on - "Put another Shrimp on the Bar-B!" (but not on Barbie...)
  • Lucky Charm -Claim the neck tie I wore on stage at Carnegie hall! (There can be only one!)
  • Disco Dance Party - I bring the disco ball and the mix tape,  you bring your dancing shoes and a bottle of Gatorade because we are going Lionel Richie on this one! (All Night Long)
  • And much more!

What happens if we don't make our funding goal?

If we are close, then we will forge ahead and force ourselves to try and overcome the funding obstacles another way... if we are miles off, the funds will be returned.

The Impact

What does this project mean to me?

This is an enormous project and I have to get it right. I am excited, terrified, nervous, and determined that it be the very best it can be. The Sydney Opera House project will take everything I have to book the hall, find musicians and hire the technicians necessary to document the evening. It will take even more resources to fill the historic hall with an audience.  But I'm not afraid of challenges, and I am passionate about performing at great halls across the globe.  Success at this level is the career game changer I have been working towards for the past 6 years.  

Risks & Challenges

There are risks to taking on a challenge like this.

We could underestimate the challenges of producing a concert overseas and fail miserably which inevitably will result in death by humiliation (there have been known cases).  All joking aside, it wouldn't be the first time I've picked myself up, only to keep trying.

While taking on the challenge of performing at one of the world's greatest concert halls may be the biggest challenge for me to date, I have succeeded once before and know the risks are worth it.

More than just money

If you are unable to donate at this time,  you can still help in several  important ways:

  • direct people to my IndieGogo page.
  • share the campaign video on your FB page.
  • email your friends and family around the world (this system works the best).
  • tell music magazines/websites/blogs/and other relevant pros about my project.
  • tell your friends directly (old school style.... offline). 

Any noise you can make to let others know is a beautiful sound! There are wonderful and easily accessed tools on IndieGogo that will help you share this campaign .  This is almost as important to the campaign as actually getting donations from fans. People need to know that this is happening.

And finally...Cross Promotion!

Maybe you would like to contribute and promote your business as well but aren't sure how? It is simple:

Do you have a business or service? Maybe you're an artist, therapist, or personal trainer? Do you have an internet service or profession that you'd like to promote?

If the answer is YES - then let's talk. Together we can build a perk that involves your business, or create a unique gift for donors that promotes your business and supports this project.

Lets get creative!

Whenever I bite off more than I can chew I am reminded of this beautiful quote from Goethe; "Whatever you can do or dream you can do, begin it now! Boldness has genius, power and magic in it."

Please help me create some magic on Sydney's historic stage by supporting this campaign!

Thank you!

direct people to my IndieGogo page.
share the campaign video on your FB page.
email your friends and family around the world (this system works the best).
tell music magazines/websites/blogs/and other relevant pros about my project.
tell your friends directly (old school style.... offline). 

Any noise you can make to let others know is a beautiful sound! There are wonderful and easily accessed tools on IndieGogo that will help you share this campaign .  This is almost as important to the campaign as actually getting donations from fans. People need to know that this is happening.

And finally...Cross Promotion!


Maybe you would like to contribute and promote your business as well but aren't sure how? It is simple:
Do you have a business or service? Maybe you're an artist, therapist, or personal trainer? Do you have an internet service or profession that you'd like to promote?
If the answer is YES - then let's talk. Together we can build a perk that involves your business, or create a unique gift for donors that promotes your business and supports this project.
Lets get creative!

Whenever I bite off more than I can chew I am reminded of this beautiful quote from Goethe; "Whatever you can do or dream you can do, begin it now! Boldness has genius, power and magic in it."Please help me create some magic on Sydney's historic stage by supporting this campaign!
Thank you!

story:
1 month aftr this project starting we have 134 likes on  facebook.com/radiotaihape , 2343 followers on  twitter.com/nzinternetradio and have had 15,500 people visit the internet radio taihape website. it is now starting to take off we have very basic gear but with the kiwi no.8 attitude i can get it done with your help. 

pat has just had some great news in fact awesome news i think he has been granted his radio licence so he will be able to start broadcasting when the rsm engineer signs off on the site and equipment



my name is pat thomas and i live in taihape new zealand and have a passion for music and dj'ing. i have quilifications from tafe nsw for sound production and screen and media (radio broadcasting). i have been looking at starting a local Internet radio station online for a few years now and feel it is the right time to do so. this is a start up and is currently not broadcasting but with your help we can purchase the equipment needed to start the radio taihape project

what we need your help for is funding to get the following equipment

  1. Broadcasting Studio Microphone stands $45.00
  2. 16 - channel pro audio mixer US $502.93
  3. High Quality BM-700 electret studio condenser microphone x 2 US $50.46
  4. gm14 high preformance desktop pc nz  $1259.00
  5. 1080hd webcam $169.99
  6. copyright licence for radio and intercast broadcasts $455
the rest of the funding will be used for broadband internet, streaming cost, powerbills etc
skills to pay the bills
  • diploma of sound production (tafe nsw)
  • screen and media (radio broadcasting) (tafe nsw)
see my diploma's here so you know that im not scamming you 




Other Ways You Can Help

if you cannot afford to donate you can help us by sharing this project with your friends and family of facebook by using the indiegogo share tools

story:
Hi! We are Jesse & Alta Keller…aka: The Prams. Our dreams of being musicians, artists and song-writers started when we were just young kiddies. Then we grew up (who knows what that really means), met each other, fell in love and our dreams merged into one - The Prams. We’ve been writing, creating and dreaming of the day when we would record an album for all of you to hear. Guess what! That day has finally come! 

Before you read further why don't you click this link and download our latest single, "Meant To Be" along with a couple demos that will be on the album.  Take a list while you continue reading!

https://www.dropbox.com/sh/nw4wmdvtnwf7oyz/AAC_...

And continuing ... 

We couldn’t be more excited to share our dream with you and hope that you catch a little “Pram fever”. We’ve got a bunch of songs ready for your ears to enjoy, we just need help recording them! 

What We Need!

There are so many things that go into making a great album. And we want ours to be amazing.  These are the following things your generosity is allowing us to do:

Goal 1:

  1. [$3000] We will be able to pay our amazing musicians what they are worth.  Sure we could fake it and end up with some mediocre tracks but we ain't gonna win no Grammys doin’ that. If you want the pros, they get paid for their talent.
  2. [$5000] MOST PEOPLE would pay for a studio but we are purchasing and renting everything we need to fill the space we already have.  In doing this you are really supporting our future projects too because we can do it AGAIN and AGAIN with our own studio equipment.
  3. [$3000] Mastering and Duplication of the album.  You may not even know what mastering is, but trust me it’s very important. HERE is some info on the process if you are interested. Duplication gets our the physical copies and online distribution.
  4. [$3000] Promotion, Perk completion, and Fees.  Promotion is key to getting our music to the people who need to hear it.  This is how you get all your stuff in the mail :)


Goal 2:

  1. [$3000] Sound system.  A tour would not be possible without a sound system… and a trailer! (“ohp, reference to a new Prams song”... now you really wanna hear it don't cha?)
  2. [$5000] Additional Promotion and booking costs.  We could use up the entire budget on promotion and marketing and still have more people and places to reach out to.  But $5000 will allow us to make a big dent in the local and regional music industry.
  3. [$2000] Travel expenses.  Petroleum, Ramen noodles, and sleeping bags … and the occasional shower.

What You Get!

Below is what you can expect for supporting us. Take a look at the Perks for more details.


Thank You!

We have so many people who have supported us over the last few years.  We are absolutely overwhelmed with gratefulness.  We feel so blessed that we were created with the ability to make music that can impact peoples’ lives. Thank you, thank you, thank you for all of your support.  The only reason we can do what we love is because of YOU, our friends, our family, and our fans.  We are excited to bring you along with us on this journey the next six months.

Other Ways You Can Help

Help us be awesome on social media.  Connect with us and follow us! 

TWITTER @wearetheprams

INSTAGRAM @wearetheprams

WEBSITE www.wearetheprams.com

EMAIL info@wearetheprams.com

DOWNLOAD this folder for high res pics for your Instagram and Facebook header :)

story: South by Southwest (SXSW) is a set of film, interactive, and music festivals that take place every year in Austin, Texas. Currently one of the biggest music festivals in the world, we are preparing to present our sound to the stages of SXSW. After years of hard work and undying committment, performing at this festival will be a once in a lifetime opportunity, propelling our dreams and careers into unforseen realities. In short, with your help, the lives of these artists and those around them will be undeniably changed forever.

story:
Short Summary

The Spins are a pop/rock project rounded up Alessia Mattalia, arguably Europes best known female drummer having done session work for Jeff Beck and particularly noted for her drumming on Jeff Beck's Grammy Award winning track 'HAMMERHEAD' featured on the album 'Emotion and Commotion'.

Band members come from Italy, Brazil and Canada and live some in the US and others in South France. 

The peculiarity of this project lies in the fact that making a wise capitalization of internet, band members are preparing the repertoire without leaving their hometowns on both sides of the ocean.

Defining the repertoire is something every artist must do before releasing a new record or starting a tour, and here is exactly where The Spins are: after having spent several months writing new tracks and exchanging files via e-mail to arrange and pre-produce them, they are ready to enter the recording studio.

So The Spins need your collaboration NOW!


What We Need & What You Get

  • Ok, we need 60.000,00 USD, and that's why explained item by item:


  1. the recording of each song will cost about $ 1.000, considering an average of 3 days to record and edit all tracks at a price of about $ 300,00 per day. Then having each song mixed at 0x1 Sound Studio (www.0x1sound.com) by voting member of the Recording Academy Jason Ruch will cost $ 250 and mastering by Sean McGee (The Beatles, John Lennon, Pink Floyd, U2) at the mythical Abbey Road Studios in London (http://www.abbeyroadonlinemastering.com) will cost $ 250 per song as well. Total amount $ 7.500.
  2. according to the rough estimate prepared by 4Reel Productions (which will care for the production of the video we will shoot in Boston) pre-production, production and post-production of a story-telling video will cost about $ 7.200, while pre-production, production and post-production of a performance based music video will cost about $ 2.500. Add about $ 4.000 per video for space rentals, prop purchases, wardrobe, actors and extras. Then we wanted to go the extra mile at least for one of the videos, so Ms. Magda Trimarchi, top upcoming film director from Argentina, will direct the making of the video which will be shooted in Nice (France).
     Director's fee plus travel and lodging about $ 5.000. Having decided to shoot 2 story-telling videos and 1 performance based music video, the total amount for this cost element is $ 33.900.
  3. we will entrust the management of distro and promotion to Unable Distribution (www.unabledistribution.com). They will distribute the EP to over 300 digital retails, promote it to blogs,magazines, fanzines and targeted U.S. radio stations for 12 weeks since releasing ($ 250 per week), optimize our YouTube channel, assembly and distribute physical press kits, manufacture CDs and DVDs and care for shipping. Approximatively we will have to allocate for promotion $ 8.000.
  4. The rest of the money we hope to raise ($ 10.600) will be used for bands travelling, food and lodging, perks, Indiegogo fee, extras and glitches.
  • We tried to be very creative in making the list of perks we offer in exchange of your contributions to our project. Having in our team such an artist like film director Magda Trimarchi gave us the ability to offer you a variety of items designed and hand painted with her own glamorous style and that you won't be able to find nowhere else! Moreover some of the perks include a life time backstage pass for any of our future concert. So, if you help us to have a successful and long lasting career, you will have load of possibilities to choose from while assuring a VIP access to our shows. Last but not least, are you a fan of our Grammy winning drummer? Up to you to grab one of the three pairs of drumsticks Alessia used to record her drumming in Jeff Beck's Grammy winning single Hammerhead or to choose 4 drums lessons with her via Skype and learn the secrets of "The Queen of Double Pedal"! 
     
The wise guys at Indiegogo suggest to describe where the funds go if we don't reach our entire goal. Well, it's absolutely impossible that we don't reach our full target, BUT just for the sake of academic discussion let's say that:
1. as you can deduce from campaign title, we're here to fund our next no. 1 worldwide, so the minimum target is to fund recording and promotion of 1 track with its relative video; 
2. gradually, the more the fundraising will get near the goal, the more of our project we will be able to complete. 
Yeah, It's that easy!

Who We Are!

  • The Spins are not a common rock band, and this is made clearer by band members past achievements.
  • ALESSIA MATTALIA's career in music has spanned nearly 2 decades, since opening with pop band B-Nario the unique italian date of Michael Jackson's HIStory World Tour at S. Siro Stadium in Milano (1997) to the drumming in HAMMERHEAD, the Grammy award winning single by guitar legend Jeff Beck (2010). In the middle, session work and touring with nearly all italian popstars. Moreover, Alessia has been voted one of the ten best female drummers all time by italian magazine PERCUSSIONI, incledued in the list "50 great female drummers" by UK magazine TOM TOM MAGAZINE, and until now is the only italian female drummer ever featured in MODER DRUMMER magazine.
  • MARCELLO GIORDANO is a highly valued italian composer since 1994, when his Dance single I WISH YOU topped European charts.
  • VINNY DA SILVA in 2013 and 2014 Vinny was the headliner of Berklee's prestigious "Guitar Night" and in 2014 he's been selected to play an honorary tribute to Jimmy Page at Berklee Commencement Ceremony. His companionship with MARCO PERFETTI, who advanced to the Judge's House on the first edition of the Italian X-Factor and performed at Canadian Music Week 2014, gave life to PERFECT MARK, one of the most interesting project of alternative music scene. 
    Add MADELINE LOUGH, an up and coming bassist and composer from the Northwestern coast of Canada, who quickly after picking up bass in 2011 began touring in Canada with local and national artists and film director MAGDA TRIMARCHI and you will see the vision at the bottom of The Spins project: a band made of musicians best known for their individual achievements who decided to get together, determined to make the best possible use of internet to cancel the distance between their respective hometowns and to spread, with your help, the love about their music!

Other Ways You Can Be Part Of Our Adventure

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help anyway:

Get the word out, make noise and create buzz about our campaign (maybe using Indiegogo share tools), make your grandma sigh in remembrance of the times when music was made by  virtuosos, induce her to call your richest uncle and convince him to make a sumptuous donation, then LET US KNOW clicking on Twitter logo hereunder 
  
 we will find you and be very kind and generous with you, you bet!

That's all folks, see you at one of our gigs in a stadium near you!

story:
Who am I?

My name is Silas King IV. Im a 19 year old singer, songwriter, producer, dancer, and i really love music. You know its like i love it so much that its the only thing i think about. I remember when i first thought about being a musician i said to my self i can do this cause i saw people who were young like me dancing on T. V like Chris Brown, Usher, and most of all Michael jackson. Well since the age of 12 i have been singing and it all started when my family and i had lost are house back in 2005 and we were homeless for 2 years and i just remember feel so hopeless, but my dad would all was tell me "What don't kill you only makes you stronger", i remember having to take the metro bus to intermediate school for the first time in my life, i was so embarrassed and afraid but it made me tough. I remember my dad come to pick me up in taxi's and i just felt like man when is something gonna change. But through all the pain from living with my youngest sister who was 18 years old at the time and had 2 children, then to living in a small hotel for 6 months. I can say I'm am so thankful for everything that happen in my life. Through all the pain a man emerged and i discovered my self over the years. From all the moments of being alone at home and just looking at the mirror i noticed something about Silas King... "ME!" I am a really courageous person and fearless. I know who i am and I will go after my dreams no matter what. I thank God for always being there for me. I really do believe that all things are created by GOD through Man. He sends the ideas from HEAVEN its just up to us to grab them and cultivate the rest. See music has been a really great friend to me and its my way to express how i feel. I love music and its something i will never stop doing, cause it brings me so much joy. So the reason why I'm running this campaign is to raise enough money to be able to create an album of quality. Im going to bring that quality music back. The music like, Teddy Pendergrass, Marvin Gaye, Michael Jackson, or Luther Vandross would create. That magical music that brings you in and takes you on a journey from start to finish, with memorable melodies. That feel good music, the kind of music that makes you feel excited and you can't wait for the next song to come on. You know, that music that makes you laugh, cry, dance, be sad, be happy, makes you jump, and makes you just darn right feel good. Im gonna take my time and build my music, cause i don't think anything should be rushed. So i really appreciate each and everyone of you for supporting me and my dream and i just wanna say from the bottom of my heart, I LOVE YOU.

What We Need & What You Get

  • Recording Amrstudio.com $1,120
  • Mixing Amrstudio.com $1,600
  • Mastering Amrstudio.com $350
  • UPC Album Code discmakers.com $20
  • Copyright Songs Copyright.gov $35
  • Album Artwork/Photo-shoot blackicedesignstudio.com $280
  • Music Posters From Discmakers.com 1,000 Posters for $743
  • Disc Distribution from Discmakers.com 1,000 CDS for $1,404
  • Music Download Cards Discmakers.com 2,000 Cards for $520
  • D.B.A for my RECORD label & Production Company name copyright.gov $36
  • Apollo twin Pre amp guitarcenter.com $700
  • Neuman U87 Microphone Guitarcenter.com $3,600
  • Shure sm57 Microphone guitarcenter.com $99
  • Yamaha Hs7 powered studio monitors $600
  • 4 Music video shoots blackicestudiodesign.com $10,000
PERKS!
  • Perks for you! everyone who backs me name will be in the albums credit list for who helped produce this album. You can also be in the music videos if you can make it to Houston Texas. If i don't reach my goals i will start this campaign again and again until i raise the exact amount i need to complete my music album. I will not quit i believe in myself to much to quit on me. So thank you everyone for you support and Love.

So i would appreciate it if you would donate and back my project because music is all i do i love it, i write songs for all people, songs from the heart and i want to share my art with the world. Isn't that what its all about others helping others achieve their dreams. Well i believe so. I know for sure that GOD put me on this Earth to do great things for people, my community and my family. I really do believe in helping people thats why i have such a big heart to give and in the bible it says "Give and it shall be given unto you", So over the past years i've recorded 2 miixtapes, and i recorded them all in my my room with my microphone, pre-amp, and computer. I made 100 physical copies of each one of my mix-tapes and gave the first one out for free called "Blue-Sky-Thinking Vol. 1 & the second one "Blue-Sky Thinking vol. 2 I sold for $10 and also gave out some for free. So over the years I've learned how to mix, master, and produce my own music, but this time i want help i believe that greatness takes a team and i wanna be around people that know more than me so i can learn and grow and meet new people, coaches, and mentors that can help me take my music to the next level. I believe i have the gift to inspire millions and with my faith, determination, and persistence, I'm gonna make it. So i would LOVE your HELP i really would, appreciate it.

You can Visit my website and see some of my latest music projects:

silaskingmusic.bandcamp.com

Risks & Challenges

some risk and challenges i might face are, songs being deleted , computers breaking down, hard drives corrupting, but I've over come so many obstacles, they won't stop me. Im too determined and committed to who i am. I have to much class and character to let obstacles stop me. I always remember what my father tells me all the time that its not what happens to you that matters , its what you do about it, so use that same energy you use to focus on the problem use it to focus on the solution and solve the problem. With GOD all this are possible. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute i would love it if you would share this message on Facebook, twitter, Instagram, and Youtube. Share it everywhere you go if you really wanna be a help, I would really appreciate it. So thank you for your time and remember you can do anything in this world if you just believe in you! GOD BLESS YOU & have an outstanding day.

see you at the top!
story_txt:
Who am I?
My name is Silas King IV. Im a 19 year old singer, songwriter, producer, dancer, and i really love music. You know its like i love it so much that its the only thing i think about. I remember when i first thought about being a musician i said to my self i can do this cause i saw people who were young like me dancing on T. V like Chris Brown, Usher, and most of all Michael jackson. Well since the age of 12 i have been singing and it all started when my family and i had lost are house back in 2005 and we were homeless for 2 years and i just remember feel so hopeless, but my dad would all was tell me "What don't kill you only makes you stronger", i remember having to take the metro bus to intermediate school for the first time in my life, i was so embarrassed and afraid but it made me tough. I remember my dad come to pick me up in taxi's and i just felt like man when is something gonna change. But through all the pain from living with my youngest sister who was 18 years old at the time and had 2 children, then to living in a small hotel for 6 months. I can say I'm am so thankful for everything that happen in my life. Through all the pain a man emerged and i discovered my self over the years. From all the moments of being alone at home and just looking at the mirror i noticed something about Silas King... "ME!" I am a really courageous person and fearless. I know who i am and I will go after my dreams no matter what. I thank God for always being there for me. I really do believe that all things are created by GOD through Man. He sends the ideas from HEAVEN its just up to us to grab them and cultivate the rest. See music has been a really great friend to me and its my way to express how i feel. I love music and its something i will never stop doing, cause it brings me so much joy. So the reason why I'm running this campaign is to raise enough money to be able to create an album of quality. Im going to bring that quality music back. The music like, Teddy Pendergrass, Marvin Gaye, Michael Jackson, or Luther Vandross would create. That magical music that brings you in and takes you on a journey from start to finish, with memorable melodies. That feel good music, the kind of music that makes you feel excited and you can't wait for the next song to come on. You know, that music that makes you laugh, cry, dance, be sad, be happy, makes you jump, and makes you just darn right feel good. Im gonna take my time and build my music, cause i don't think anything should be rushed. So i really appreciate each and everyone of you for supporting me and my dream and i just wanna say from the bottom of my heart, I LOVE YOU.   
What We Need & What You Get
 
Recording Amrstudio.com $1,120
Mixing Amrstudio.com $1,600
Mastering Amrstudio.com $350
UPC Album Code discmakers.com $20
Copyright Songs Copyright.gov $35
Album Artwork/Photo-shoot blackicedesignstudio.com $280
Music Posters From Discmakers.com 1,000 Posters for $743
Disc Distribution from Discmakers.com 1,000 CDS for $1,404
Music Download Cards Discmakers.com 2,000 Cards for $520
D.B.A for my RECORD label & Production Company name copyright.gov $36
Apollo twin Pre amp guitarcenter.com $700
Neuman U87 Microphone Guitarcenter.com $3,600
Shure sm57 Microphone guitarcenter.com $99
Yamaha Hs7 powered studio monitors $600

4 Music video shoots blackicestudiodesign.com $10,000

PERKS!

Perks for you! everyone who backs me name will be in the albums credit list for who helped produce this album. You can also be in the music videos if you can make it to Houston Texas. If i don't reach my goals i will start this campaign again and again until i raise the exact amount i need to complete my music album. I will not quit i believe in myself to much to quit on me. So thank you everyone for you support and Love.    So i would appreciate it if you would donate and back my project because music is all i do i love it, i write songs for all people, songs from the heart and i want to share my art with the world. Isn't that what its all about others helping others achieve their dreams. Well i believe so. I know for sure that GOD put me on this Earth to do great things for people, my community and my family. I really do believe in helping people thats why i have such a big heart to give and in the bible it says "Give and it shall be given unto you", So over the past years i've recorded 2 miixtapes, and i recorded them all in my my room with my microphone, pre-amp, and computer. I made 100 physical copies of each one of my mix-tapes and gave the first one out for free called "Blue-Sky-Thinking Vol. 1 & the second one "Blue-Sky Thinking vol. 2 I sold for $10 and also gave out some for free. So over the years I've learned how to mix, master, and produce my own music, but this time i want help i believe that greatness takes a team and i wanna be around people that know more than me so i can learn and grow and meet new people, coaches, and mentors that can help me take my music to the next level. I believe i have the gift to inspire millions and with my faith, determination, and persistence, I'm gonna make it. So i would LOVE your HELP i really would, appreciate it.
You can Visit my website and see some of my latest music projects:
silaskingmusic.bandcamp.com


Risks & Challenges some risk and challenges i might face are, songs being deleted , computers breaking down, hard drives corrupting, but I've over come so many obstacles, they won't stop me. Im too determined and committed to who i am. I have to much class and character to let obstacles stop me. I always remember what my father tells me all the time that its not what happens to you that matters , its what you do about it, so use that same energy you use to focus on the problem use it to focus on the solution and solve the problem. With GOD all this are possible. 
    Other Ways You Can Help If you can't contribute i would love it if you would share this message on Facebook, twitter, Instagram, and Youtube. Share it everywhere you go if you really wanna be a help, I would really appreciate it. So thank you for your time and remember you can do anything in this world if you just believe in you! GOD BLESS YOU & have an outstanding day.
see you at the top!

story:
The iconic Caerleon May Ball will be making it's annual appearance for the last time this year, due to the awful recent news of Caerleon Campus's closure. 

PLEASE NOTE: Seen as this is last ever May Ball, staff, students, alumni, and friends / +1's are welcome to buy tickets! Please spread the word, share the event and help make this something to remember!

This will be your last ever chance to experience Caerleon Campus in all it's former glory. So tell your friends, your lecturers, alumni, and everyone you know. Buy a ticket now, and be part of something truly special.... for one last time....


In the mean time.... please help us raise money to give Caerleon the send-off it deserves! We have been denied money from both the union and the university and so must go about fundraising ourselves, as students. So please give generously and spare whatever you can, to try and make this the greatest, and last May Ball ever!

story:
Help Indie Hard Rockin' Band Complete Their First Album!

The Dirty Habits are ready to take the world by storm with their own brand of KickAss Hard Rock'n'Roll! Based in Montreal, Canada, the band has demoed more than 50 songs in the last year  Their Reverbnation profile has more than 3000 fans, and close to 20 000 hits on their songs (Mp3 streaming + videos views):

https://www.reverbnation.com/thedirtyhabitsrocks 




Listen to the album teasers on Soundcloud (note: these are UNFINISHED recordings):

https://soundcloud.com/the-dirty-habits/sets/the-dirty-habits-album-teasers

Also, their Facebook page has more than 2300 likes so far:

https://www.facebook.com/TheDirtyHabits

It's no surprise: influenced by the very best Rock bands from the 70s up until the 90s  (Led Zeppelin, Aerosmith, Stone Temple Pilots, Guns and Roses and Soundgarden, to name a few ), The Dirty Habits take it a step further, spicing it up with Punk attitude and Glam Rock! If blues legends like Buddy Guy and Stevie Ray Vaughn were able to build on the foundations of master bluesman Robert Johnson, it is The Dirty Habits' conviction that they will bring classic Hard Rock to a new level with a raunchy twist! 

Vocalist and Lead Guitarist Mars Trinity, a singer with a unique raspy voice, plays every night in Montreal bars. He has also self-released many albums. Thunderin' bassman Sly Tellier has toured for many years with Led Zep tribute band The White. Danny Peake is said to be one of the best drummers in town and has worked with Groovy Aardvark in the past. And last but not least, hyperactive rhythm-guitarist William J Enhyde has written and demoed something like 50(!) songs for the project since 2015.

By doing it independently, The Dirty Habits keep the precious "Master Tapes" and remain sole proprietors of their musical destiny, making you the real boss! They will retain total creative control on their first opus, deciding, with the help of producer Pierre "Baz" Bazinet https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pierre_Bazinet which tracks make it on the album. It's after much shopping around  for the best-suited person to bring out the best out of them that The Dirty Habits have decided to team up with the famed producer, two-time Felix-Award winner (they're just like Grammies here), who has worked with Celine Dion and Sass Jordan to name a few. "Baz", excited with the band's energy and drive has agreed to help make the most of the songs the boys choose for the album.

This album will be our weapon of choice to convert KickAss Hard Rock'n'Roll lovers around the world to our cause! It's no secret that touring with an album in tow greatly improves the likelihood of drawing bigger crowds. 

Not only our contributors will get a piece of the action, they will also support an up-and-coming band that do it their way, in control of their vision. Our contributors will also get to see the project take form from the very beginning! Kinda like watching a toddler make its first steps into the World!

What The Money Will Be Invested In

Well, since "Baz" wanted to get THE big drum sound, we have already canned those. He suggested we rented a studio with a BIG room in Montreal where acoustics would do the drums justice. Take a listen for yourself...

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6rIQKzE1kQo

We've also invested in getting the basic tracks really solid, money coming from our pockets. This crowdfunding campaign has been put together so we can reach our goal, keep the ball rolling. It is meant to pay for the remaining recording costs and other expenses: printing CDs, making sure we deliver you the perks you will have chosen, whichever they are. 

With Baz's reputation as a reliable and talented producer, we feel our chances of making an excellent album have exponentially decoupled! By the way, Baz believes in our songs so much that he has agreed to start working on the album before we even got the money together!!!!

Another thing we need to think about is the artwork of the packaging: a very talented local artist has been approached to design an instantly-recognizable "Icon" to grace our t-shirts, posters, and CDs: Marie-Claude Gervais.  http://www.creationsmcg.com/

To thank you for your trust and support. We have thought of a variety of ways to show you our appreciation. The album, t-shirts, and everything else we offer in return for your contribution.

 And for those for whom money's tight, a simple 5$ contribution will be acknowledged with thank you notes, on Facebook, by email or Twitter.

Of course, we are aware that this very exciting adventure greatly needs your help to come to life. In the event that we do not reach our goal, we have thought about different scenarios: downsizing the budget allowed to rent the studios, taking a couple of days less to complete the recordings. But this is going to be a great Rock'n'Roll album! Let's get the real feel, we say!

On the other hand, if we get more money than we've expected, we are of course going to invest it to better the final product!

Why we need you!

It's no secret that since MP3 revolutionized the way we think about sharing AND buying music, big record companies have become very prudent when comes the time to sign an artist. Most likely, they will let the artist finance his/their project and they will - maybe - sign them to take care of the distribution or marketing of the record. Record sales have dramatically dropped, and we're in the midst of a revolution: finding new ways to live off of our music. But there's a good side to this. By paying for his album, the artist remains proprietor of the "Master Tapes", enabling him to decide how his music will be marketed. The Rolling Stones own none of the records the have made from 1964 to 1972, the year they  put together their OWN record company. This doesn't mean they get no royalties, but it means that if the owner of the "Master Tapes"  decides to put together an album of very poor quality outtakes from the vault, The Stones have no say. And who gets swindled? You, the purchaser of such indignities. It is for us a matter of respect. Let the artist decide if he wants or not to make a samba remix of his Death-metal epic record! Lol! Anyway, you get the idea. Artists and entertainers such as rock musicians have always contributed to the bettering of society. Remember the sixties? So, you would have your say in expressing that what all artists create can have a positive impact on the world we all live in, the world we all hope to live in too.

Whatever happens, this record will be made. We all have jobs, and have been working on this for so long that we'll take money out of our pocket to make this album for y'all! But a top-notch recording goes a long way in many ways : subtler atmospheres, more intense moments, the experience of very pleasant emotions and THE sound quality. Let's not kid ourselves: a treat for our ears!

Of course, it is possible to cut corners. Like producing it ourselves for instance or taping it "live". Lots of other independent artists chose that way : their aim is to get the music out for everybody to enjoy. 

For those of you that want to get their hands on the album, this means more pleasure for your buck!

You'd like to contribute but can't?

Sure you can! By spreading the word! By using IndieGoGo's tools to do so. By asking your friends to check out our various profile pages on the web. By coming to our concerts (the money we make playing a gig is used to cover the rehearsal spot and transportation expenses, but anything that remains will go into this project.)

Thank you so much for having taken the time to read about our project. We hope a connexion has been made and that we will see you on tour!  The sooner, the better!

Rock ON!

story:
The Vision

The idea for the Pet Selfie Project was born while working on The Global Selfie Project (selfies of people, of course).

The goal of the original project is to strengthen international unity, solidarity and the brotherhood of man bycrossing borders and cultures.

Anyone interested, can take a selfie and upload it onto the project's website. The end goal of the project is to upload the resulting mosaic online. However, it has become clear to us that it's not easy for everyone to expose themselves and selfies aren't suitable for everyone.As a result, we looked for an additional way that would allow those interested to identify with and participate in the project.

In an age when each and every one of us has a cellular phone within reach at all times - a phone which is, in actuality, a computer that fits in the palm of our hand - big things can be made to happen by little people.

We brainstormed ways to harness this power into a global social concept that would unite and emphasis our similarities and the brotherhood between us; not our differences and the things that separate us. Today it is impossible to think of a cellular phone without thinking of Selfies. So we thought of taking the popular Selfie idea and adding a little twist – turning it into a "Pelfie".

Think about it, why shouldn't we give our pets a place of respect? Why shouldn't we put them in the center arena for a change? When was the last time someone put them on a pedestal? Unlike us, our pets don't possess pumped up egos or cause useless conflicts based on race or nationality. If this is the case, they are the most qualified to express our global project goals.

In the framework of the Pet Selfie project you can photograph your dog, cat, chicken, frog, fish, weasel, and even your beloved cow and upload their pictures to this first of a kind, unique global Pet Selfie mosaic which will be displayed by the project organizers.

If you agree, all that's left to do is to take your pet "selfie", which we're all familiar with, but to give it a little twist –change it to a "pelfie"!


The goal

  • Reach the goal of 1 million pelfies.
  • Print the largest pelfie mosaic in the world.
  • Publicize in central locations.
  • Apply for registry in the Guinness Book of World Records.

So come on and take part in this global initiative in which we celebrate our miraculous pets! Let's become inspired by them to give and love without limits and to proclaim brotherhood, all of which are values we humans need more of!

Take a picture of your pet and upload it onto the project website. We will weave all of your pets pictures together into an amazing global "Pelfie" mosaic.

Invite your friends and family to photograph their pets and join the experience. You can do this by sharing your "Pelfie" on social media networks. 


Remember, this is only the beginning… your pets are the inspiration, together they are the creation.

story:
Hello friends, family and fans,

As you know, I've been playing shows touring on the road and beyond since April of 2015. In Colorado I was blessed with "Clarice" a 1985 ford E350 tour bus that had been customized into a cool RV vehicle perfect for getting to my shows and living in. When I got back from doing shows in Germany for three months, the muffler cylinder blew when I started her up. I was relieved to know this was only a minor repair.  So I picked up some rideshare people and headed to my next destination. I was on my way to Orcas Island, Washington for some shows and holiday rest. In Federal Way, Washington, funny noises from the engine started to appear, so I headed to nearest off ramp to check it out. When I got to the end of the off ramp something blew and Clarice stalled right there in the middle of traffic. I got her towed to the mechanic and got a ride from an angel to Orcas and waited for the diagnosis. Worst fears realized, Clarice needs a new engine and muffler fixed. 

This is the only place in a 300 mile radius that can do the job.
I know the total doesn't match the amount I'm asking for, but i'm choosing a realistic goal to raise and asking for miracles. My goal is to keep touring for the next 2 years, sharing my music all over the country and the world. I am also using Clarice as a mobile recording studio to provide my engineering and producing services for musicians in need to get there music out there. I'm am also providing a rideshare incentive to help share in gas expense and to help good souls  get to their destination.

If wish to know more about me, go to www.milomatthews.com or Facebook/Milo for an in depth look of what I am about.

I have also accepted the fact that if Clarice cannot be fixed, your funds would go to helping purchase a new vehicle which some say I should do already. I believe the universe gifted me Clarice to help fulfill my purpose in this life. That purpose is to share my music and life with the world, and to help others on the path to their dreams.  She is such a unique and special vehicle. No amount is too small and no dream is too big!!! Thank you very much for your time and your help. Many blessing to you all and lets get Clarice back on road to musical bliss.
story_txt:
Hello friends, family and fans,As you know, I've been playing shows touring on the road and beyond since April of 2015. In Colorado I was blessed with "Clarice" a 1985 ford E350 tour bus that had been customized into a cool RV vehicle perfect for getting to my shows and living in. When I got back from doing shows in Germany for three months, the muffler cylinder blew when I started her up. I was relieved to know this was only a minor repair.  So I picked up some rideshare people and headed to my next destination. I was on my way to Orcas Island, Washington for some shows and holiday rest. In Federal Way, Washington, funny noises from the engine started to appear, so I headed to nearest off ramp to check it out. When I got to the end of the off ramp something blew and Clarice stalled right there in the middle of traffic. I got her towed to the mechanic and got a ride from an angel to Orcas and waited for the diagnosis. Worst fears realized, Clarice needs a new engine and muffler fixed. 
This is the only place in a 300 mile radius that can do the job.I know the total doesn't match the amount I'm asking for, but i'm choosing a realistic goal to raise and asking for miracles. My goal is to keep touring for the next 2 years, sharing my music all over the country and the world. I am also using Clarice as a mobile recording studio to provide my engineering and producing services for musicians in need to get there music out there. I'm am also providing a rideshare incentive to help share in gas expense and to help good souls  get to their destination.If wish to know more about me, go to www.milomatthews.com or Facebook/Milo for an in depth look of what I am about.I have also accepted the fact that if Clarice cannot be fixed, your funds would go to helping purchase a new vehicle which some say I should do already. I believe the universe gifted me Clarice to help fulfill my purpose in this life. That purpose is to share my music and life with the world, and to help others on the path to their dreams.  She is such a unique and special vehicle. No amount is too small and no dream is too big!!! Thank you very much for your time and your help. Many blessing to you all and lets get Clarice back on road to musical bliss.

story:
Short Summary

Hi - Bobby Lyle here!  Thank you for visiting my Indiegogo page.  If you are familiar with my music, I would like to express my gratitude for supporting me over the past 3 decades.  For the rest of you, please allow me to introduce myself to you.

My musical journey began at the age of 16, playing in local clubs in Minneapolis, Minnesota.  Over the years, I've had the honor of performing with such artists as Al Jarreau, Anita Baker, Bette Midler (with whom I scored an Emmy nomination for her HBO special Diva Las Vegas), and Phyliss Hyman.  With 14 solo CD's, a live television show, and performing all over the world, I am very excited to embark on my 15th CD project.  

This indigogo campaign is very important to me because it would allow me to share my passion of music, continue to educate and mentor young aspiring musicians,  while at the same time, preserving the essence of live jazz.  

 

What We Need & What You Get

I am looking to raise a total amount of $35,000.  This amount will be allocated as follows:
  • Record Costs - Studio rental, equipment rental, mixing and mastering, studio musicians ($16,500)
  • Packaging and Duplication - Duplication of $1,000 CD's ($2,100)
  • Project Manager - Coordination of all project activities ($5,000)
  • Marketing Director - Coordination of all activities relating to CD sales ($2,500)
  • Photo Shoot - CD cover and promotional material, wardrobe and makeup artist ($1,000)
  • Video Shoot - CD promotional videos, video composition, editing, and voice over talent ($1,600)
  • Website - Creation and functionality ($2,000)
  • Marketing Materials -  Creation of promotional posters ($400)
  • Publicist - Responsible for community activities ($1,200)
For donations of $25 - $100, the donor will receive a personalized, autographed photo of Bobby Lyle.
For donations of $101 - $299, the donor will receive a personalized, autographed photo of Bobby Lyle, as well as a signed copy of the CD.
For donations over $300, the donor will receive a personalized, autographed photo of Bobby Lyle, a signed copy of the CD, and would be listed as an Executive Producer on the CD.

If the goal of $35,000 is not reached, the money received will go directly toward  recording expenses.  Additional efforts to collect the remaining balance will be ongoing, if needed.


Risks & Challenges

The foreseen obstacles in achieving this financial goal would be that potential contributors do not see the value in investing in this endeavor.
In order to overcome that possibility we have produced several videos showing the importance of this project. The project not only fulfills music requirements - but allows me to continue investing my time and resources into inner city kids mentoring and providing piano lessons.
Surrounding yourself with smart, qualified and experienced people is another key to this projects's success. I have taken the opportunity to choose the best in the business to handle Marketing, Project Coordinating and Public Relations. I am excited and confident that this project will be completed.

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.


Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to financially contribute, there are other ways to help:
  1. Share the vision with friends and family by pressing the "share" link on this page.
  2. Please contact me if the following  services can be donated : photography, videography, and audio recording.

Thank you

story:
My name is Eban Olivier. Myself and my amazing team owns a company by the name of MILITIA BROADCAST PTY LTD and this is our story:

For years now we have been creating live musical content for sponsors and agencies; live to screens filming at international events with some livestreaming in the mix here and there. A few months ago we started filming South African live bands (in our home country) for the purpose of ONLY livestreaming their intimate hour sets live online. We did not want to have an audience in the shoot as we believed that if the artist featured had anything amazing to offer the viewer, that it should be their performance, the only variable to win the viewer over.

This project became so successful that our national television broadcaster approached us to licence the content created for these amazing artists. 

The only catch is that we have to focus on the more mainstream hit artist - and as amazing as they might be, by doing so we are missing out on hundreds of mind blowing artists that will never get to be the mainstream flavour of the month.

There are so many amazing and talented musicians in South Africa - from Jazz, Prog-Rock, Electronica, Indigenous and my favourite, the mash-up bands that you will only ever hear playing live in a 20 pax club downtown in Braamfontein.

There are also many obstacles in our country as in most other countries for startup musicians and it is not just financial - the lack of true distribution platforms, a collective place where pure talent means more than pressing play on a cdj and rapping over the studio recording, connection directly to what you the FAN wants and not some fabricated fast-food music designed to be consumed by the masses.

We have decided to take a stab at creating (for now in South Africa only) a daily live stream in HD, from a warehouse in Johannesburg featuring the array of spectacular talent we have here, music that you are most likely never to stumble upon on youtube or soundcloud.

The goal in six months is to create the most amazing platform for artist on a daily basis to share their live's work with you, the fan, so that we can start the project in other countries that faces the same obstacles.

Currently the artist after their "Urban Session" performance own the content created - The Master Video Mix, The Camera separates and the Multitrack audio recordings - This in turn can create extra income for them selling DVD's at their shows - using it as promotional material and in some cases we heard that some artist, after showing these sessions to promoters, got booked for big international festivals. 

It's funny how the abbreviation for "Urban Sessions" spell "US" - this is truly the only way this can happen. 

Now, the only missing piece to the puzzle is YOU!

YOU can help us to provide the life-blood our music industry so desperately need.

And above all, it's going be fun as hell doing it!

• We have a reputable track record and content with enormous traction.

• We own in full all the broadcast gear for this project, cameras, lenses, switchers, recorders  etc.

• We have additional projects throughout the year as service providers from which the profits on-goingly will fund these Urban Sessions .

• We have access to the most amazing artists that need your help to be discovered.

• We don't have hundreds of thousands of dollars to sustain this by ourselves.

• We would want to work towards renting our own studio/warehouse whereby we will be able to create these livestreams from, on a daily basis, instead of renting a studio space at  a massive daily cost.

• Own a few of our own lights - you will see in the videos attached - we have to date bought LED tubes and wired them to strip plugs with on/off switches and flicked it on and off manually to create the look in the sessions. This is crazy to say the least but that is what we have to work with and we make do with these little makeshift solutions in the meantime - lol.

• Dolly and tracks - we still have to hire them in because it's damn expensive to buy even secondhand ones.

• Some essential backline for the artists.

• A small PA for the band to have the best vibe that they possibly can have during the recording. Currently this is also a massive cost centre that we have to hire in.

Our vision is to include our backers in weekly "Live Production" meetings that we will livestream, to our backers online channel, that only they have access to. You will be able to listen into our production meetings - what we are planning for the following week - who the bands are - how we will film the shows - the bands you would like to see etc. We are pretty good at what we do but with your creative touch we can collectively create the most mind-blowing sessions ever seen on this planet.

If you feel generous and believe in what we have fought tooth and nail for, then take the plunge and part with a few of your precious dollars, or donate a piece of equipment that we can save money on instead of renting it in.

We are not fussy - the donations can be second hand - nothing a bit of elbow grease and a lick of paint can't fix :-)

MOST IMPORTANTLY:

YOU will always be the first! 

Weeks before we schedule the online release of the content, you will get a notification to watch the session live, before anyone else online.

We will REWARD our backers with live shows that no money in the world can buy you.

We will send little surprise gifts to our backers - it might be a drumstick, a beautiful framed photo signed by the artists, crazy clothing and even pieces of tech that YOU helped us fund.


We can only thank you for your time reading our story and we hope that you can see our passion and our determination.


We can't wait to have YOU onboard for the most exciting musical ride of YOUR life!

Love from South Africa!









"It is my pleasure to recommend Eban Olivier as one of the best live show directors I encountered in my years at Sony Corp. He not only surpassed all my expectations, but also provided all the necessary professional elements to put together "the best marketing activation program" (quote from FIFA) during the 2010 FIFA World Cup in South Africa. He was our lead director in our marketing activation called "Sony 3D Dome at Nelson Mandela Square". His strong dedication and leadership brought so much to the team on the ground. His continued effort lead to more than 55,000 people attending this event and have them experience what Sony had to offer. I can say not only behalf of myself, but on behalf of Sony Corporation Japan, that Eban was one of the top performers throughout our global activation."

Regards,
Andy Hata
Manager - Global Sponsorship Group Sony Corporation


“I worked with Eban and his team whilst fulfilling the position of On Air Producer at MTV Networks. I found Eban and his team to be beyond the standard of an local suppliers and their ability and willingness to go beyond the call of duty refreshing.

His team, headed by Eban, are progressive and willing to put in any form of work to get a superb outcome. The quality of Eban's work is untouched in his field and his personality to be a pleasure to work with.

I wish Eban all success in his business, however, somehow I don't think he will need it. A truly talented and remarkable person with such strong passion for what he does. It would be my pleasure to work with him again. Enough said.”

Nicola Cooper, On Air Producer MTV


“Eban is a great Director to work with. His passion for his craft is inspirational. His ability to problem solve in unusual ways leads to amazing results. His loyalty and respect for his crew is another great quality.”

David Pienaar, Director Of Photography


“Eban is a highly creative and highly technical person with a wealth of knowledge in the areas of post- production and production. He is someone you can always rely on to come up with a creative solution to any problem thrown at him.”

Warwick Allan, Director, Mushroom Media


“I had the fortune of meeting and working with Eban in the capacity of scriptwriter this year. He's an exceptionally creative individual and a fantastic director!

Its such a pleasure to work with someone who has a clear vision of what he wants to achieve, and manages to visualize and project his every thought into a reality.

Well done on your projects so far - outstanding!”

Martie Steyn - Scriptwriter


“Eban is an extraordinary person. He is an asset to any company that uses his services. His attention to detail, his knowledge of his subject, and his personable style ensure that he is always popular, very hard- working, top of his field, and he can be relied upon to meet deadlines and provide professional work to the highest standards. I can't recommend him highly enough.”

David Forbes, Director, Shadow Films

story:
Summary

What started as a simple idea in 2014, to put on a picnic for friends & family who love good genuine house music, has transformed into something that encompasses what makes Oakland California one of the most loving & diverse cities in America. We are now going into our 3rd year of production! The SOL HOUSE festival continues to bring together all ages, races, creeds & genders for a day of celebrating dance and togetherness in a way that only good house music and positive vibes can do! 

Making It Happen

Though SOL HOUSE is free to attend, there are hard costs that the organizers must incur in order to help actualize. Last years' event ran just shy of $3,200. This year, we predict that the event will run just shy of $4000 as we continue to grow and will need to spend on things like:

(bullet point these) porta-potties, security, & cleaning services. 

  • Other hard costs include:
  •  event permitting
  • staging 
  • equipment rental
  • setup transportation
  • water station

Due to the City of Oakland permitting regulations, we are not permitted to collect donations at the event and quite frankly we wouldn't want to. Those who have attended SOL HOUSE in the past know that it is a special space for dancing and celebrating Oakland's togetherness. Attempting to request donations throughout the event would do a disservice to the moment we've all created. 

The Impact

By making a contribution to this year's SOL HOUSE, you are helping make an event happen that TRULY brings together the many different pockets of Oakland:

  • At a time when Oakland is experiencing massive changes to its demographic, we can truly say that this is an event that has proven to bring together the many different people who call this place home. YOUR DONATION MAKES THAT HAPPEN. 

Check our videos from the past two SOL HOUSE festivals to get a good idea of what your donation helps to make happen. Without your contribution, we CANNOT make SOL HOUSE 2016 happen. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute financially, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • We need volunteers for help setting up the event.
  • We need volunteers for help picking up trash at the end of the event. 
  • We need help getting the word out on social media. 
  • Maybe you can't contribute money, but do you know someone who can? 

See you at SOL HOUSE 2016!
