story:
The Rub

Bonesyard is excited to announce that we're very much underway with recording our new album, Where Muscle Cars Roam.  We're hoping for a release toward the end of the year, maybe beginning of 2017.

At minimum, we plan to release material digitally and on CDs as we have with our previous two albums: Legends of the Pelican Man and Still Dreaming of Love

Yet, as recording these previous two albums proved to be a dream come true, we continue to dream. And having an album on vinyl would be icing on the cake with a organic cherry on the top.  But...printing on vinyl costs a minimum of $1000!!!!

"And therein lies the rub"...where in the past we have crowdfunded to pay for recording of previous albums, we're not doing that this time.  Instead, we're looking to crowdfund for printing on vinyl.  Contributions of $30 will net you both a vinyl and digital copy of Where Muscle Cars Roam.  Any and all contributions are appreciated.

If we do not net $1000 in contributions, we will still explore pressing the album on to Lathe.  While different than vinyl, Lathe cuts also provide an exciting opportunity to play this awesome album on a record player.  

Bonesyard

We're an assemblage of friends, soccer buddies, and debauchees making the most of our lives in Oakland and San Francisco by engaging in music when we're not working our 9-5s.  Learn more about us here.  

At present, we're really pumped to be crafting new material for both the recording studio and upcoming gigs.

Where Muscle Cars Roam

Bonesyard's third album is shaping out to be a concept album, exploring themes of drought, gentrification, climate change, aging, anomie, and of course...love.

In addition to the familiar Bonesyard crew, there will be a number of guest vocalists and musicians lending their talents to this project.  You'll have to wait to find out who we've got lined up, but worry not, Rufus will be singing again.
story_txt: The Rub Bonesyard is excited to announce that we're very much underway with recording our new album, Where Muscle Cars Roam.  We're hoping for a release toward the end of the year, maybe beginning of 2017.At minimum, we plan to release material digitally and on CDs as we have with our previous two albums: Legends of the Pelican Man and Still Dreaming of LoveYet, as recording these previous two albums proved to be a dream come true, we continue to dream. And having an album on vinyl would be icing on the cake with a organic cherry on the top.  But...printing on vinyl costs a minimum of $1000!!!!"And therein lies the rub"...where in the past we have crowdfunded to pay for recording of previous albums, we're not doing that this time.  Instead, we're looking to crowdfund for printing on vinyl.  Contributions of $30 will net you both a vinyl and digital copy of Where Muscle Cars Roam.  Any and all contributions are appreciated.If we do not net $1000 in contributions, we will still explore pressing the album on to Lathe.  While different than vinyl, Lathe cuts also provide an exciting opportunity to play this awesome album on a record player.  BonesyardWe're an assemblage of friends, soccer buddies, and debauchees making the most of our lives in Oakland and San Francisco by engaging in music when we're not working our 9-5s.  Learn more about us here.  At present, we're really pumped to be crafting new material for both the recording studio and upcoming gigs.Where Muscle Cars RoamBonesyard's third album is shaping out to be a concept album, exploring themes of drought, gentrification, climate change, aging, anomie, and of course...love.In addition to the familiar Bonesyard crew, there will be a number of guest vocalists and musicians lending their talents to this project.  You'll have to wait to find out who we've got lined up, but worry not, Rufus will be singing again.

story:
Thank you for checking out our page.  We are allthebestkids, an alternative hip hop band based out of Washington DC, USA.  We've been around for 4 years, creating, playing, and sharing music for public enjoyment.  Our music sounds a bit like if Biggie were to have crossed paths with The Flaming Lips.   Check it out for yourself.  We incorporate themes of love, life, and self awareness to promote positive vibes in our listeners.  

Our album Go Out With A Bang is not the average hip hop record.  Here are a few facts that might help you get a better understanding of it.

1. The album incorporates quite a few genres. From hip hop, to hard rock, to disco, to soul.  Yet, it all still sounds like one cohesive project. We drew on a wide range of influences, including Gangstarr, NIN, Marvin Gaye & Tammi Terrell, RATM, RHCP, MIA, and Jay-Z to name a few.  

2. We sampled the original onboard audio from the Apollo 11 missions. Real clips of Buzz Aldrin, Neal Armstrong, and Michael Collins traveling through space and landing on the moon. What was it like for them to see the earth from their shuttle for the first time?  How did they experience outer space?  You'll find clips of them speaking throughout the album, and hopefully will gain a closer understanding of this phenomenal achievement.  

3. Go Out With A Bang continuously flows in on itself.  Put it on at a party and let it go. You wont notice a down moment.  

4. Structurally, it's a love letter to Dark Side Of The Moon.  We didn't initially set out to make it that way, it just kind of happened. Vocal samples, sexy sax solos, 2x the track count, a song called Time; Just a few examples of how Go Out With A Bang became our alt hip hop ode to DSOTM. There are more similarities, some intentional, some not so much.  It's one of our favorite albums of all time, and this is our way of showing appreciation.  

5. There's always something new to hear. 

Sounds awesome right? Thanks!  We think so to. The good news is it's already recorded. All we need is the money to mix, master, and release it.  Here's a bit of backstory on the history of "Go Out With A Bang".

We recorded the album in November 2014 at Montrose Recording in Richmond VA.  It's a lovely music studio, and we were lucky to have recorded there.  When we were done with production, we sent the recording files to our mixing engineer.  We also sent him the money for the job.  He gave us a bunch of excuses, and repeatedly made promises that he would later deny making.  Long story short, he didn't mix the album, and he kept our money.  After 5 months of being strung along, we were left with nothing but wasted time and disappointment.  

We ended up mixing the album ourselves, and releasing that on bandcamp in time for our departing members last summer.  It was a quick demo version, and it cant stand up to a professional Mix & Master.  

Recently, we've been given the opportunity to mix our album at Airshow Mastering with Don Godwin.  These are professionals that want to support our project.  They love the vision for the album, and they want to help bring it to life. 

That is where you come in.  We need help to properly Mix, Master, and release this album.  We appreciate anything you can do to help us reach it.  Pledging is Great!  Even just sharing it with your friends is awesome.  Thank you for your time!

story:
Short Summary

The Whiskey Crisis started in 2014 when preparing for a release show for Julia Felice and Harry Nichols' co-written album. The Whiskey Crisis has a whole lot of local Ithaca talent and a whole lot of fun, and we want to roll both of those things into a new album! 

Every one of us has had a hand in writing and arranging the music for this album, and we know you'll be just as excited about it as we are. We've got rock, we've got soul, and we've got a few surprises in store. Help us bring this album to life!


What We Need & What You Get

We need $3,000 to make this happen. We need these funds to tap even more Ithaca talent to record vocals, instruments, and drums, and to and mix and master each track. We'll also use these funds to print some snazzy hard copies of the album. We've already got all these folks lined up, we just need to get started!

~~~~~~~~~

You guys, we have such great perks. Remember, for each funding tier, you get that prize AND all the prizes in the tiers below. Hot damn, you can't beat that.

Among our perks is one we are so excited to make: a brand-new, live acoustic version of our last album, Diving for Falls. Think The Whiskey Crisis: Unplugged! We love to rock out, of course -- but you don't want to miss this totally different corner of our sound. 

Just a tier or two above that, and you can also be the lucky beneficiary of Julia's baking and crafting skills! We're talking custom treats and designs. Professional people have paid her good money for these things, folks, and they didn't even get any music to listen to as they enjoyed their prizes! How sad for them. But not for you!

Now hold on to your pantaloons, because you have the chance to actually make The Whiskey Crisis work just for you. We're talking you can have us come do an hour set just for you (and hopefully some other people, because playing just for you might be awkward). Wanna impress people -- or maybe just your secret crush -- by throwing a killer party with a live band? We can be that band! We can even be all like, "What?? You want to afterparty with us??!!" So impressive, you are. So crushworthy.

Last but not least: Have you ever fantasized about having a song written and recorded just for you? It makes us tingle just thinking about it. We will make that fantasy a reality! We will work with you to make a song that you love -- we're talking a song with custom style, lyrics, and arrangement just for you -- and we will record it all fancy-like. How cool would it be for the rest of your life to be able to say, "This killer band wrote and recorded a song just for me. Wanna hear it? NBD." So impressive, you are. So cool.

And don't worry -- even if we don't reach our goal, you still get yer prizes, and we still get to use all the funds we collect.


The Impact

We think the best thing about this album is that it represents a true collaboration among Ithaca musicians. Most of our band members are songwriters, arrangers, and mainstays in the Ithaca music scene, and most of us have been recognized in local music awards by Ithaca's own Jim Catalano for our songwriting, production, vocals, and "MVP" work among Ithaca bands. 

Many bands in which 3/5 are bandleaders, 4/5 are songwriters, and 5/5 are arrangers would have a hard time working together. Not The Whiskey Crisis! We have struck gold with personal and professional chemistry. We have created an album of new music that represents both our woven-together creative vision and the absolute blast we have playing music together. 

The result will be an album unlike anything the Ithaca music scene has heard.


Risks & Challenges

There are always risks. Like, the lead singer/keyboardist might accidentally fracture her elbow roller-skating (*ahem*), or aliens might make an unscheduled stop at the recording studio and abduct our engineer. Those jerks!

But seriously, we've all done a lot of recording in this area, and have a good idea of what needs to happen and how. Also, we're chomping-at-the-bit committed. We can promise you your money will be well-used and that, alien attacks aside, this shiz is happening. Unless nobody donates, which would really suck.


Other Ways You Can Help

But if you can't donate, you don't suck! Particularly if you use your voice and technology to help spread the word about the project. 

Actually, please do this even if you can donate, you absolute rock star!

story:
We're Starting Fresh With a New Band Name and Some New Songs! Ladies and Gentlemen, Introducing... The Fromps

Howdy everyone! It's your pals: Ryan, Peter, Jake, and Brett (a.k.a. The Fromps) here with an exciting proposition... Something we've never done before... Crowdfunding.

We feel like the people who support us already do so much for us. So, to be honest, asking you for money kind of makes us feel a bit guilty. But we absolutely can't go on without financial help. We funded all of the previous bands and projects we've had on our own money and often took pride in the fact that we were a young band that could pull that off without ever having to resort to crowdfunding. But now with college, our band fund spent on the last project, Jake's child on the way, and more financial obstacles, we can't stretch our dollars any further. We need your help, and we'd be endlessly grateful if you could help us raise some money or even just some awareness. But to alleviate some of the guilt, you get more than just our eternal appreciation; you get some pretty awesome prizes as well!

What We Need & What You Get

We have high hopes for the support from you lovely people, and between the costs of recording/mixing/mastering/distributing an album professionally, touring in the summer, and ordering new merchandise, we're going to be set back a drastic amount in band funds, more than we can provide. Which is why we need YOUR help!

You've always been good to us, folks. Be it showing up to numerous venues to watch us play, sharing our music with friends, or sending us friendly and/or inspiring messages over the internet, you all have definitely proven to be kind and supportive fans, friends, and family. We hate to ask any more of you (which is why we often just give merch away at shows), but we simply can't go on with the funds we have (or lack, rather), so we'd like to ask you to help us collectively raise $1,500 by the end of March. We know that that's a lot of money, and even if we don't reach that goal, we'll still be super excited for every penny of support we do receive. Truly anything helps. But to create an incentive for your donations, we're offering up some pretty awesome prizes! Perks include:

  • Advanced downloads of a song from the new album
  • Merchandise bundles including CDs, stickers, t-shirts
  • Boxes of assorted treasures from old bands we've been in together, including Dead Authority and Exploding Head Syndrome
  • Songs written and recorded about/for you on a CD
  • Free show attendance forever (including the possibility of rides to shows)
  • Writing and recording a song of yours (or even a cover, if you want) with us at a professional recording studio
  • Us playing a gig in your house! No location restrictions, and YOU pick the set list
  • Us being housemaids for you and making a remake of any movie you want

The Impact

It's always weird being a band on one of these crowdfunding websites, because we aren't noble humanitarians, spreading important ideas and solutions to the world's problems, but we aren't selfish people. Being in a band is something we love. Asking people for money isn't, but since we need to in order to continue to do what we love, we swear to make it something you will love as well. We really don't see any difference between us and the audiences we perform for. We're all people, and it's a goal of ours to be utterly inclusive and have everyone interested not just be a nameless fan of The Fromps, but an important part of The Fromps. We really do always remember you people and what you do for us. Though we have our occasional eccentric traits, we truly are humbled and flattered by your continued support. So to give back, we're giving you our absolute best effort in writing, recording, touring, and interacting with you all. We really want this band to be as worth while for all of you as it is for us.

Plus, there are totally cool and fun prizes we can all enjoy.

Risks & Challenges

Well, obviously the main risk of this fundraiser is not raising enough money to do everything we plan on doing. But we do promise to deliver on all the perks you choose. It'll just make it a whole lot easier if we can raise more money.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some of you might be unable to contribute dollars, but that doesn't mean you can't help in other ways:

  • Share the link to our Indiegogo page on social media, blogs, etc.
  • Indiegogo has special share tools to make that nice and easy for you!

We are hopeful and excited for the future. Please join us in it with those emotions to match. As always, we appreciate every ounce of support. We've got this!

Undying love,

~ The Fromps

campaign_city: Lake In The Hills, United States

story:
The IndieGoGo Campaign has ended, but join us on our site for all of these perks and more and help us achieve our goals! Click Here!

 

The recording project of Suite Jubilation has been over a decade in the making.  This composition and recording project began with my dream to combine 18 piece jazz orchestra with full chorus for an emotional journey through music and creation.  I started the Calgary Jazz Orchestra in 2004 , and since the inception, this orchestra has harboured countless award winning musicians and become critically acclaimed across North America.  To use this orchestra in recording Suite Jubilation is to use an ensemble that has grown together artistically for over a decade.  The composition of Suite Jubilation began with the formation of the orchestra, and it too transformed and grew to become a masterpiece highlighting the strengths and character of each musician on their instrument.

The addition of New West Symphony Chorus extends the musical family of this project as I have worked closely with these artists within Calgary throughout the years.  They have a strong passion for singing and an eagerness to learn and grow together that their artistic abilities strengthen with each project. 

The combination of both the jazz orchestra and choir create an awe inspiring, spiritual and uplifting experience that radiates from their performance.  Suite Jubilation premiered in concert in June of 2015, to a sold out crowd of over 600 patrons, with a packed stage of musicians and vocalists.  It became very evident from this performance that the suite should be recorded to share this experience with others across Canada.  With my work as a composer, producer and director of the Calgary Jazz Orchestra I have had the creative liberty to refine, and customize the performance and recording of this composition to it’s highest interpretation.  The strength of the choir brings the vocals on this composition to the next level of artistry, and in combination with the orchestra is proven to be a success.

When you contribute and partner with us for this campaign, you are becoming part of the recording project and part of something much bigger.  You’re choosing to join our team and create something remarkable that celebrates and highlights Canadian artistry.

Here is a break down of the cost for a project such as this; studio recording fees, mixing, and mastering will cost approximately $11,500 CDN, artist fees approximately $13,800 in addition to album design, photography, videography for the project and the manufacturing of the physical album copies. 

With a financial commitment of this magnitude for a project like Suite Jubilation, there is a high level of excitement and nerves, but also a level of confidence and joy that overrides with the image of the final product in sight for April 2017.  We would love for you to come along with us.

Check out our rewards and services we are offering to generate funds for this recording.  We have a variety of levels ranging from album pre-sales, creative lessons with Johnny, VIP recording experiences and even a rally racecar ride along!

We are asking for a partnership from you where we can all work together on this. 

There are many ways to become involved in addition to our list of rewards; like us on facebook, share this campaign link to generate buzz and excitement for what we are launching, and tell all your friends!

Let’s create something together, something for all of us.

story:
WHO ARE WE?

ensemble mise-en is a New York-based contemporary chamber ensemble focusing on performing challenging, new works by composers from all over the world. Since its founding in 2011, ensemble mise-en has commissioned 106 new works by a variety of composers of different backgrounds, ages, nationalities, and cultures. ensemble mise-en has performed 124 world premieres, 58 United States premieres, and 28 New York premieres. One of mise-en’s primary goals is to promote works by underperformed and under-represented composers. We are constantly striving to create an open platform for composers, musicians, and audience members to work, perform, and network together. To do this, we decided to host a new music festival that breaks down traditional barriers and encourages all to interact freely with one another. 

WHAT IS THE MISE-EN MUSIC FESTIVAL?

The MISE-EN MUSIC FESTIVAL is said by the NY Times to be, “examining unusual corners of the composition world.” This year will be the 3rd ever mise-en music festival, and we’re looking to make this one bigger and better than ever before. Last year’s festival featured fantastic composers from all over the world over 4 days filled with concerts and workshops of new music. This year’s festival received 792 submissions on our call for scores, and after careful curation and consideration, we’ve invited 31 composers to New York to be featured in this year’s festival. This year’s festival will take place from June 22nd to June 25th and feature performances all over New York city at venues such as the cell, Scandinavia House, the Taipei Cultural Center, and MISE-EN_PLACE. We will also be featuring guest Exceptet and Phoenix Quartet as guest performers and hosting workshops throughout the festival at our very own MISE_EN-PLACE in Bushwick and at the cell.

WHAT'S THE MONEY FOR?

Right now, we are asking for your support to help reach our minimum fundraising goal of $10,000. Each dollar you give is completely tax deductible and will go towards the artist fees, venue rentals for the performances, and transportation costs for the equipment. With so many composers coming from across the world to this festival, we want to help them get to New York to collaborate with us to create an amazing performance, and your donation will go a long way to making this a possible experience for these very talented composers. 

With this money we want to be able to cover

-Stipends for the guest composers

-Venue rentals 

-Transportation/cartage service 

-Percussion & equipment rentals 

-Artist fees for all of the talented musicians

Most importantly, 60% of everything we fundraise through our indiegogo campaign is going DIRECTLY to the composers!

Thank you in advance and we hope to see you at mise-en music festival 2016!

Any support you can give would go a long way to making this festival a reality and we would greatly appreciate it.

story:
The Story in Brief

Help the New York Jazzharmonic premiere a composition penned in 1987 by music legend Fred Hellerman, and never before performed in public.  Fred was an original member of The Weavers, founded in the 1950's by him and the legendary Pete Seeger.

  • For the last 29+ years, Fred has been waiting to hear an orchestra perform his 10 minute masterpiece, "Fourths of July."
  • The New York Jazzharmonic is a big band that plays primarily swinging jazz, but with strong crossover elements of classical and world music. 
  • The free concert is set for Tuesday, June, 28, 2016 as part of the Washington Square Music Festival.  We expect an audience of close to 2,000 people.
  • While on in years and unable to travel comfortably these days, Fred is as excited as can be to hear the composition played by live musicians.

Please help us with the considerable costs of presenting this wonderful patriotic extravaganza in the Fourth of July season, which is a theme and variations on Yankee Doodle Dandy, and other American traditional and original themes.

The New  York Jazzharmonic at the 2015 Washington Square Music Festival

Our costs for this historic performance.

The Washington Square Music Festival is presenting our band, and helping us pay our musicians, however there are considerable extra costs in presenting this world premiere performance. We raised app. $500 in our first round.

  • Honorarium for Fred. $1,000. Of course Fred is entitled to a fee for the performance of his composition.
  • Re-orchestration. $1,000.  Fred's original score is for full symphonic ensemble with string section.  We need to re-orchestrate the piece for our 17 member big band.
  • Score and parts typesetting and printing. $1,000.  A new score for the conductor and parts for the players must be produced. 
  • Extra rehearsal for the piece.  $855.  Our musicians get paid under a union contract per rehearsal.
  • Possible extra musicians, app. $300 each.  It may be that we need to hire an extra percussionist or piccolo player to add on to our band to fully realize the work.
  • Video filming and post production.  $500-$1,000.  We would like to have a high quality video of this one-time-only performance so that as many of Fred's fans as possible can see this.
  • Fred's Transportation: $200-$300.  We'd like to arrange for a driver and limousine to bring Fred down in style and comfort to Greenwich Village from his home in Connecticut.
  • Any money raised above our goal will go into a fund to premiere other neglected works by composers from various fields of music.

Ron Wasserman and Fred Hellerman

New York Jazzharmonic

  • By the end of our first year of existence we will have played world premieres by 9 composers, culminating in this performace, which is a long overdue honor for our dear friend Fred.

  • We have an annual season at the Leonard Nimoy Thalia Symphony Space.

  • This is one of the most exciting things that artistic director Ron Wasserman has done in his 35 year professional career, and the most important premiere the new York Jazzharmonic has done in our existence.

Visit our web site for information: www.nyjazzharmonic.org Like us on Facebook. www.facebook.com/newyorkjazzharmonic


Fred Hellerman quote:
“If you can exist, and stay the course — not a course of blind obstinacy and faulty conception, but one of decency and good sense — you can outlast your enemies with your honor and integrity intact.”

story:
THE TIME IS NOW

NOW IS THE TIME FOR GAFF-E to finish the new album she started...

LET'S GET THIS ALBUM RELEASED INTO THE UNIVERSE

Any way that you can contribute makes a huge difference. This campaign relies heavily on growing our community- so anything you can do to spread the word and make some noise about my project directly influences the outcome:

 COSMIC MUSIC, VIBRANT AND FUTURE ART!!!

GAFF-E

High-energy psychedelic butterfly, Gaff E transcends genres flying her own divine style. Her colourful, original, wild and hallucinogenic performances leave you breathless and sweaty…

Gaff E’s passion for challenges and collaborative projects has cast her on a continuous international tour of creativity – performing, producing music, DJing, modeling, styling, dancing and directing videos.

ME

I have been performing and making music for eight years and the time has come to finish and release the most important and relevant project I've done to date; my dream album! In the next few months, I will be back in the studio recording and producing a brand new sound along with making new videos.

THE ALBUM

I have been traveling to Brighton to create in the studio as much as possible in between touring the world; writing and recording whenever I can but it can be tough when life is on the road. To get the album finished, it requires more time than I have been able to give it so far. My friend Jamie Cruisey has let me use his studio, provided me access to amazing analogue machines and helped me produce a whole new sound. He has given a lot of his time for the love of this project so far because he believes so strongly in the album but the tracks we have started are yet to be finished and there is still more to write!

WE COLOURFUL SPIRITS

The last few years of performing, creating and traveling have been magic. I have been inspired collaborating with colourful spirits and artists on my travels. Knowing that feeling of being real living in a fantastical world of creativity. I appreciate the support and inspiration I receive along the way from those who get my art.  

The notion to dig deep, let go and be true to yourself... To your wants and needs...

SUPPORT FROM MY PEEPS

You are the reason I do this, you have supported me every step of the way and you are as much a part the Gaff E story as I am. I wouldn’t be here without my fans, family, friends and artists.

I need your help to turn the thing I am best at creating; fantasy into a reality and this album means the world to me. 

Everything you contribute will go directly to helping the production of making this album happen. 

Let's turn Gaff E vision to reality --- There's no time like now!

Here is where the money raised will go:

- production

- mixing

- mastering

- music videos

- recording studio 

- promotional materials

- costume

- rehearsal studio

- art work

All Donations are massively appreciated, to show my appreciation and give you motivation to increase your donation... you give and I will give back!

DONATE AND SPREAD THE WORD!

SPANK YOU!

Love forever, 

Gaff E

story:
Hello, hello hello!!

I am Christopher Klaich. I have been involved in music my entire life as a performer and composer leading me to have a degree in music. As a babysitter/nanny and a teacher of music for all ages, I have noticed a great lack of quality music for children. Children are smart and thrive when given the opportunity, but it seems that often music is dumbed down with simple arrangements and terrible sounds. It seems, just because they are kids, their music is not made to the same standards as music for adults. That is just not right. They can handle and DESERVE better!

Studies show that music in children's lives boosts brain power, improves memory, aids in language skills, and fosters creativity. I was inspired to create an album of fun, smart, quality music that actually inspires children and gives them the music they deserve. And because there is detail and quality in this music, it is only an added bonus that adults will actually enjoy listening to the music as well. I need help to fund the remaining costs of the album so this music can be available for children and help them develop into the best they can be.  


What I Need & What You Get

$7500 is needed to finish making this album and to get it out to the world. 

This covers the following costs:

  • $1250 to finish recording and get it ready for post production. This includes hiring a few more musicians and recording some last tracks, as well as getting all of the tracks mastered, giving it that final polish.
  • $2750 for post production costs, making the physical CDs, graphic design work for the album, registering the songs, and making sure all the legal work is taken care of.
  • $2500 is needed for marketing. Once the album is complete we need to let people know it is out there! This money will help buy ad space and get the word out, so this music can be heard and enjoyed by all!
  • $1000 contingency fund is needed as this is the first album I have produced and don't want to be surprised with unforeseen costs without the ability to cover them. 

Be sure to SELECT your PERK:

There are some great perks to contributing to this project! Everything from mp3 downloads to physical copies of the album, some even signed by yours truly! If you know me, you know I also love to craft and make food. (check out my instagram!)  I included some baked goods, knit booties and even a full on dinner party! 
If you have any perks you would like to see, please let me know!

If unable to fully fund this project, I will use what is raised to help me get along in this journey to a completed album, even if it means a later release date as the balance of funds are raised by myself. 
On the flip side, if there is a surplus (LET'S HOPE!), I have ideas and plans to make other, follow up albums to create a whole collection of children's music with the same mission of great, fun, music for kids. My ideas span from music for nap time, to playtime melodies, to songs from around the world etc. etc. etc.! 

The Impact

We all know children and have them in our lives. Be they our own children, grandchildren, nieces, nephews, or friend's children we want the best for them and give them every opportunity to be the best they can be. This album is for them! To boost brain power, improve memory, aid in language skills, and foster creativity!


My Challenges

This is the first album I have ever done, but to me, that is an exciting beginning! I knew there would be challenges as I learn everything that is involved in self producing an album, but I thrive on challenging myself in learning and discovering. I have been working on this album for two years already, composing and arranging the music and little by little recording and getting things ready. Now that I am nearly finished with that part, I have taken a look at the "mountain" ahead of me and realized that I will need help to make this happen in a timely manner! I am passionate about this album and believe in the children and realize their grand future possibilities! I am only excited to see what the future brings!


Other Ways You Can Help

I realize that you might not be able to help financially, but you can share this with your friends, and help get the word out for this awesome project! Send emails, tweet, share on Facebook, or even carrier pigeon if it suits you! 

There are share tools at the top of the page. Follow along and cheer as we go on this journey together!

story:
About Fara 

Fara Palmer is a vocalist, songwriter and performing artist originating from Cree, Saulteaux, Secwepemc, and Canadian territories. Fara has recorded 3 multi-award winning POP/R&B albums over the last 16 years. During a bunch of those years,  Fara decided to take time off of her music career to start a career in raising a family. She now has 5 sacred daughters who are following in their mothers musical footsteps with their own group called SisterClan.

Anyone who has children knows how much work it is raising them. Fara happily chose to put family first and become a full time mother, but now is aware that the stars have aligned in a way that announces 'it is a good time to return to music'! 

Fara's passion is heart inspired, awareness and empowerment raising songwriting. She loves to connect with her audience and hopes her songs act as catalysts for positive change. 

'When I hear Fara perform I can feel her spirit rise through the space, she has an amazing talent and her beauty and humbling soul shines though her music' ~Sage Soltero, a sacred female fan

'She is a shining example of what can be achieved through hard work, determination, talent and goodwill' ~ Phil Fontaine, Former National Chief

'An Electrifying Talent' ~Weekend Outlook


Help Fara Record A New Album!

It's been 7 years since Fara's last 'return to music' and album 'Phoenix' was released. One and a half years after Phoenix was released, she got pregnant with her fifth and final child. Well now, Fara's baby making days are done and she plans on making a new cd and picking up musically where she left off! This fundraiser will really help her to achieve those goals.   :)

The Album: 

  • 10-12 songs. All original music and lyrics. 
  • 4 of Fara's songs have already been recorded as demo's (non mastered, unproduced recordings). 2 of the demo's were recorded in Chilliwack at Beat Productions with her long time engineer and co-producer Peter Kilgour, 1 was recorded in Toronto with Producer and Engineer Christian Hurst and features poetrapper Belladonna, and 1 in Vancouver with songwriters Dave Pickell and Jeff Dawson (out of hitmaking producer Dane Deviller's Studios). Fara used her own limited amount of money to get herself this far and its a great start! One of the songs can be heard in Fara's campaign video (above).
  • Fara plans on collaborating with a few local artists and producers she admires
  • Fara plans on including local talent to cameo on her album. For example: singers, rappers, musicians (for that live sound vibe).
Your contributions will cover the producers fees, recording, mixing, mastering and other related costs. The monetary goal is $11,000. and it is a barebones budget that will 'just' cover the costs involved.
Fara knows sound technology has allowed DIY artistry to flourish. As such, Fara plans on working with and getting the best deals she can from other DIY artists while focusing on preserving sound quality. Where several years ago an $11,000 dollar album would have been unheard of, today it is not.

If Fara exceeds her fundraising goal, all extra funding will be poured into delivering the best quality album to you, the fans and backers, and into promotional costs and merch (t-shirts, photos, posters etc). 

The Impact

Dreams never die and Fara's dream to write, record and to sing still burns deeply in her heart. If you've never heard or seen her sing, head over to her Official Website or Fara's YouTube channel. We guarantee once you get to know her, listen to her voice and songs you'll be excited to participate in Fara's upcoming cd project by contributing to this campaign. The power of unity makes miracles happen!

Other Ways You Can Help

Apart from donating money, there are many other valuable ways you can help Fara's fundraiser to succeed! 


1) Spread the word! 

Share, tweet, instagram, Facebook, hashtag, email, phone call, snapchat, (you get the idea). Use your social networks, your friends social networks and good ole fashioned word of mouth to spread the news about Fara's 33 day Cd Fundraiser.

2) Create a FB event inviting all your friends to visit Fara's Indiegogo campaign. Tell them why you think they should check it out!

3) Pray, send positive vibes and great energy to this campaign. Mind and heart power is where miracles begin <3

Ok, that's good. I hope i haven't left anything important out. I want to thank you from my heart for your support, for taking time out of your life to be a part of mine! I hope all your dreams come true also and cannot wait to share with you the songs i've been writing and dreaming of singing!! 

One Love,
Fara Palmer <3 xox

4 of Fara's songs have already been recorded as demo's (non mastered, unproduced recordings). 2 of the demo's were recorded in Chilliwack at Beat Productions with her long time engineer and co-producer Peter Kilgour, 1 was recorded in Toronto with Producer and Engineer Christian Hurst and features poetrapper Belladonna, and 1 in Vancouver with songwriters Dave Pickell and Jeff Dawson (out of hitmaking producer Dane Deviller's Studios). Fara used her own limited amount of money to get herself this far and its a great start! One of the songs can be heard in Fara's campaign video (above).
Fara plans on collaborating with a few local artists and producers she admires
Fara plans on including local talent to cameo on her album. For example: singers, rappers, musicians (for that live sound vibe).

Your contributions will cover the producers fees, recording, mixing, mastering and other related costs. The monetary goal is $11,000. and it is a barebones budget that will 'just' cover the costs involved.
Fara knows sound technology has allowed DIY artistry to flourish. As such, Fara plans on working with and getting the best deals she can from other DIY artists while focusing on preserving sound quality. Where several years ago an $11,000 dollar album would have been unheard of, today it is not.
If Fara exceeds her fundraising goal, all extra funding will be poured into delivering the best quality album to you, the fans and backers, and into promotional costs and merch (t-shirts, photos, posters etc). 

The Impact

Dreams never die and Fara's dream to write, record and to sing still burns deeply in her heart. If you've never heard or seen her sing, head over to her Official Website or Fara's YouTube channel. We guarantee once you get to know her, listen to her voice and songs you'll be excited to participate in Fara's upcoming cd project by contributing to this campaign. The power of unity makes miracles happen!

Other Ways You Can Help
Apart from donating money, there are many other valuable ways you can help Fara's fundraiser to succeed! 
1) Spread the word! 
Share, tweet, instagram, Facebook, hashtag, email, phone call, snapchat, (you get the idea). Use your social networks, your friends social networks and good ole fashioned word of mouth to spread the news about Fara's 33 day Cd Fundraiser.2) Create a FB event inviting all your friends to visit Fara's Indiegogo campaign. Tell them why you think they should check it out!3) Pray, send positive vibes and great energy to this campaign. Mind and heart power is where miracles begin <3Ok, that's good. I hope i haven't left anything important out. I want to thank you from my heart for your support, for taking time out of your life to be a part of mine! I hope all your dreams come true also and cannot wait to share with you the songs i've been writing and dreaming of singing!! One Love,Fara Palmer <3 xox

story:
HAS THIS EVER HAPPENED TO YOU?


You're tired of the direction your life is taking, and begin wondering: what if one day my work becomes irrelevant, or I turn such to it? What would my legacy to society be?

This thought crossed my mind for a couple of years until the afternoon of July 15, 2011, wandering through France, when I found myself in front of the storefront of a luthier shop.


An Eureka moment; I then knew that I wanted to leave everything to devote myself to this noble trade. My background in physical therapy + design & architecture would come in handy, and coming from a line of a few generations of craftsmen, this could work out nicely.



Hi. I'm Dennis. Entrepreneur, eternal student, polyglot.


Artisan luthier.



BIRTH


During the study of the trade, I discovered gypsy jazz ("manouche"), which brought my passion for jazz with gypsy music and classical training together.

2 years later, I decided to take a huge financial risk and left for France to investigate the mythical guitar Selmer/Maccaferri, also known as "manouche guitar," and get rid of any doubts by going directly to the most reliable source today, during a two-month stay.

(I had to teach myself French in less than a year for this.)


I was greeted, in the heart of 'Quartier de l'Opera', by François Charle, known scholar in this instrument, who showed me in his premises at the traditional Véro-Dodat gallery, original specimens of Selmer/Maccaferri-style guitars and details about their origin and construction, from design to assembly.

From there I traveled through France southward from Paris to Avignon and its surroundings, looking for luthiers, instruments, musicians, gypsies, stories.




THE BEGINNING


Upon my return, after working a stint as a systems administrator, I risked everything to *live* in a small workshop. It was hard; I had switched countries recently. I starved. I was rather alone.

(My first, horrible pad upon first embarking into this quest)

Later, I began giving private language lessons and acting in commercials, while moonlighting in instrument repair. While I made some money to get by, the project never completely took off, and the only way to save it was, paradoxically, to postpone it in favour of other profitable activities.

Since I spent my "prime working age" (24-34) outside the country, I have no credit records, so access to banking is, for me, impossible. The initial capital, if not gathered as a whole, vanishes before you can tell. Operating costs are hungry and unforgiving. It's all or nothing.



THE CHALLENGE


This is where I turn to crowdfunding, by people, for people. I've seen how it can make a difference. With your cooperation, rewarded in services and tangible items if you want, we can gather the critical capital, once and for all, for the project to finally make the leap, and bring carefully built musical instruments to life.



The kind your children will one day inherit.


Like back in the day. Today.



THE PLAN


There is no great feat without a plan, and after several late nights (and liters of coffee), the proposed action plan can be summarized as follows:


  • What I already have: tools, plans, templates, molds and jigs to make this happen. Infrastructure is covered, I've found a bigger, better shop space.
  • I need to initially raise 2000 dollars in local currency; these will go into paying at least 4 months of rent in advance, plus basic services, food, and an initial stock of tonewood, adhesives and accessories. I'm practically going to lock myself up for a while to build instruments. Just make sure to slide me some biscuits under the door, and I'll be fine.
  • The contributions will be rewarded with services or tangible items of choice related to the trade and to musicians, both amateur and professional; these range from hardwood picks to instruments.
  • If we fail to collect 100% of the initial goal, I will look into other ways of supporting the operation, trying not to postpone the project; rewards for individual contributions will not be sacrificed: you took the time and had the willingness to help, and you can't imagine how much that means to me.
  • I want to bring back quality to the construction of instruments, and the musician-craftsman as patient-doctor relationship.
  • I also wish to show that you can combine a business vision with a different way of life, and to inspire and help those who are at the crossroads.


Even non-monetary contributions are helpful; the dissemination of the project, either through social networks or by telling your friends, colleagues or partners, can help amplify the message, and eventually achieve the goal together; one "share", a retweet, a "reblog" or mention on your favorite social media platform can help this go a long way!



Thank you so much for reading this.

Now, do you think?

story:
Hey Folks,

Scott, James, Steve, Dale and Sammy here. In the midst of a life-long dream, we've halted everything to get our year-long project to a reality. As this is an independent project, we've recorded the audio and instrumentation from everywhere we can think of from James' van to Steve's bathroom. But, we're still in need of mixing and mastering from a second, third and even fourth set of ears. Distribution will come in last, placing each set of songs onto a disc and into your hands for listening.

Southbound, one exclusive track from the upcoming album is available for listen here. 

We're lucky to have a lot of help with promoting it, but getting the album from dream to fruition is where you come in.

We're happy to invite you to be a part of making our dream a reality. As they say, it's not about the destination - it's about the journey. The video we have shows what we do and the fun that we have... the journey has been and continues to be what we look forward to every single day.

We've collaborated to write a collection of songs that we're incredibly proud of. And we're uniquely lucky to have the talent of Lonesome River Band's Sammy Shelor, who has played with everyone from Alan Jackson to Steve Martin on electric guitar and banjo. Although the songs are coming to life (you can hear rough mixes in the video), they still need a great deal of professional help and production.

You may wonder what we sound like.  Big Virginia Sky is a bluegrass-inspired Americana/Folk group that writes in a very unique style - influenced by both the Punch Brothers and Nickel Creek. 


The rough tracks are featured partially in the video above and the song list includes "Big Virginia Sky", which is the song that inspired the name for the band. It's based on the first few times that we played together and seemed fitting to describe our vision. We have also collaborated with Logan Vath to write "Whiskey and Long Talks", which is indescribably personal and soulful.



Although we're all from different backgrounds, we all have played with some amazing musicians. James frequently plays with Katie Rogers in Nashville, TN. Scott has played with Glen Phillips of Toad the Wet Sprocket and award-winning bassist Edgar Meyer. Sammy is frequently featured both on television and radio programs alike and plays with multiple professional artists such as Alan Jackson and Steve Martin. Both Dale and Steve have done their share of impressive playing with everyone from traditional Indian music to off-the-wall Jazz improv. We truly have a group of very talented and humble artists.

Over the last two years, we've been collaborating on these songs, writing all instrumental parts individually for our instruments and leaning on each other for lyrics.

You might wonder what we've done to pursue this dream. 


The audio is finished and was recorded on our own dime with a lot of Steve's expertise and equipment. We're already contacting professionals in Nashville, TN and Western Virginia to arrange the perfect studio services where we can have all of these tracks made into a finished album that we can be proud of.

We couldn’t feel more blessed to have formed this group and been as successful as we have.

Why are we doing this?

Unfortunately, because we are all working as hard as we are to make our day-to-day lives financially possible, we have been unable to find a way to finance such a project on our own and with each member receiving his fair share. After the careful consideration and encouragement from friends, fans, and family, we've decided to take a step outside of the box and start a campaign to make our dream a reality.

We're ready to put the finishing touch on the tracks we've carefully crafted, pay for promoting the album and us for the first time since we formed, order and distribute the album, and the most important part - watch it bring warmth to your ears. We know it isn't easy to ask for help and during this tender time we reach out to you, asking to lend us a hand and a listen.

We understand that not everyone is the same, and we have chosen to provide a variety of levels of support with matching rewards so you may contribute in a way that is comfortable to you. We hope that you'll find it in your heart to branch out and give us a chance.

Thank you for listening,

BVS
bigvirginiasky.com
